loans.name: Rony

texts.en:
Rony is a 35-year-old married man and father of three dependent children. He has been involved in his home painting occupation for the past six years. He works hard along with his wife to provide the family income and to pay for their children's schooling. He offers painting services for home projects through the entrepreneurs who ask for his work. 

Today, Rony is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy new painting tools and additional paint supplies to satisfy his business needs and meet his customers’ requirements.

loans.use: To buy new painting tools and additional paints supplies

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20203980026) is a 30-year-old woman who lives in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. H. is the leader of a 5-member L. group sponsored by SEDA. Although each member of the group receives an individual L., they are all responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Thượng Thôn nhóm 05 (5).


H. is married and has 4 school-aged children. To making a living, H. providing repair services to local community members. H. has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. is requesting a L. from SEDA for the first time. She isr equesting a L. of 5.152.000 VND to purchase equipment to improve the business. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1. Đào Thị T. (20203980027) is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her service-based business.


2. Nguyễn Thị C. (20203980028) is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her specialized retail store.


3. Nguyễn Thị L. (20203980029) is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support livestock business.


4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20203980030) is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her livestock business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Nguyễn Thị (20203980026) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Thượng Thôn nhóm 05 (5).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ sửa chữa cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND. H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.   Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1. Đào Thị T. (20203980027) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2. Nguyễn Thị C. (20203980028) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3. Nguyễn Thị L. (20203980029) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20203980030) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Mmodenmmo Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Abena is a 55-year-old woman who describes herself as hard-working.  She is married and has 8 children ranging in age from 14 to 35 years old.  Abena’s husband is a farmer.   Abena would like to provide quality education for her two youngest children.  

For the past 25 years, Abena has operated a food retail business selling 'kenkey'.  'Kenkey' is a maize-based dough ball that is usually eaten with pepper sauce and fish.  Abena will use the loan to buy more maize to prepare 'kenkey'.  She hopes to expand her business by supplying 'kenkey' to stores in towns such as Kumawu and Abofanso.  

Abena is currently the leader of the group named "Mmodenmmo", which means “hard-working” in Twi, the language most commonly spoken in Ghana.  There are 10 members in this group.   The other members in the group also operate retail businesses selling items such as fresh tomatoes, yams, onions, 'kenkey', rice and stew.  The members in the group live in the same area and trust each other. They plan to use the loan to buy various inventory to grow their business to enable them to better support their families.

loans.use: To purchase maize, fish, and vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Women United Group

texts.en:
Miatta K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Women United. She is 48 years old, married and has six children who range from 13 to 26 years old. She also cares for one sibling. All of her children are attending school.

For 25 years, she has been selling petroleum products (gas) in Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She started her business with 10,000 Liberian dollars and now has 70,000 Liberian dollars as working capital.

She plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more petroleum products (gas).

She hopes to expand her business and to make more profit to be able to continue supporting her family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Madam T. is inset at the lower right.

loans.use: To buy more petroleum products (gas)

loans.name: Bourn

texts.en: Bourn K., 33, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She is employed as a garment factory worker for an income of about $2 per day. Her husband is a farmer and tuk-tuk driver (a motorcycle with a passenger trailer), earning an income of around $3 per day.  K. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a trailer to attach to their mechanical plow. By doing so, they will be able to transport fertilizer and other materials to their rice field. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a trailer to attach to their mechanical plow

loans.name: María Yesenia

texts.es:
María Yesenia tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Olmos, el distrito con la mayor extensión geográfica de la región, está conformado por un pueblo central y varios caserío que distan mucho uno del otro, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de alquiler de cabinas de internet (café internet) desde hace mas de dos años, adicionalmente brinda otros servicios asociados como tipeos, impresiones y copias. El negocio es bastante frecuentado por los jóvenes y estudiantes de la zona que siempre acuden a buscar información para realizar sus trabajos escolares. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en solventar sus gastos personales y en apoyar a sus padres en el sostenimiento de su familia.

María desea brindar mantenimiento a sus máquinas para que estas puedan seguir funcionando de modo correcto, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme  Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer responsable y que trata de ayudar a sus padres en el sostenimiento y cuidado de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es abrir otras cabinas de internet en su distrito.
texts.en:
María Yesenia is 33 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the district of Olmos, which is the largest in the region in terms of geography. The district consists of a central town and several villages that are distant from one another. It is situated in the province of Lambayeque and located an hour and 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

María has been managing an Internet café for more than two years. She also provides other services such as typing, printing, and copying. Her business is frequented by young people and students in the area who are always looking for information to complete their homework. The income she earns from this business is used to cover her personal expenses and help her parents with supporting their family.

María wants to provide maintenance for her machines so that they continue to function properly. In order to do this, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

María is a very responsible woman who tries to help her parents with supporting and caring for their family. Her greatest wish is to open another Internet café in her district.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for computer maintenance

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a divorced woman with three children: two adults and one still attending school. She has been selling onions, for the last five years, at the market to retail shops and also to wholesale shops. With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase ten bags of onions. She faces the major challenge of transportation and seasonality. Christine aims to buy twenty bags of onions in future to generate more profit. She decided to work with Yehu so as to access loans and expand her business. She lives at a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To purchase ten bags of onions.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel A. is from the village of Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 38 years old. Roel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Roel owns & operates a business venture making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Roel has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Roel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Roel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Roel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Roel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture.

location.town: Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis O

loans.name: Halou

texts.en: Mrs. Halou P. sells charcoal out of her home, located in the Agoe neighborhood of Lomé, Togo. She has requested her first loan from WAGES in the amount of 400,000 CFA. Mrs. P. is 34 years old and a widow. She has three children. Since 2003 she has been selling and distributing charcoal from her home. With her 400,000 CFA loan, Madame P. plans to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia B. is from the village of Rizal. She is 40 years old. Delia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2007, Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Delia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Delia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate  translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie B. is from the village of Bitibut Sapang, Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old. Margie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Margie owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling biscuits, candies, shampoo, soap & toothpaste, eggs, etc. in the local community. Margie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Margie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Margie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Margie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en: Marie Claire, a hardworking 45-year-old mother, has seven children between the ages of 3 and 26, one of whom is married, while the rest are in school.  Marie Claire's husband is a plumber and he works hand in hand with her to raise their children.  Marie Claire sells meat, and with this loan she will buy more meat to sell, intending to expand her business to make more profits.  Her dream is to support her children up to university level.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Milton Ruben

texts.es:
Milton Ruben G. D. tiene 23 anos. Es soltero y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 1 nina, Melissa, de 2 meses. 
 
Milton es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, frejol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total. 

A Milton trabaja en la finca de sus padres sembrando maíz y arroz desde hace 8 anos. Las fertilizantes y los insumos compra en las tiendas agrícolas y vende sus productos en cualquier comercial. 
Solicita el credito para invertir en la siembra de maíz y comprar los fertilizantes. Con el apoyo del credito le ayudaria económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es comprar una finca, un carro, y tener una vida economica mas suave. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar el indor fútbol y el volley.
texts.en: Milton is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents in Cantón de Ventanas, province of Los Rios. He has a 2-month-old baby daughter, Melissa. Milton is a member of the Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) community bank, which is located 25 kilometers from Cantón de Ventanas. It is a community that makes a living in short-cycle crops (corn, rice, soya, beans, cocoa). There are 14 member overall in his community bank. Milton has been working on his parents' farm harvesting corn and rice for the past eight months. Her purchases fertilizers and other planting materials from agriculture stores and sells his products at various commercial centers. He is requesting the loan to invest in planting corn and purchasing fertilizers. The loan will help him financially to meet his necessities. His dream is to buy a farm, a car and have a smoother life financially. He enjoys playing indoor soccer and volleyball in his free time.

loans.use: Invest in planting corn and buying fertilizers

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en: Aggrey, age 47, is a married man with four children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a semi permanent house. He says that he started as a small scale farmer. He dreams of building a permanent house for comfortable living. He also wants to expand his plantations and open a store for his output. Aggrey wants a loan to buy Irish potatoes and millet seeds for planting and reselling.

loans.use: To buy Irish potatoes and millet seeds for planting and reselling

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi is a widowed woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food stall, cooking rice and beans for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mesaidi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy winter season, it becomes difficult to sell food in an open market. She hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bags of beans and wheat flour to cook for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase bags of beans and wheat flour to cook for sale

loans.name: Arcoiris De Huitel Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama ARCOIRIS DE HUITEL, porque ellas consideran que los arcoiris son de buena suerte y tambien porque un arcoiris no tiene un principio ni un fin y a si consideran ellas su negocio pero sobre todo su amistad. Este grupo está ubicado en la Ciudad de Tula de Allende Hidalgo. La sra Maria Margarita P. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 55 años, estudió hasta tercero de primaria, tiene cuatro hijos los cuales ya estan casados. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas echas a mano y en comal, negocio que tiene ya hace ocho años de atenderlo, la conoce la comunidad y es por eso que vende muy bien por la a tención y la amabilidad con la que la señora  las atiende. Ella quiere este credito para la compra de maiz para que asi pueda tener mejor calidad en sus tortillas, asi como una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Arcoiris de Huitel' (Huitel Rainbow) because its members believe that rainbows bring good luck and also because a rainbow has no beginning and no end and that is how they think of their businesses and, above all, their friendship.

This group is located in the city of Tula de Allende Hidalgo.  Mrs Maria Margarita P. is the group's president.  She is 55 years old and studied up to the third year of elementary school.  She has four children who are already married.  Maria sells hand-made tortillas which she cooks in a 'comal' (a flat earthenware pan).  She has had this business for eight years.  Maria is known in the community and for this reason her tortillas sell very well.  She serves her customers with attention and kindness.  She would like this loan to buy corn so that she can make better quality tortillas and also enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy corn to make tortillas

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy has been practicing mixed farming for four years in the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. Her farm produces tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes and milk which are sold to the local market. Farming is her main source of income.

She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo of 40,000 KES in order to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of her family. She hopes to expand her farm in the future by acquiring more dairy cows.

Mercy is 28 years-old and married with one child age 2½ years-old.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mayis

texts.en: Mayis S. is engaged in stone cutting business. After mastering that trade Mayis has opened his own workshop in his family house. His two brothers help Mayis in growing business. Mayis is married and has a little child who was born with serious disabilities and needs constant medical attention. Mayis receives orders for kitchen furniture, stair steps, balusters, window sills etc. To better his production, Mayis would like to purchase a special stone cutting machine, as well as raw materials.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Buunisa

texts.en:
Buunisa K. is an attentive mother of a tightly-knit family. She has two sons. Her husband works as a salesman at the local car market and does everything he can to cover his family’s expenses.

In 1992, in order to find an additional means of subsistence for her family, Buunisa with her husband started their cattle-breeding business. They worked hard and managed to enlarge the number of milch cows at their farm and raise milk sales. Buunisa is a very exacting stockkeeper who follows all medical procedures with her cattle to avoid animal diseases.

Now, Buunisa is applying for a loan of 120,000 KGS to broaden her business and develop her farm. The loan will allow her to buy milch cows and increase her milk sales. In the future, Buunisa dreams of maintaining a big farm with a large number of cattle.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners:

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable segment of Kyrgyzstan’s population. It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in the country. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services to rural and urban areas that leads to increased employment and meets the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase milch cows

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto, tiene 28 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Alberto se dedica a confección de artesanía, él tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio y reparte su productos a los centro comerciales, tiendas y a personas que se dedica a la venta de artesanía. Alberto requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como lana, pieles, arcillas, plata y muchas cosas más. 

 Alberto pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en: Alberto is 28 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  He makes handicrafts.  He has a small workshop in his home, and distributes his products in shopping malls, shops, and to people who sell handicrafts.  Alberto requires the loan to buy more materials, such as wool, leather, clay, silver and many other things.  Alberto belongs to the communal bank "Caminemos Juntas" (We Will Together) of the UMF Arariwa Association, in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To buy materials such as wool, leather, clay, silver and many more things

loans.name: Rey Antonio

texts.es: El  Sr G.  labora como fontanero es soltero tiene  tres persona a su cargo, es el primer crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que  brinda esta institución con  este  desembolso para realizar  compra de  materiales  de construcción bloque, cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín, estribo, alambre y pago de mano de obra para hacer un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en: Sr. G. works as a plumber.  He is single and has three people under his care.  This is the first loan he has received from CEPRODEL.  He is grateful for the support that CEPRODEL has provided so that he can buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, sand, iron, gravel, brackets, and wire.  Rey Antonio will also pay for labor in order to build a room in his home.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials & pay for labor to build a room in his home

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en:
One famous quote says, “If you fail to plan, you plan to fail”.  Renilda F., or Taring as she is called by her friends, makes sure she plans well so as to have a good future ahead of her. Still single at 26 years of age, Taring runs her own business as she receives continuous entrepreneurial training from CCT as a community partner. Taring finished high school and presently resides in Caloocan City.

Taring owns a sari-sari (variety) store near her home. On a daily basis, she competes with other sari-sari stores in the community and makes sure her regular customers will keep buying goods from her while she continues attracting other neighbors to buy from her store. Taring has been in this business for five years now. She earns around 10,700 PHP a month.

To help her grow her business, Taring needs a loan amount of 10,000 PHP.  She will use this loan to purchase quality products which her customers are looking for. She makes sure that her store shelves will not lack any essential product which her neighbors need, and so she plans to buy more canned goods, soft drinks, and other grocery items. Taring believes that this loan will raise her sari-sari store above her competitors.

Competition is something one cannot and should not avoid. Making the most out of it, Taring is using competition to push her business to grow. This is important for her as she strives to reach her dream of having a good, well-provided for family of her own someday.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase quality grocery items for her store

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 48 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Ceferina de 47 años, quien lo apoya en la chacra y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo al que se dedica Pedro, es la siembra de papa, choclo, zanahoria, maíz y arvejas, los cuales después de cosecharlos, vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de tarma, en donde ya tiene varios clientes, que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todo al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 32 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus chacras, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado, puesto que no quiere que los químicos le causen una enfermedad. En adelante, espera seguir vendiendo sus productos, pero para mejorar sus ganancias desea comprarse un auto, con el cual él mismo pueda transportar sus cultivos. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con los  dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará insecticidas, ya que tiene que fumigar sus siembras.
texts.en:
Pedro, aged 48, is a very cheerful and hard-working family father. He lives in his own house with his wife Ceferina, aged 47, who helps him on his farm. His greatest wish is to improve their quality of life.

Pedro grows potatoes, corn, carrots, maize and peas, which he sells after harvesting at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. There he has many customers who know the quality of his products and are ready to wait until he sells his crop. What Pedro most likes about his work is sowing his field and making it fertile and productive. He has been in this activity for 32 years. The hardest part of his work is to fumigate his farm; he must be very careful so as not to become sick from the chemicals. In future he expects to continue selling his products, but to boost his earnings he wants to buy a car for the transportation of his crop.

This is his tenth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. He is aware that he must pay the installments on schedule, if he wants to have access to more loans in future. Within his communal bank he is a very responsible member and is concerned with the well-being of his group. He will use the 2,500 nuevos soles to buy insecticide, as he has to fumigate his crop.

loans.use: To buy insecticide

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 47 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Wakoro, préfecture de Dioïla ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de l’arachide, de la volaille et du bois de chauffe.                                                                                                                       
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur premier prêt .RAMATOU C. compte acheter beaucoup de condiments au niveau du marché de Nangola avec les revendeurs. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement au village de Wakoro, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The women of the group Danaya are all married and average 47 years of age and five children living in traditional extended families in the village of Wakoro, prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in condiments, peanuts, poultry, and firewood. The group members are now on their first loan.

Ms. Ramatou C. intends to use her loan to buy a lot of condiments from retailers at the Nangola market. She makes her sales every day, accepting cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men. 

Ramatou envisions making an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used to make the loan payments and to help pay for societal ceremonies. The rest of the profits will be reinvested in her condiments business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Marufjon

texts.en:
A. Marufjon is a very loving father devoted to the needs of his children, whom he adores. He works raising livestock and every morning leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. 

His desire is to improve the quality of his animals, but in order to do this he would need to purchase livestock of better breeds. Those animals are very costly; he needs 5000 Somoni and at the moment he does not have that much money, so he is requesting this loan. Marufjon hopes that you trust in his hard work and honesty.  

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas P., 27, is married and lives with her two young children in the Takeo province. She raises pigs and works as a farmer, making approximately $1.50 each day, and her husband works in construction. Her family is also supported by her husband’s $5 daily income. Meas P. is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike. This motorbike will help her to reduce her daily transportation costs.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike in order to reduce her daily transportation costs

loans.name: Neyda Narcisa

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Fe y Esperanza, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Neyda, tiene 49 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya mayores de edad y el menor de 17  años que estudian en colegio, tres de sus hijos aun viven en su casa. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
 
Ella se dedica a la limpieza de pinchaguas (pez pequeño con el que se elabora las sardinas), pero además en su casa tiene una pequeña granja en la cual cría pollos y gallinas criollas, nos cuenta que en temporadas tiene hasta cien pollos los cuales los cría de dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya están listos para la venta, después los pela y vende por libras a los conocidos que llegan hasta su casa o si no también entrega en tiendas de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días en sus actividades y lo hace con muchas ganas siempre pensando en el bien de su familia.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar la mayor cantidad de pollos, alimentos y medicinas para sus animalitos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 7 años y le gusta porque con los créditos se ha financiado mucho en momentos difíciles.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish, in Portoviejo Canton, we find a place known as "Los Arenales". Here the members of the communal bank "Fe y Esperanza" meet every two weeks. This area is known for its beautiful beaches, gastronomy and warmth of its people.

Here we meet Mrs. Neyda, age 49, who is in a common-law marriage and has four children.  Three of them are adults and her 17-year-old is in school.  Three of her children still live at home.  Her husband is a fisherman.

For a living she cleans "pinchaguas" fish (a small fish used to make sardines), and also raises chickens and creole hens on her small farm.  Sometimes she has up to 100 chickens that she raises in two or three months' time.  She then sells them by weight to acquaintances who come by or she delivers to stores around town.  She works every day and does it cheerfully because she is always thinking about her family's well-being.

She will use this new loan to buy more chickens, feed and animal medicines.  She has been in the communal bank for seven years and enjoys it because the loans have been very helpful to her in times of need.

Her dream is to open a grocery store.

loans.use: To buy chickens, feed and animal medicines.

loans.name: Silvia Eugenia

texts.es: La Señorita Silvia tiene la edad de 23 años es una joven muy trabajadora que ayuda a su familia con el negocio de venta de antenas para televisión, ella trabajo en una banca de emprendimiento y se compro un trípode y una tv pequeña, trabaja por horarios con sus hermanos menores quienes ambulas en la ceja por las tardes y noches, aparte ella esta estudiando en un instituto, tiene muchos deseos de superación quiere ser profesional y ayudar a su Mamá,  Invertirá el crédito en la compra de otro trípode y otra tv pequeña además realizara sus propios catálogos para comercializar mejor sus antenas, es una joven emprendedora con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y de su familia, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Silvia is 23 years old and she is a very hard working young woman who helps her family with her business, selling television antennas. She worked at a placement agency and she bought herself a tripod and a small television. She works on shifts with her younger siblings, alternating on the afternoons and the evenings. She is also studying at a school. She has many dreams of self-improvement. She wants to have a career and to help her mother. She will invest her loan in the purchase of another tripod and another small television. she will also make up her own catalogues to help her sell antennas. She is a young enterprising woman who wishes to improve the quality of her life and that of her family. She is thankful to the organization for the support they provided her.

loans.use: to purchase television antennas.

loans.name: Florisa

texts.es: Florisa, D. 56 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres junto a su querida hija Marilyn D. 22 años y su papá D. 82 años; en la localidad D. Picoy. Los sembríos D. Florisa son D. los mejores cuidados D. entre los agricultores D. la zona, ya que ella los cuida y trabaja con mucha paciencia y cariño, los productos que cosecha, son la papa y la arveja, los cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Tarma, ya que es ahí donD. mejores precios obtiene. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras, lleva 31 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus chacras. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras, para incrementar su producción. Además prepara hamburguesa y anticuchos los días domingos en la ciudad D. Tarma, donD. obtiene buenas ganancias. Pero como está trabajadora mujer no descansa, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la costura D. mandiles realizadas a base D. telas, el cual lo comercializa D. acuerdo a los pedidos que recibe D. parte D. los pobladores D. su localidad. Ahora está pesando sembrar en mayor cantidad, pero el alza que tuvo las semillas D. los productos agrícolas, la preocupa. Sin embargo espera obtener buenas ganancias. Florisa pertenece al banco comunal “Exaltación Santa Cruz” y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donD. espera su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Florisa, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. 2 bolsas D. semilla D. arveja D. la variedad “letrilla”, asimismo en linsumos como baldes D. aceite para la realización D. la comida que venD..
texts.en: Florisa is 56 and is a very simple and hard-working woman.  She lives in Picoy in a home that she inherited from her parents with her beloved daughter, Marilyn, 22, and her father, 82. Florisa’s fields are among the best cared for of all of the farmers of the area.  She cares for them and works with a lot of patience and care.  She grows potatoes and peas, which she sells at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  This is where she can obtain the best prices.  What she likes most about her job is sowing the land.  She has done this work for 31 years, and the most difficult part is fumigating the land.  With time, she hopes to buy more land and increase her production.  She also prepares hamburgers and kebabs on Sundays in the city of Tarma, where she makes good profits.  Since this hard-working woman doesn’t rest, in her free time she sews items maD. out of fabric, which she sells based on orders she receives from people in her town.  Now she plans to harvest large quantities, but the rise in seed prices worries her.  Nevertheless, she hopes to make good profits.  Florisa belongs to the communal bank, “Exaltación Santa Cruz,” and this is her 10th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, where she hopes for collaboration to finalize her plans.  On the other hand, she promises once more to make her payments on time, like in previous loans she has had.  She is also thankful to her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very united.  Florisa will invest the requested money in the purchase of 2 bags of pea seed of the “letrilla” variety and in supplies like buckets of cooking oil to make the food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds and cooking oil.

loans.name: Inass

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 22 years old, married and the mother of one child.

Inass has been a tailor since 2009. She makes and repairs women's, men's and children’s clothing.

She gained her experience from her mother and she has a good reputation and she is well known in her area.

She is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a generator, an air conditioner and a sewing machine. She is aiming to earn more profit so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator, an air conditioner, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Eriberto Antonio

texts.es:
Don Eriberto de oficio mecanico, labora a una empresa del estado. Casado, y con sus hijos independiente, su esposa labora en servivios domestico apoyandose mutuamente para lograr juntos las mejoras.
Eriberto ha tenido dificultades con su terreno ya que queda enbajada y que por recursos economicos no logro comprar otro terreno. Es por eso que logro levantar un muro para la retencion del agua y que no se siguiera devordando la tierra, el cual esta casi terminado gracias al apoyo economico que Afodenic ha dado en cuatro ciclos, siendo usados para las mejora de su vivienda.
Con este nuevo prestamo seguira levantando la pared del muro que quedo pendiente y que es de gran relevancia terminar, lo que comprara: cemento, piedra, arena, hirro, y dos camionada de tierra para rellenar su terreno, y poder dar mejor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Eriberto is a Mechanic; he works for a state firm.  He’s married and his children live independently.  His wife works as a domestic employee supporting each other to attain improvements together.

Eriberto has had some difficulties with his property because it’s located on a down slope and because of his limited economic resources was unable to buy a different lot.  He managed to build a retention wall to keep water from eroding away the land.  It’s almost finished thanks to economic help from Afodenic which has given him four cycles that were used for home improvements.

He will use this loan to continue the construction still to be completed of the wall which is very important to finish.  He will buy cement, stone, sand, iron rods and two truck loads of dirt to fill in the lot and provide more security for his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to paint the walls and install the tiles in her new house so that she can move in by the end of the summer.

loans.name: Ayda Merilin

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Ayda, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 1 hijo de  2 años y un bebé de 10 meses. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ganarse algo propio y poder comprar cosas necesarias para sus hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y bisutería, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  la mayor parte de sus ventas las  hace a base de pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Trabaja tres  días a la semana más que todo en las noches cuando su esposo llega del trabajo y puede quedarse con los niños, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada sábado. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Portoviejo  cada vez  que necesite. También cría pollos en su casa los mismos que entrega a comerciantes.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde del inicio y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó en su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es de su mamá.
texts.en:
The “María Inmaculada” (Mary Immaculate) communal bank meets every two weeks in La Sequita Parish in Montecristi, a canton that’s known as the birthplace of the “Viejo Luchador,” Eloy Alfaro, and for the famous straw hats that are admired both inside the country and abroad.

Ayda, 23, lives here.  She’s married and has a one-year-old son and a 10-month-old baby.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

She is a very good housewife who, in order to earn income of her own and be able to buy needed things for her children, sells all types of clothes and costume jewelry door to door.  Most of her sales are based on prior orders from her customers.  She works three days a week, mostly in the evening after her husband gets home so he can stay home and take care of the children.  She sells on credit and collects payment each Saturday.  She goes to Portoviejo to buy merchandise each time she needs to.  She also raises chickens at home that she sells to merchants.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like: pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because it was thanks to her first loan that she was able to start her business.

Her dream is to have a house of her own because she currently lives at is her mother's.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana de 34 años de edad, vive en con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Juana se dedica desde hace 4 años a la crianza y comercialización de aves de corral (gallinas, pavos y patos), su corral los tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo puede ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar sus necesidades personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento y una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga más clientes y así pueda tener mayores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Juana es una persona responsable y trabajadora que lo único que desea es que su negocio crezca para seguir ayudando a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Juana, 34, lives with her husband and children in her own house which has electricity and water and is located in Mórrope District that belongs to Lambayeque Department.  It’s a zone characterized by farming, cattle raising and tourism.

Juana has been raising barnyard fowl (chickens, turkeys and ducks) to sell for the last four years.  Her corral is in her back yard.  She feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural grains.  When they reach optimum growth she can sell them to her customers and use income obtained to meet her personal expenses.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to buy more animals and their respective feed and once they are fattened up she will sell them at the various markets in her area hoping to attract more customers to increase her income and have a better quality of life.  Juana is a responsible, hardworking person whose only wish is that her business grows to continue helping her family to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy more animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru:
Илхомджон трудолюбивый, честный и добрый человек. Он всегда помогает всем. Он женат и любящий отец 4 детей. Он занимается услугами перевозкой пассажиров на местном городе. Он старается, чтобы пассажирам было комфортно и удобно на дорогу. Он с утра рано выходит на дорогу, дома вернется поздно вечером  уставшим. Он хочет, чтобы его дети жили в хороших условиях жизни и поэтому так усердно работает. Илхомджон хотел бы получит кредит в размере 2000$ США для покупки автошин 5 шт. и капитальный ремонт своего автомобиля. Илхомджон хочет заранее благодарить вас за вашу помощь и поддержку.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Ilhomjon is a hard-working, honest and kind person.  He always helps everyone.  He is married and is a loving father of four children.  He is involved in providing passenger transportation in the local town.  He tries to make sure that passengers are comfortable on the road.  He goes to work early in the morning and returns home tired late in evening.  He wants his children to live in good living conditions and works this diligently for it.  Ilhomjon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of five tires and to make major repairs to his car.  Ilhomjon wants to thank you in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to purchase tires and to repair a car

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, de 58 años, se separó de su mujer hace 21 años, pero vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos a los cuales cuida y educa en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de La Merced (selva central peruana). El trabajo que le permitió darle el sustento económico a su familia es el trasporte público. Hace19 años que labora en la empresa de trasporte “Santa Rosa” cubriendo las rutas La Merced-Oxapampa, y según menciona le gusta mucho su trabajo, porque puede conocer nuevos lugares y diferentes personas, ya que a veces cubre las rutas a la ciudad de Pozuzo - La Merced; que es un lugar turístico y muy visitado. Aunque a veces le resulta un poco cansado, él no se rinde, pues según sus propias palabras “todo trabajo tiene su lado bueno y malo”. Por ello todas las mañanas, se levanta convencido que hoy, es un nuevo día. Asimismo obtiene un dinero extra en el alquiler de cuartos, donde tiene inquilinos muy puntuales que le pagan la renta. Ahora con el dinero que pudo ahorrar, piensa comprar un auto nuevo y así tener mayores ingresos que le permitan sacar adelante a sus hijos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de Capelo” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde está segura que podrá salir adelante con la ayuda de su banco comunal, pues le enseñan a proyectarse y ahorrar. Por ello promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Gerardo de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en completar el dinero faltante para la compra de un nuevo auto, con el que pueda trabajar.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 58 years old, separated from his wife 21 years ago, but lives with his 3 children and takes care and counsels them in his own home, in the city of La Merced (Peruvian central jungle). The work, which allows him to support his family financially, is public transport. He has worked the Santa Rosa transport covering the route La Merced-Oxapampa and he goes on to tell us that he likes his work because he gets to know new places and meet different people. Sometimes he covers the routes in the city of Pozuzu-La Merced, which is a much visited tourist area.

Although sometimes he is very tired, he never gives up because in his own words, “all work has its good side and its bad side.” So every morning he gets up thinking that today is a new day.

He also gets extra income from renting rooms and his renters are punctual paying the rent. Now with the money he has saved, he wants to buy a new car in order to increase his earnings so he can provide his children a better opportunity in life.

He is a member of the "Pioneros de Capelo" Comunal Bank and this is his 9th loan with MFP, and he is sure he can go ahead with the help of his Comunal Bank, because they teach him to project forward and to save. He promises to make his payments on time. He will put the money he receives from the loan together with the money he has saved, to buy a new car, which he will use in his job.

loans.use: to complete the payment of the purchase of a car

loans.name: Laneh Kuru Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mohamed was born in Makeni city, about 56 years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple has seven children who are attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. Mohamed has been a businessman for 25 years now. He sells groundnuts (peanuts), rice, palm-oil, gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), etc. 

With the help of this loan, Mohamed and his group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mohamed will use his share of the loan, 1,000,000 Leone (SLL), to buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, rice, palm-oil, gari, etc. at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: San Luis Group

texts.es:
El comité San Luis es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y sacrificadas, por lo cual ya son reconocidas en la zona por su trabajo en pos del bienestar del grupo y de la comunidad. Ellas se unieron con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de ellas mismas y la de sus familiares que de ellas dependen, quieren que sus familias no tengan que pasar por todo los sacrificios que ellas enfrentaron.
Una de las miembros es la señora Agueda, ella hace tiempo que se dedica a la venta de verduras, trabajo mediante el cual ha podido salir adelante. Comenta que todos los días muy temprano se levanta para empezar su trabajo, dice que tiene una clientela bien formada, pues siempre compran de ella.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hortalizas de todo tipo, con lo cual tendrá mas variedad para atraer a mas clientes. Está contenta por la oportunidad que se le está ofreciendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Luis is located in the city of San Lorenzo.  They are a group of hard-working, sacrificing women who are known in their region for their work in pursuit of the well-being of their group and their community.  They meet with the goal of improving their quality of life and that of their families that depend on them.  They do not want their families to have to make all the sacrifices that they have had to make.  

One of the members is Señora Agueda.  For some time she has been selling vegetables which has allowed her to get ahead.  She says that she gets up very early everyday to start work.  She also says that she has a well-established clientele as they always buy from her.  She is requesting a loan to buy all types of vegetables so that she can offer a wider variety and attract more customers.  She is pleased about the opportunity that she is being offered.

loans.use: purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Fortunineza

texts.en: Fortunineza is single. She is 22 years of age and she located at Barangay Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She sells snacks in the community to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns about PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to use as additional capital for her store. She has been a member of GDMPC for 5 years.  In the future, Fortunineza hopes to build her own store.

loans.use: to use as additional capital for her store.

loans.name: Santos Marina

texts.es:
Santos es una madre D. familia D. 65 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su hija en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio D. luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito D. Chicama que pertenece al departamento D. La Libertad.  Esta zona es D. actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta D. alimentos desD. hace diez años, ella prepara los alimentos en su domicilio para luego ofrecerlos en venta al público en general. El negocio goza D. muy buena acogida por parte D. sus clientes debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus comida. Santos se vale D. los ingresos que recibe D. esta actividad para ayudar a su hija a solventar la economía D. su casa.

Santos desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. insumos y realizar algunos arreglos en su cocina D. modo que pueda ampliar su producción y aumentar sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Santos is a 65-year-old mother who lives together with her daughter in her own home.  The only service her house receives is electricity.  It is located in Chicama district, in La Libertad department.  People in this area farm and raise livestock.

Santos has been preparing and selling food for ten years.  She prepares the food in her home and then sells it to the general public.  Her business is very popular with her customers owing to the good flavor of her food.  Santos uses the income that she makes from this work to help her daughter cover their household expenses.

Santos would like to expand her business by purchasing supplies and making some changes in her kitchen so that she can expand her production and increase her sales.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy supplies and make some changes in her kitchen so that she can continue providing a good service

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children.  Lolita has a food shop that sells viands, like chicken & pork adobo, pancit bihon & afritada . She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands.  Lolita has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands

loans.name: Mirian Ester

texts.es:
La señora Mirian es de la ciudad de Encarnación, ella es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, los cuales ella ha criado con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo. Sus hijos son su razón de ser y el motivo por el cual ella se esfuerza cada día más.
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de primera necesidad, como ser aceite, harina, fideos y otros, los cuales trae desde la Argentina. Se dedica a esto hace ya 5 años, por lo que ya tiene una vasta experiencia en el negocio. Nos comenta que ella va a seguir luchando por sus hijos, pues su mayor sueño es que ellos se conviertan en personas de bien, que no sean utiles solo a si mismos, sino también a la sociedad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, fideos, aceite y demás productos de primera necesidad, lo cual tiene mucha salida y lo cual le ayuda a tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mirian’s from the city of Encarnación.  She’s a single mother of three children who she’s been raising with much sacrifice and effort.  Her children are her life’s purpose and this is why she strives even more each day.

She buys basic staple items like oil, flour, noodles and others that she brings from Argentina.  She’s been doing this for five years so has vast business experience.  She comments that she is going to continue to struggle for her children because her greatest wish is that they become upstanding citizens who are useful not just to themselves but to society as well.

She asks for the loan to buy flour, noodles, oil and other basic staple items which sell the most and that will help her earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 37 and married with four children. Three of her children attend school and one is too young. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. She owns a house without electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Fatuma has operated a retail shop for the past five years with the local villagers as her customers. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop. With the loan of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase more stock of rice, wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice, wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand's priority in life is to make his family financially stable. He cultivates a one-hectare ricefield he inherited from his parents. He only finished his high school education and did not find a stable job, so he just grows corn and sells it to earn his living.

Ferdinand is now 42 years old and blessed with a helpful wife and four children. His wife also raises hogs and future harvests, upon growth. Ferdinand decided to borrow PHP10,000 to buy herbicides and insecticides used in maintaining good growth of his crops.

With determination, hard work and God's guidance, Ferdinand hopes to see all his children earn a degree and pursue their own career someday.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru: Махмуд 54 летний мужчинка , который занимается дехканским хозяйством и откормом и продажей скота. Он живет в горном селении, где основной деятельностью населения является выращивание скота. У Махмуда сейчас на дому корова и 10 баранов. Получая кредиты в нашей организации, Махмуд значительно улучшил условия выращивания скота. Сейчас на рынке скот подешевел он хочет купить ещё две коровы, для откорма и продажи их в летний сезон. На снимке Махмуд в день выдачи с радостью выражает свою благодарность, что своевременно он сможет купить скот и достичь своих предпринимательских планов.
texts.en: Mahmud is a 54 year-old man, who is involved in dekhan farming and fattening up and selling livestock.  He lives in a mountainous location, where raising livestock is the residents' primary type of business.  Mahmud currently has a cow and ten sheep.  Receiving loans from our organization helped him to significantly improve the conditions for raising livestock.  Right now, livestock prices at the market have dropped, and Mahmud wants to buy two more cows for fattening up and subsequent sale in the summer.  On this photograph, Mahmud gladly expresses his gratitude on the day of loan disbursement for the ability to timely purchase livestock and achieve his entrepreneurial goals.

loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is from Magsaysay, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. 

Nora owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been in her business for 12 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Nora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Salma

texts.id:
Mrs. Salma, is a war survivor and dedicated entrepreneur who lives in the highlands of Aceh, Indonesia. Her father and brother were killed during the Acehnese civil war and the shop of her family was burnt down. The sales of Nazava Water Filters offer a great opportunity for her and her husband to increase their daily income. In just 6 months Salma sold over 300 water filters and provided over 1500 people with access to safe and affordable drinking water. 

Most of Salma’s customers are poor to lower income coffee farmers that earn less than 5 USD per day. Compared to buying water households safe 132 USD per year using Nazava water filters, which enable them to purify rain, well or river water and make it safe to drink. 
To respond to the high demand for Nazava water filters in her district, Salma would like to purchase bigger stock at reduced costs. She has already established a network of 5 sub-resellers that can directly sell the filters to their customers.

 “I currently have the cash for just 25 filters, that’s why I run out of stock easily, which is bad for my business. Transport costs are also relatively high when ordering just a few filters. “
With a 2000 USD loan, Ibu Salma can provide safe drinking water to 1000 people in just 1 month. The loan enables her to purchase around 200 water filters at a discounted price and with reduced transportation costs. This will provide more families with safe drinking water, increase their disposable income as well as the revenue for Salma.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger stock of water filters and increase the access to safe and affordable drinking water in her district.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enable her purchase more energy-saving charcoal stocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To be able to buy more auto spare parts and employ two more mechanics for her garage business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
In the mornings, Juan shine shoes at the plaza Avaroa(Avaroa square). it is located in the Sopocachi zone in the city of La Paz. He works alone and has two children: one that is independent and the other of school age. His wife is a retailer. To supplement his income, during the weekends Juan works as an employee at a milk distribution agency.

He lives in the north zone of Achachicala and rents his dwellings. It is the fourth time that he asks for a loan from the IMPRO agency. His credit history with our institution qualifies him as a client #1, meaning he has fulfill the payments of his previous loans in good faith. The amount that he asks for will be used to buy materials needed for his shoe shine business like: creams, dyes, small brushes, rags, and to repair his shoe shine bench.

His past credit history and work allows him to access this loan. He has experience in this business which in turn gives him the income to cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Juan por las mañanas lustra calzados en la plaza Avaroa ubicada en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz. El trabaja solo, tiene dos hijos uno que es independiente y el otro en edad escolar, su esposa es comerciante minorista. Para poder ayudarse en sus ingresos los fines de semana trabaja como empleado en una agencia de distribución de leche.

Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de norte de Achachicala y vive en alquiler (es decir que paga una renta mensual). Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito con IMPRO. Su historial en nuestra institución lo califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de material que necesita para su negocio de “lustra botas”, como ser cremas, tintas, escobillas, paños y refaccionar su banca de lustrador.

Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Working capital for his shoe shine business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is an artisan. She embroiders with patterns and colors that are characteristic of her region. She makes napkins, cushions, bedcovers, shawls, clothing typically worn by people of the area, and other such items. She has always done this type of work and it is how she helps her husband with the household expenses and education for their five children. She takes her merchandise to sell in the town of San Cristóbal de las Casas. Rosa is part of a loan group called Merced 4. With her loan she will buy thread and fabrics at wholesale price so she can increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

ROSA es artesana borda con figuras y colores que caracterizan a su región, hace servilletas, cojines, sobrecamas, chales, ropa típica, otros. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad apoyando de esta forma a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus cinco hijos. Su mercancía lo lleva a vender a ciudad de San Cristóbal de las casas. Forma parte del grupo llamado Merced 4. Con su préstamo comprara hilo y telas al por mayor incrementando así la producción.

loans.use: To buy thread and fabric at wholesale price

loans.name: Sambat

texts.en: Mrs. Sambat S., aged 51, sells a variety of grocery products and earns about $1 per day in income.  She and her husband have five children - one who is a laborer, one who is a motor-taxi driver, and three who are students.  Mrs. Sambat S. is requesting this loan in order to purchase a motorbike so that her husband can become a motor-taxi driver and earn about $2 per day to supplement the family income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to start a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en: Farogat sells men’s clothing in the Spitamen bazaar. She started borrowing in 2003, and has since then been both an active and a responsible client. In her sales, she is both accurate and accountable. Due to the quality of her products she can easily make more for the large number of clients she has every year. She would like to apply for a loan to vary the assortment of her goods, and attract new clients to satisfy their demands.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni has always worked hard. From the time she was little, she's been engaged in handcrafts type work and weaves beautiful sweaters, scarfs and gloves. This noble profession/craft which she learned from her beloved mother, will hopefully one day become a recognized and outstanding craftsmanship in the city of Juliaca. Now she has made this profession an important way of generating income for her family, and thus support the household expenses along with her husband, Juan, who works with a lot of determination and hard work as a bricklayer. Marleni, works daily from 9:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night, to create her beautiful items, and finally puts them on sale on Sundays (in the Sunday market in the city of Juliaca). This charming mother of three wishes to increase her production. This requires the purchase of a knitting machine in order to expedite her work. Your generous contribution will be very well spent in the hands of this talented mother.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marleni, siempre fue una mujer trabajadora, desde pequeña se dedica a la labor artesanal, teje hermosas y novedosas chompas, chalinas y guantes; este noble oficio lo aprendió y heredó de su querida madre, quien un día llegó a ser una reconocida y destacada artesana de la ciudad de Juliaca.Ahora ella ha hecho de este oficio una manera importante de generar ingresos económicos para su familia, y así apoyar con los gastos familiares a su esposo, Juan, quien trabaja con mucha voluntad y ahínco en su noble oficio de albañil.Marleni, realiza diariamente sus excelentes tejidos manuales desde las 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 10:00 de la noche, para finalmente ponerlos en venta los días domingos en el mercado dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca.El deseo de esta encantadora madre de tres niños es incrementar su producción, para esto requiere comprar una máquina de tejer con el fin de agilizar su trabajo. Tu generoso aporte será muy bien invertido en las manos de esta talentosa madre.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale materials of good quality to continue making her beautiful items. (Compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima para seguir elaborando sus bellas prendas.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his beauty and barber salon business.

loans.name: Zari

texts.es:
Zari is a member of the communal bank “Amistad y Paz” (friendship and peace); she lives in the San Martin region, in the province of Mariscal Caceres, in the district of Juanjui. Her business is located in her own home located at Jiron La Merced N 268; she has a little store where she sells candy and other edible products. She also sells cleaning products. Having a home business helps her share her time because she can be attending her business as well as doing her domestic chores. Her love towards her business was impulsed by her own mother. Ever since she was young she has been exposed to being dedicated to the business.

With the loan of 1,300 soles, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will start a business buying sacks of rice, sugar, boxes of milk, oil, dried fish, packets or noodles, eggs, cleaning supplies like detergent, soaps, brooms, and other things her clients may ask for.

At age 24 she now has 2 children and she is a very optimistic and hard working person who loves the business world. Her goal is to buy land so she can construct her own home and there install her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Zary es socia del banco comunal “Amistad y Paz”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situada en el Jirón La Merced Nº 268, tiene una bodega donde vende abarrotes en general, golosinas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario y artículos de limpieza y de aseo. El tener un negocio en su casa le permite compartir su tiempo con las tareas domésticas sin mayores dificultades. Su amor al negocio lo aprendió de su mamá, habiéndose desarrollado en ese ambiente lo que demuestra ser una joven con mucha visión para la pequeña empresa.
