Con el préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual pagará en 6 meses, implementará un negocio al comprar sacos de arroz y azúcar, cajas de leche, aceite y conservas de pescado, paquetes de fideos, huevos, productos de aseo personal y de limpieza para el hogar como detergente, jabones, escobas y otros que tienen mayor demanda entre sus clientes que acuden a comprar.

A sus 24 juveniles años y con 2 hijos es una persona muy optimista y trabajadora que le encanta el negocio. Su meta es comprar un terreno para construir su propia casa y ahí instalar el negocio.

loans.use: Buy grocery goods (rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Felicitas' Group

texts.es:
Felicitas, Rufina and Maribel belong to the Future communal bank, where they learned to be punctual and how to save.

Felicitas is married, 69 years old and has five children. She makes clothing typical of the region such as blouses and long skirts, which she sells at the local fair. She also runs a convenience store out of her home.

Rufina is married, 50 years old and has seven children, four of whom still live with her. She sells vegetables at the local market. On Sundays, she goes to the fairs in the region to purchase grains to sell at market.

Maribel is single and 24 years old. She travels to the regional fairs to purchase grains to sell at the Santa Clara market. She also sells natural medicines via catalogue. She also recently started breeding hamsters.

Felicitas, Rufina and Maribel needs loans of 1000 soles ($375), 1000 soles and 600 soles ($200), which they will use to purchase fabrics, milk, sugar, noodles, cookies, corn, grains and natural medicines.

Felicitas, Rufina and Maribel dream of seeing their children become successful, of expanding their businesses and having their own stores.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Felicitas, Rufina y Maribel pertenecen al Banco Comunal Futuro, en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser puntuales y a ahorrar.

Felicitas es casada, tiene 69 años y 5 hijos, Felicitas confecciona ropa típica D. la región como centros, blusas, fustanes, que los venD. en la feria D. Las Nazarenas. Además Felicitas tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Rufina es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con ella, Rufina venD. verduras en el mercado 12 D. abril. Además Rufina los días domingos viaja a las ferias donD. compra cereales y los venD. en el mercado Nery García.

Mientras que Maribel es soltera y tiene 24 años, Maribel viaja a las ferias donD. compra cereales y lo venD. en el mercado Santa Clara. Además Maribel venD. medicinas naturales por catálogos. Maribel recientemente comenzó a criar cuyes.

Felicitas, Rufina y Maribel necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 1000 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. telas, leche, azúcar, fideo, galletas, maíz, linaza, quinua y medicinas naturales.

Los sueños D. Felicitas, Rufina y Maribel son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un negocio más granD., un local propio y tener una granja D. cuyes.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, milk, sugar, noodles, cookies, corn, grains and natural medicines / Felicitas, Rufina y Maribel necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 1000 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas, leche, azúcar, fideo, galletas, maíz, linaza, quinua y medicinas naturales.

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Sean N. is 32 years old. She and her husband, Thong Vannak, are vegetable sellers in their home province of Kampong Cham. Their combined profits come out to only about US$3 per day. Their two children are both students. Their family hopes to be able to send them all the way through school instead of pulling them out eventually to work, as most poor families must. With their microloan, they want to invest in a large stock of vegetables which they can sell in bulk to market sellers in other districts.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción had a job as a teacher, but she liked sales and sold to people she knew after she retired, so she decided to work full time selling shoes from a catalog. This keeps her active and she gets to meet people every day. She has done well with this activity.

She is requesting a loan for US$300, which she plans to repay in four months, to invest in merchandise and increase the size of her business in order to sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Concepcion tenia un trabajo como maestra, pero le gustaban las ventas y vendia a sus conocidas despues la jubilaron, asi que decidio dedicarse por completo a la venta de zapatos por catalogo, ya que esto la mantiene activa y conoce gente a diario y le ha ido bien con esta actividad.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $ 300 que pagara en 4 meses para poder invertir en mercancia, agrandar su negocio y asi vender mas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Mrs. Seam K., 33, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. Since 2000 she has been making a living by selling bamboo shoots, and earns approximately $2.50/day in this business. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and makes up to $5/day. The couple has three young children.

Seam wishes to help her husband’s business and is seeking a loan of $1,000. She would like to use the loan to replace her husband’s old motorbike and purchase a trailer so that he can operate a larger taxi (a motorbike-pulled cart called a tuk-tuk, common as taxis in Phnom Penh) and earn more money.

loans.use: Seam would like to replace her husband's motorbike and purchase a trailer (for a tuk tuk).

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
Rossana C. lives in the San Roque neighborhood of the city of Carapeguá and has two children, one school aged and the other a 8 month old girl. She is an only child and lives with her mother.

Since she was very young she has been engaged in this activity and helped her mother selling handicrafts in the capital. Later she started her own business in a place strategically located close to the city market and sells the handicrafts at wholesale and retail to the mobile vendors in the area.

She also delivers her merchandise to important businesses in the capital. Thanks to her work, she could buy a car with which she could make her sales.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise (bedspreads, blankets, tablecloths, and sheets).

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra Rossana C. vive en el Barrio San Roque de la ciudad de Carapeguà tiene 2 hijos uno en edad escolar y otra niña de 8 meses de edad. Es hija ùnica y vive en compañía de su madre.

Ella desde muy joven se inicio en esta actividad y ayudaba a su madre en la venta de artesania por la capital, mas adelante montò su propio negocio en un lugar estratèjico en las cercanias del mercado de la Ciudad, se dedica a la venta por mayor y menor de artesania a los macateros (vendedor ambulante) de la zona. Tambien llevan mercaderias a negocios importantes de la capital. Gracias a su trabajo pudo comprarse un automòvil con la que realizar sus ventas.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (sobrecamas,frazadas,manteles y sábanas).

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (bedspreads, blankets, tablecloths, and sheets)

loans.name: Assetou

texts.fr:
Madame Assétou S. est une veuve âgée de  28 ans,  mére de 4 enfants( 2 garçons et de 2 filles) qui vit dans le domicile de son feu mari à Koko, un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo( Région de Sikasso  République du Mali).
Elle a commencé très jeune les activités économiques et s’est spécialisée dans un secteur où il ya une forte demande à savoir la vente des pagnes wax (tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’Ouest) depuis maintenant plusieurs années.
En raison des difficultés d’obtenir des ressources financières suffisantes, elle intégra le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir obtenu trois prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) elle est à  son deuxième prêt individuel et tous les précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.  Avec ce prêt elle compte achéter 12 pièces de pagnes wax à Bobo Dioulasso (une ville de la République de Burkina Faso en Afrique de l’ouest). Elle revend ses pagnes en détail et au comptant dans les foires des villages environnans et dans la ville de Kadiolo (préfecture de Sikasso) à une clientèle essentiellement féminine.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, assurer certaines de ses propres dépenses et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Assétou S. is a widow of 28 years of age, mother of 4 children (two sons and two daughters), who lives in the home of her deceased husband in Koko, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Kadiolo (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali).

She began to earn her living at a very young age and has specialized in an area where the demand is very high, selling wax print cloth (brightly colored cloth that is highly prized in West Africa) for several years now.

Because of the difficulty of obtaining sufficient financial resources, she joined the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. After having obtained 3 group loans, she is now on her second individual loan, and all the preceding loans have been reimbursed without difficulty. With this loan she intends to buy 12 lengths of wax print (known as "pagnes") in Bobo Dioulasso (a town in the Republic of Burkina Faso in West Africa). She re-sells her lengths of cloth retail and for cash in the fairs of the surrounding villages and the town of Kadiolo (Sikasso Prefecture) to an essentially female clientele.

She expects to make a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA which will be used to make repayments on the loan and cover some of her own expenses, with any remainder being invested back into her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of lengths of wax print cloth

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
El señor Domingo Antonio V. Ayala es de Jejui, tiene casa propia, casado, con hijos, tiene 52 años de edad.

Tiene una ferretería, y también taller de motocicletas, que ya lleva 6 años de funcionamiento. El mismo esta ubicado en un local propio en donde es ayudado por su hijo, tiene clientela formada y buena ubicación pues se encuentra en una zona céntrica de la ciudad.

También tiene 30 hectáreas de propiedad, en donde tiene animales vacunos y ovinos, además de cultivos diversos. Estos también representan un ingreso muy bueno para la familia.

Domingo quiere aumentar la cantidad de mercaderías, para su negocio, ya que tiene muchos clientes que prefieren comprar en su negocio precisamente por la buena variedad de productos que ofrece en su ferretería.

Entre las mercaderías a adquirir están repuestos en general como cables, focos, pinturas, repuestos para motocicletas, etc.
texts.en:
Mr. Domingo Antonio V. Ayala is from Jejui, has his own home, is married with children, and is 52 years old. He has had a hardware store and also a motorcycle shop for 6 years. He owns his shops’ locale and is helped by his son. He has a customer base and good location in the city’s center. He also has 30 hectors of property where he has cattle and sheep in addition to a variety of crops. This also represents a good income for the camily. Domingo wants to increase the quantity of merchandise in his business, as he has many customers that prefer to buy in his business precisely for the good variety of products that he offers in his hardware stores. Among the merchandise to acquire are general parts such as cables, lights, paint, motorcycle parts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy general parts such as cables, lights, paint, motorcycle parts, etc.

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.es: La señora Patrocinia V. en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, barrio ubicado en la capital  de Managua, tiene la edad de 47  años,  se encuentra casada con el señor Sergio quien es taxista, junto tienen 5 hijos. Actualmente la señora Patrocinia se dedica a la costura, teniendo su taller de costura en su casa, quien inicio este negocio con la venta de un taxi hace 5 años, ella esta solicitando un crédito de C$  6,000 a 9 meses para invertirlo en su negocio, ya que necesita reparar una maquina de coser y para comprar  tela y poder realizar mas ropa, por tanto ella aspira en un futuro poder ir comprando poco a poco maquinas industriales que le permitan trabajar sin dificultad y hacer ropa de mas calidad; para a la vez incrementar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Patrocinia V. lives in the Reconciliación Village neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. She is 47 years old, married to Sergio who is a taxi driver, and together they have 5 children. Today Patrocinia is a seamstress; she has a sewing shop in her home. She began this business 5 years ago by selling a taxi. She is asking for a loan for C$6,000, which will be repaid in 9 months, to invest in her business as she needs to repair a sewing machine and buy fabric in order to make more clothing. She aspires in the future to be able to buy, little by little, industrial sewing machines that will enable her to work without difficulty and make better quality clothing in order to increase her sales and obtain greater income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine and buy fabric to make clothing

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en: Koffi K. is a 31 year old married father.  He lives in the village of Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital.  Wome is situated in a lush and beautiful area of Togo near the border with Ghana.  To provide for his family, Koffi operates a taxi-motorcycle service.  With his motorcycle, Koffi picks up passengers along the road and drops them off at their destination.  This service is always in demand in Wome. There is no electricity in this village and people must often travel further than walking distance to take care of business.  Koffi hopes to use this loan from Kiva to purchase a new motorcycle.  With the profits he will earn from his business, Koffi can continue to send his children to school and provide for his wife and family

loans.use: Purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence I. is 56 years old and married with 7 children. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is happy because the demands for her goods will increase during and after the festive season. She needs the loan amount of N70, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs, provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A., 35, is married and has given birth to three children – a boy and two girls.  She says two of her children are in basic school.  Evelyn’s husband is a commercial driver, and she lives with her family in Konongo in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. 

She is in the business of trading, mainly plantains.  She buys food from the farmers in her community and nearby towns, and then Evelyn treks to Accra to sell to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators.  She has been in business for barely two years.  She says when plantains become scarce, she buys other food items like cassava, yam, etceteras.  Evelyn wants to buy plantains on larger scale so that she can sell to a number of customers and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy plantains in bulk

loans.name: Chadulu L Group

texts.en:
Esta has owned a small charcoal store and has been a maize seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for 14 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 175. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and maize for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and to save money.

Esta is 40 years old, married, and has four children: aged between 22 and 16. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members Joyce, Janeth and Chipegwa. Each woman has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and maize for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: S. owns a small alcohol distilling hall and raises piglets as well. She runs this business very well and has been earning a good profit from this work since 2007. She is recognized for her skill in distilling alcohol, and she earns her daily income of $4 per day. S. has been married to Mao, 28, for a number of years. Mao is a local construction worker and a hard-working husband. Lately, the family has been facing problems with the business’ transportation. So, S. is applying for a loan of $400 to buy a motorbike for the business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the business

loans.name: Karim

texts.ru: Клиент Мирзоев Карим, проживающий в районе А_Чоми занимается животноводстом более 18 лет у него имеется несколько голов скота. Клиенту 60 лет, женат, имеет 6 детей, образования среднее. Клиенту помогает его дети.На получившие деньги, клиент хочет купить несколько молодых бычков.
texts.en:
Karim M. is a client who lives in the A-Chomi region and does animal husbandry for more than eighteen years. He has several heads of cattle. He is 60 years old, married and has six children. He has secondary education. His children are helping him. Karim will use the loan money to buy a few more young calves.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. She says three of her children have completed senior high school and are currently working. The last two are still in school. Mary lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Mary is a hardworking woman. She is a bread baker. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. Mary also sells drinks such as malt, Fanta, Coke, etc. She procures the drinks from the wholesale dealers in the regional capital, Cape Coast.

Mary has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure more bags of flour, ingredients and drinks in bulk to produce bread on large scale.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour, ingredients and drinks in bulk to produce bread on a large scale

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
La señora María Estela O. se dedica arduamente a su negocio de tienda en general el cual es comercializada por ella misma habiéndola desarrollado siendo Ceprodel el pilar que le ha brindado créditos para su negocio. 

Hoy en día ha mejorado las condiciones de su negocio habiendo adquirido vitrinas y estantes donde exhibir sus productos. Espera en que Ceprodel le brindará un crédito para la compra de los productos y así salir adelante en su negocio en su localidad.
texts.en:
María Estela O. works arduously in her general store. She advertises the store on her own and works to improve it through the help of Ceprodel, a pillar that has brought her credit for her business. At present, she has improved her business by installing display cases and shelves to display her products. She hopes that Ceprodel will help her obtain credit to purchase merchandise and make her business successful.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Cẩn Nguyen Thi (446011538) is a 47-year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has three school-aged children. Cẩn raises livestock for sale, primarily pigs. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, Cẩn joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cẩn has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Cẩn is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 5th loan from TYM Fund. Cẩn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard M. is married and has 2 children. He has received schooling through University level. Richard sells fabrics and clothing for men and women in Kotokraba, which he has done since 1999. His wife is a seamstress. Richard uses his income to pay school fees and housekeeping expenses.

Richard will use the loan to purchase more fabrics and clothing for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Richard plans to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: purchase more fabrics and clothing for resale

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua M. is married to a fisherman and they have four children. She has received no formal education. Efua sells fish and provisions at New Takoradi, and has been in the fish-selling business since 2007. Her loan will be used to buy more fish and provisions for resale to expand her business. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees and her household expenses, and she hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to pay these.

loans.use: To buy more fish and provisions for resale

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Сафарова Зухра проживает в райоен Турсунзаде. Возраст 50 лет. Замужем, имеет 1 ребенка. Зухра более 10 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на оынке, где в основном торгует продуктами питания. Ей также в этом помогает ее муж. Клиентка просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Zuhra S. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. She is 50 years old, married and has 1 child. Zuhra has been involved in sales for over 10 years. She has a retail stand at the market, where she primarily sells food products. Her husband helps her with the business. Our client is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Daajinsuren

texts.en:
Daajinsuren is a single mother who lives with her two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Daajinsuren sells children’s clothing. In 2007 she and her two daughters moved to the city from the countryside and began to sell children’s clothing at the outdoor market.  In 2009 she moved to a different market, leased a booth and started working there.  Her older daughter helps her at the market even though she is in school.   She also takes care of her little sister when Daajinsuren is away.  They hope someday to be able to lease another booth to expand their business.

With money from the loan she would like to buy clothes in Beijing and bring them to Mongolia to sell.  If she can get a better selection and better quality clothes from Beijing she can gain more customers and increase her income.

She lives with her two daughters in a Mongolian Ger.  Her husband got sick and passed away four years ago.  The property they live on has a shack on it but it is so old and run down that they can’t live in it.  She hopes to be able to save enough money to fix up that shack and move into it before winter sets in.

Daajinsuren is very quiet, unassuming, and a very hard worker.  She says her biggest goal is to raise her daughters to be good and wise people.

About XacBank:

Founded in 1998, XacBank is a community development bank and microfinance institution in Mongolia, and is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar.  It currently serves approximately 16,000 micro clients at 76 branches in all 21 aymags (provinces) in Mongolia, making it the largest microfinance institution in the country.

XacBank's mission is to contribute to sustainable development of Mongolia that can come only from educated and skilled people and competitive and dynamic businesses concerned equally about Planet, People, and Profit. The Bank will provide equitable access to transparent, reliable and responsive banking products and services to the Bank’s clients, including its traditional Micro-entrepreneurs as well as Small and Medium businesses.

Your loan enables XacBank to expand its microloan capacity and return a portion of the interest back to the borrower at the end of the loan term

To learn more, please visit the XacBank website at: www.xacbank.mn.

loans.use: To purchase more children's apparel to increase her business inventory

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen A. is the picture of a woman who is very determined to cut the ties of poverty that hinder her way to success. She believes that business is a starting step to achieve something higher, provided it is properly managed. Now on her third loan, she is requesting 15,000 pesos as additional capital for her fishing business. Specifically, the loan will pay for two bundles of fishnets, 60 pieces of bamboo, and for the repair of her fish cage.

Carmen is a native of the island town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is married to Apolinario, who is a 57-year-old fisherman. She is the mother of two daughters: her elder daughter, Helen, is 35 years old and her younger daughter, Mary Ann, is 18 years old.

In 2007, she joined Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with high hopes and aspirations to have access to capital for her business. Her previous loans were used as rolling capital for her fishing business and also, partly, as capital for her secondary sewing business. She is hopeful that with hard work and proper use of capital, she can make her business grow. She dreams of having more fish cages and her own sewing machine. She also wants to be able to improve her house into one more spacious and durable.

loans.use: To pay for fishnets, bamboo and the repair of a fish cage

loans.name: Yakhara

texts.fr: Yakhara D. est une femme de 43 ans mère de 6 enfants. Elle est marchande de fruits de saison. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter son capital et avec les revenus participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yakhara D., 43, is the mother of 6 children. She sells seasonal fruit. She is requesting this loan to add to her working capital and with the income will participate in supporting her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of seasonal fruit

loans.name: Bahriddin

texts.en:
Bahriddin rents a little store where he sells construction materials and paints. He buys his goods from different cities wherever they are cheaper and sells them. He purchases goods every week. Bahriddin is married and has two children. He has many constant clients. Bahriddin wants to take a loan for purchasing more goods and have more profit. He wishes to educate his children and hopes that someday they’ll become good persons in society.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Voa Tiger Group

texts.en:
Christiana A. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called VOA Tiger. She is 45 years old and an elementary school drop-out due to poverty. Christiana is married with three children aged 14-28 years old and their educational levels are 9th high school graduate. She also cares for three siblings.

Christiana lives and does business in the Jah Tono community, Brewerville area, north of the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.
This community is known as a very old settlement where people settle after leaving the rural areas; it is also known as a community where people fight poverty to change their lives.

Christiana's business is purchasing food ingredients like seasonings, pepper, oil, fresh tomatoes, onions, etc. She buys wholesale and sells to the residents of Jah Tono. She has been running this business for three years and is hoping to improve her business to a better standard. She sells at affordable prices that encourage customers to always want to patronize her business. Her main challenge is when she sells on credit. But if she doesn't give credit, she feels it drives them away, although she is able to save.

Christiana needs this loan to purchase bags of charcoal as a method of expanding her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education to enable them to become prominent people in society.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal to expand her business

loans.name: Kobavi Ahoueffa

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et est mère de 02 enfants ; depuis 2000, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de pagnes de qualité, des produits génériques, certains articles scolaires et certains ustensiles de cuisine comme les cuillères, les fourchettes, les couteaux. Elle dispose d’un petit espace à côté d’un super marché dans le quartier de Djidjolé à Lomé où elle vend ses produits. La plupart des clients visitant le supermarché en profitent à leur sortie, de jeter un coup d’œil sur ses produits. Elle réalise en ce moment de bonnes affaires puisqu’elle revend aussi les pagnes à des revendeuses ambulantes, qui viennent s’approvisionner chez elle. Pour disposer d’un nouveau stock, elle sollicite urgemment un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 pagnes Wax Hollandais, 05 pagnes Hitarget, 05 pagnes Soso ainsi que certains articles scolaires manquants et des ustensiles de cuisine.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is married and the mother of two children.  In 2000, she started doing commerce in quality pagnes (colorful West African cloth), generic pharmaceutical products, certain school supplies, and certain kitchen utensils, such as spoons, forks, and knives.  She has a small spot next to a supermarket in the Djidjolé district of Lomé where she sells her goods.  Most of her customers visiting the supermarket have a look at her goods and take advantage of them upon exiting the store.  Right now, business is good, since she also resells pagnes to hawkers who come to her to stock up.  To obtain new inventory, she's urgently requesting a WAGES loan to buy 10 Wax Hollandais pagnes, 5 Hitarget pagnes, 5 Soso pagnes, as well as certain lacking school supplies and some kitchen utensils. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy "pagnes" cloth

loans.name: Seferina

texts.es: La Sra. Seferina trabaja con la Institución desD. mayo del año 2008, ella tiene el negocio D. venta D. comida en la zona D. Cotacota, juntamente con el esposo atienden la venta D. comida y desayuno, desD. hrs. 6 D. la mañana hasta las 4 D. la tarD., ambos esposos conviven, se colaboran y comparten sus actividades, el esposo Don Felipe maneja un transporte, ellos ya no tienen obligaciones con los hijos, puesto que ya los sacaron profesionales, dedicandose ahora a cuidar alguna vez a los nietos y la mantenución D. la casa D. su casa propia, precisamente parte del destino del crédito es para arreglo D. la movilidad que tienen, es una pareja D. esposos muy responsables en sus cuotas, durante estas cuatro secuencias en las que trabaja con nosotros.
texts.en:
Seferina has worked with this Institution since May 2008. She has a business selling meals in the Cotacota zone. Working with her husband, they sell meals, including breakfast, from 6:00 am until 4:00 pm. Both husband and wife live together, collaborate, and share in activities. The husband Felipe also drives a transport.

They no longer have obligations to their children, who have already become professionals. Seferina and Felipe now dedicate themselves to caring for their grandchildren and for their own house. Precisely, the loan they are requesting is for improving their business. They are a couple who have been very responsible in their payments during the four loan cycles they have been with us.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY GROCERIES, OIL, AND OTHER PRODUCTS FOR HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Y. Honorine

texts.fr: G. Y. Honorine est née le 06 Avril 1982 et vit au quartier Houénoussou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis près de 27 ans. Honorine est mariée à WHANDENON Rock Serge, un peintre auto, et est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. En plus de ses enfants, Honorine a un autre enfant en charge. Seul le conjoint de Honorine supporte les charges de la famille. Honorine a fréquenté jusqu'au secondaire. Il y a de cela quatre ans que Honorine vend divers articles (sucre, savons, pâtes alimentaires, conserves, papiers hygiéniques, lait, etc.) à son domicile. Honorine vend également de l'eau glacée et de la glace. Honorine fait ses achats à Dantokpa, marché internationale du Bénin. Honorine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié d'un crédit qui a été bien remboursé. En vue de diversifier son activité et d'augmenter la taille de sa clientèle, Honorine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
G. Y. Honorine was born on April 6, 1982 and has been living in the Houénoussou district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for nearly 27 years. She is married to WHANDENON Rock Serge, an automobile painter, and is the mother of three children who are all in school. In addition to her children, Honorine has another child in her care. Her husband is the only one who is covering family expenses. Honorine has a secondary school education. For four years since then, she has been selling various goods (sugar, soaps, pasta, canned food, toilet paper, milk, etc.) out of her home. She also sells ice and ice cream. She supplies herself at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. Honorine is a former ALIDé client who has had a loan before, which she has repaid. With the aim of diversifying her business and expanding her customer base, she’s requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, boxes of pasta, sugar, soaps, water in packets

loans.name: Esa

texts.en: Mrs. Esa P. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, is married, and is blessed with five adult children. Esa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than three years, earning 1,800 PHP net monthly income. In 2006, Esa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Esa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Niño Divino Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Niño Divino" esta representado por la señora Ana María y conformada por 12 miembros que se caracterizan por ser amigas, socias muy unidas y activas, emprendedoras que desean realizar actividades crediticias para crecer y sacar adelante sus negocios de venta de comida, cosméticos, refrescos, pollo celulares y entre los varones se dedican al servicio mecánico, jardinería y el transporte.  En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus ventas están dentro del margen de ganancia necesario para el sustento de sus familias. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición de mercadería, insumos y herramientas para ayudar a realizar un mejor trabajo mucho más eficiente y capaz de competir en el mercado.  En cuanto a su experiencia ellas la tienen a pesar de ser su primer ciclo gracias créditos en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital a la cual agradecen por la confianza depositada y el apoyo económico brindado, que les otorga para poder hacer crecer sus negocios y mejorar la vida de los miembros del grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Niño Divino" (Divine Child) is led by Sra. Ana María and consists of 12 members known for being close friends. They are active entrepreneurs who wish to pursue loans in order to grow and succeed in their businesses which include selling food, cosmetics, soft drinks, chicken, and mobile phones. The men of the group are involved in auto repair, gardening, and public transportation. Within such a competitive environment, we are able to mention that their sales are within the margin of profitability required to support their families.

This loan will be used to acquire merchandise, supplies, and tools to help them work more efficiently in their jobs and make them competitive in the marketplace. Despite this being their first loan cycle, the members have experience working with solidarity group loans through other institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital. They are grateful for the confidence and financial support provided to them. This will help the members grow their businesses and improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Las Lomas De San Juan Group

texts.es:
“Las Lomas de San Juan”, es una alcancía comunal conformada por  12 socios entusiastas y emprendedores, quienes realizan diversas actividades como: producción,  comercio y servicio, ellos vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desde hace 1 año y 6 meses.
Fernando Edgar asume el cargo de presidente, tiene 37 años, casado, y tiene 3 hijos de 3, 14 y 16 años.
Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de pollos, se inicio en este negocio porque inicialmente trabajó en una empresa, en el cual logró aprender y a conocer a sus clientes  y  decidió independizarse, actualmente distribuye a los diferentes mercados.
Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo logro comprar un terreno y mejorar su calidad de vida y la educación de sus hijos
El reciente préstamo será destinado a la compra de mercadería para esta campaña navideña, todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a pagar en los plazos pactados.
texts.en:
Las Lomas de San Juan Community Bank is made up of twelve enthusiastic and enterprising members who have a variety of jobs in areas such as production, business, and services. They have been working with Kiva Partner EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad for between six months and a year. Fernando Edgar has the job of president. He is 37 years old, married, and has three children aged 16, 14, and 3. For the last four years he has been selling chickens. He started in this business because initially he worked in a company where he learned some skills and got to know his customers. He then decided to work independently and now goes to different markets to sell his product. Through his hard work Fernando has managed to buy a piece of land, improve his quality of life, and educate his children. The recent loan will be used to buy merchandise for the Christmas season. All the members of the group are grateful for the help that the money gives them and promise to repay it in the time period agreed upon.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: Maria Alejandrina

texts.es:
doña Maria Alejandrina D. tiene 34 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de Choluteca, Maria tiene una pulperia en la cual vende varios tipos de productos, Maria es muy dedicada a su negocio y a sus hijos, tiene 3 hijos que son lo mas importante para ella en la vida.
su esposo se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para salir a trabajar y asi ganarse la vida.
entre los dos cubren con los gastos del hogar.
Maria invertira el credito en comprar mas productos y asi tener una buena variedad para sus clientes.
Maria necesita el credito para hacer crecer su negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Alejandrina D. is 34 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San Pedro in the city of Choluteca. Maria has a small convenience store where she sells various types of products; she is very dedicated to her business and her children; she has three children who are very important in her life. Her husband gets up at 5:00 in the morning to go to work and earn his livelihood; together, they cover the household expenses. Maria will invest her loan to buy more products so she can have a good variety of products for her customers. Maria needs her loan to grow her business and get ahead in life with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store: beans, rice, sugar, lard, oil, cereal, soups, tissue paper, soap, candles, corn flour, tortillas, drinks, juices, salt, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario P. is from the city of San Antonio, Ozamiz City. He is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Dario owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as canned goods, shampoo, toothpaste, eggs, salt, sugar, candies, some food for snacks and so on in the local community. Dario has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $228 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Dario joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. Dario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 15,348 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This will be his 5th loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Kagala Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
K. Dodovico, shown in the small photo at the top left, also appears in the big photo. He is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is 59 years old and married with sixteen children out of which seven are still in school. He also takes care of one grandson and two granddaughters. 

He is a businessman, and has been involved in selling sugar cane and firewood from Namasiga trading center for twenty-five years. He is able to make a profit of approximately $50 a week and he attributes this to his faithfulness, promptness and the help of the loan. He would like to have access to a sugar cane processor so that he can transform his business to make more profit. 

He also works hard to ensure that he educates all his children so that they get a better life. He needs a loan to be able to purchase more firewood and sugar cane for increased purchases and sales.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and sugar cane for resale.

loans.name: Divina Misericordia 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of her group Divina Misericordia (Divine Mercy), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Santiago, a city known for its tobacco and beef production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple rented structure as a single mother with her children.

Carmen is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having fully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling phone cards (cards which, when scratched off, reveal a secret coD. which when texted to the phone company gives the customer prepaid minutes). She will use the profits to invest in her family by purchasing school supplies for her children as well as saving towards owning her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Phone cards to sell

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: Martha del Socorro tiene  50 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 30 años. La señora se dedica al negocio de compra-venta de cosméticos, además de esto también tiene una crianza de pollitos de engorde, además que también vende comida para aves de corral. Ella inicio con este negocio desde hace 10 años y tiene ya 2 años de tener la crianza de pollos y la venta de comida de aves. Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito en Fundación León 2000 para ser invertido en la compra de productos Avon, ya que actualmente posee bastantes pedidos, además de esto desea invertirle un poco al local donde tiene las aves de corral. Con los dos negocios ahora obtiene mayores ganancias, sobre todo obtiene más ganancias en la crianza y engorde de pollo. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una tienda grande ubicada en el nuevo mercado.
texts.en:
Martha del Socorro, 50 is married and has a 30-year-old son. She is a cosmetics merchant but also raises chickens and sells feed for barnyard fowl. She started the cosmetic sales business 10 years ago and has been raising chickens and selling bird feed for two years. She is requesting funding from Fundación León 2000 to buy Avon products, since she currently has several pending orders, and also to invest a bit in improving the corrals in which she keeps her chicks. Her two businesses produce good profits, she makes the most profits in the chicken raising business. Her dream has always been to have a large store located in the new market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Avon cosmetics.

loans.name: Kiwumulo Development Group Of Mukono

texts.en:
K. Rose is a lively 34-year-old widowed mother with two school-going children. Her four-year-old boutique business in Seeta, MuKono, has been her financial recourse as she grapples with the solitary responsibility of taking care of her children.

The lack of capital to expand her business has been one of Rose’s undoings over the years. With monthly profit returns of 80,000 shillings, she has not been able to consolidate her business venture. As such, she wants a loan to buy new equipment for her boutique and to move into bigger premises.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for her boutique and to move into bigger premises

loans.name: Askar

texts.en:
D. Askar is 31 years old. He is married and has a child. His mother and father are living with him, and he is responsible for their living expenses too. He has a butcher shop and has been running meat-selling business for 9 years. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. Now Askar is requesting a loan of $1000 USD. Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro entrepreneur and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan. Askar is counting on your help. Your support will really help him.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase meat to expand his business.

loans.name: A.batapa's Group

texts.en:
Arsulita B., 70 years old, is from the village of Buenavista. She is is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Arsulita is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living Arsulita operates a "sari-sari" store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Arsulita has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

Arsulita joined PMPC in 2000 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid her previous loans from PMPC. Arsulita is requesting her 14th loan, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Nehemiah

texts.en:
Nehemiah is 46 years old, married, and has six children aged between 10 and 21 years old. All of the children are in education. Nehemiah is a mixed farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. He has been farming for 20 years and has one permanent employee. Over time, he has employed 18 casual laborers during planting, weeding and harvesting times. Nehemiah is also a school teacher. His main challenges in farming are the unpredictable weather conditions, poor prices for his produce, and crop diseases.
Recently, Nehemiah completed a loan from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, for 45,000 KES, which he used to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He has requested this loan of 70,000 KES to lease more land and grow bananas. He says that he has been able to see his children in high school and university through farming. In future, he would like to go large scale by leasing more land and growing bananas and maize. He is requesting more training on business management skills from Juhudi.

loans.use: To lease land for growing bananas

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Mrs. Svay S., 44, is a hard-working woman who tries to earn money by fishing along the river. She has another earner in her husband, shown on the left in the photo, who works in the construction field. They have seven children and almost all of them are working at different jobs.

The coming fishing season is good for fishing but Svay S. doesn’t have enough equipment to fish. Thus, she decided to seek a loan to purchase a net and trap to use in her fishing activity.

loans.use: To purchase a net and trap to use for fishing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a fast food cart

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with a son and a daughter, both attending school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the family’s needs. Alice owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Alice has been operating her poultry business for the last ten years as retail and from home. She sells to the neighboring community and also to retailers and hotel (restaurant) operators. She has no other source of income. The major challenge in the business is seasonality which causes fluctuation of prices in the market.

Alice decided to work with Yehu so as to obtain a loan to expand her business. With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to buy chicks and chicken feed. She hopes to buy a plot and add more chicks in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Vanush

texts.en: Vanush M. is 55 years old. Together with his wife, he lives in Garnahovit village, Aragatsotn region, Armenia. Vanush works as a bus driver but his driver’s salary is very low and it is impossible to support his household with it. To have extra financial means, the couple is occupied in cattle breeding and land cultivation. To improve his household economy, Vanush is planning to buy more cattle.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Los Madroños Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Los Madroños está conformado por Danelia Z. Dávila, Flora Nuvia M. L. y Damaris del Socorro S. Mejía, tres mujeres de una zona en crecimiento que comparten la misma dedicación y empeño al desarrollar sus labores de comercio diarias con el deseo siempre de superarse y obtener lo mejor para ellas y sus familias.

Danelia, quien es la coordinadora, vende ropa en general (nueva y usada) en su casa de habitación y también ambulante frecuentando a familiares, vecinos, conocidos y personas recomendadas para ofertar sus productos. Ella inició hace 8 años del mismo modo pero con muchos menos clientes, muchos menos productos y muchos menos estilos de ropa. Flora también se dedica a la venta de ropa pero ella vende únicamente ropa usada, y Damaris de igual modo vende ropa decidió vender también cosméticos y algunos artículos de uso personal.
texts.en:
The “Los Madroños” group is comprised of Danelia Z. Dávila, Flora Nuvia M. L., and Damaris del Socorro S. Mejía. These three women are from a rapidly developing area and share the same spirit of dedication and hard work towards developing their businesses, always seeking to get ahead and provide the best for their families. Danelia, the coordinator of the group, sells new and used clothing from her home. She also travels to the homes of relatives, neighbors, and other acquaintances to offer her products. She began this business 8 years ago with many fewer clients, products, and styles of clothing. Flora sells clothing, but specializes in used clothes. Damaris sells clothing as well as cosmetics and other personal care items.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes M. is currently in the business of selling bread, groundnut paste and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock dried and fresh fish.  Agnes is 31 years old and is married to a driver. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: Stock dried and fresh fish

loans.name: Herminigildo

texts.en:
Herminigildo Y. is from the village of San Vicente. He is 40 years old. Herminigildo is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Herminigildo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Herminigildo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 70,000 PHP per harvest for these activities.

In 2010, Herminigildo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Herminigildo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Herminigildo is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Herminigildo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Namulesa Twekembe-Lugazi Group

texts.en: Tailoring is a business preoccupation 32-year-old N. Diana has been inclined to for the last 14 years in Nangunga-Lugazi. It is a business that has been putting food on her family’s table all this while and she has no regrets as to why she began it. Of paramount importance have been the skills she got at the tailoring schools she attended. What has also come in as a winning attribute is her hard work attitude. Diana, who is a jolly mother of four, says she also operates a pay phone business and sells bananas. In a month, her profits equal 140,000 shillings and with this loan, Diana who belongs to Namulesa Twekembe Group-Lugazi, says she is going to give her business a new lease springboard. In essence, she says she is going to buy more cloth-making textile material and also improve her other businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth-making material

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó mediante la unión de amigas y vecinas de San Antonio ya que se enteraron de Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron ayudarse para recibir los beneficios.
Actualmente se encuentran trabajando cada en sus actividades de manera independiente para los ingresos de sus familias, sin embargo no dejan de realizar algunas actividades en conjunto para recaudar fondos y de esta manera cuentan con ahorros y también les ayuda a pagar las cuotas de sus créditos.

La Sra. Librada Y. quien integrante y presidenta del comite, trabaja elaborando y vendiendo comestibles en un puesto de venta el cual es muy concurrido por la clientela teniendo en cuenta la ubicación, buena atención y calidad de productos.
 Ella desea invertir y ampliar el negocio mediante la adquisición al por mayor de más variedad de bebidas, como jugos en envases, gaseosas de más variedades, etc. y productos para la elaboración de las comidas como: panificados, lácteos, embutidos, carnes, verduras y frutas para diferentes ensaladas y jugos
 De esta manera estaría incrementando sus ingresos con las ventas, abaratando costos de producción.
texts.en:
This group was founded when friends and neighbors in San Antonio united, joined the program of the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women and decided to help one another to receive the benefits of the program. Each of them is currently working independently in her own business to earn an income and provide for her family, and yet they share a few activities to raise some funds and have some savings. This also helps to pay the installments of their loans.

Ms Librada Y., the member who chairs the group, prepares and sells meals in her stall, which is very popular because of its location, the good service and the quality of the food. She wants to invest in her business and expand it by purchasing in bulk a large quantity of drinks (juice in containers, several kinds of soft drinks, etc.) and ingredients for her dishes (bread, dairy products, sausages, meat, vegetables for salads and fruits for juices). Thus she would increase her income with higher sales and lower production costs.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meat, bread, condiments, drinks and fruit

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen M. is a thirty-two year old general landscaper and green nursery tree planter in Bamburi, Mombasa. He is a single man who only supports himself and has been in this business for the last five years and has done well.

He was introduced to KADET and now he is requesting his first loan to purchase seeds and polybags for his tree nursery, and he intends to expand and start a second tree nursery with the anticipated profits.

He hopes that he will be able to expand his business in future and live more happily.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and polybags for his tree nursery.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba B. sells palm oil and cassava dough at Elmina. She is married and has ten dependents. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more palm oil and cassava dough to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in other foodstuffs for resale.

loans.use: buy more palm oil and cassava dough to sell

loans.name: Edisson Rolando

texts.es:
Edisson Rolando S. S. tiene 29 años. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con la compañera y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Edisson se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 10 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar la casa.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Edisson Rolando S. S. is 29 years old. He lives with his partner and their children, in the Ventanas region, Province of Los Ríos. They have 3 children.

The members of the La Union rural communal bankare all based in the Aguas Frías area of Ventanas. The group is dedicated to agricultural work, in a  planting cycle of maize, rice and beans. This activity takes a lot of time. 

Edisson has been dedicated to agriculture - especially the cultivation of maize, rice and beans - for 10 years. He buys his supplies in Ventanas and sells his produce at the market in the same area. He is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for his crops. The loan should help him financially, to stock up on these necessities. He faces difficulties such as crop diseases and the variability of the climate. His dream is to improve his house. He likes to play sport.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila, de 61 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado mucho por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 6 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. El negocio al que se dedica Teofila, es el cultivo de hojas de coca, café y cacao, productos que con mucho esfuerzo y paciencia ha logrado cosechar, sus tierras son de las mejores cuidadas de su pueblo, ya que ella es muy responsable con sus cultivos, puesto que sabe que la ganancia que obtenga dependerá de la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos ya que los sacos de cultivos son muy pesados. Para más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas crediticios gracias a ello. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para fertilizar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Teofila is 61 years old.  She is a woman who has always worked hard to get ahead in life.  She lives in her own home with her 6 beloved children and what she most desires is to enjoy a peaceful old age.  Teofila's business is growing coca leaf, coffee and cacao.  These are products which she has managed to harvest through a lot of effort and patience.  Her land is some of the best looked after in her village since she is very responsible with her crops as she knows that the profits she makes will depend on the quality of her produce.

What Teofila most likes about her work is sowing her land and she does this with a great deal of care.  She has been in this business for 40 years and she considers the most difficult aspect of her work to be transporting her produce since the sacks of crops are very heavy.  In the future, she hopes to buy new land so that she can increase her production.

This is Teofila's first loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual in her payments and has never had any credit problems thanks to this fact.  She will use her 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy more manure to fertilize her crops with.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of manure

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maria; ella tiene 46 años. La socia es soltera, y tiene 01 hijo; la socia se dedica a la administración de su tienda de abarrotes ella desea implementar el dinero y comprar mercadería para surtir su tienda, ella también deberá terminar de pagar parte de la mercadería que adquirió en el mes de noviembre como panetones, vinos, champan, chocolates para la época navideña, actualmente la socia nos indica que le está yendo muy bien que está vendiendo sus panetones y las pastas de chocolate, ella tiene buenas expectativas con respecto a la época navideña y el año nuevo, la socia nos indica que el año pasado vendió panetones hasta el mes de marzo de este año entonces no se apura en vender todos solo en esta fecha. La socia solicita el préstamo para surtir mercadería y pagar una última cuota de los panetones.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Nuevo Amanecer del Cusco" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Maria is 46 years old.  She is single and has one child.  Her business is running her grocery store.  She would like to use her loan money to buy merchandise so that she can stock her store.  She must also finish paying for some of the merchandise that she acquired in the month of November such as panettones, wine, champagne and chocolates for the Christmas season.

Maria tells us that currently her business is doing very well and that she is managing to sell her panettones and chocolates.  She is confident with respect to the Christmas season and the New Year.  She tells us that last year she sold panettones up until the month of March so she is not worried about selling them all right now.

Maria is requesting this loan to stock her store with merchandise and to meet the last repayment on her panettone purchase.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To stock her store with merchandise and to make her final repayment on her panettone purchase

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is 55 years old from Kakamega, married to George and they have two children who are all over 18 years old. Her husband George is a businessman and his income helps support the family.

Rose has a dairy business that she has been running for the past nine years. She currently owns one dairy cow which she has been using to milk and supply milk to the neighbouring shops and schools. She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD and has a good credit history with us. Rose intends to use the money to buy another diary cow to add to her business so that she can be able to meet the demands of her clients by supplying them with milk.

Her dream and desire is to venture into poultry business in the future.

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow to add to her stock

loans.name: Leo I Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama LEO, está ubicado en el Estado D. PuebL. en México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. Florentina L. tiene 50 años, estudió L. primaria, es artesana y tiene en total 2 hijos: 1 mujer y 1 varón.  ElL. se dedica a L. artesanía en figuras D. yeso que inició hace 10 años,solicita el préstamo para comprar piedra ya que es en L. forma como llega el yeso, D. modo que elL. lo tiene que picar, para después molerlo. Quiere satisfacer los pedidos D. sus clientes, algunos vecinos y clientes D. elL. comentan que hace figuras muy bonitas, tanto D. temporada, como al gusto D. sus clientes hace figuras desD. 10 cm y hasta D. 3 metros D. altura, lo que más venD. son ángeles. Florentina venD. en L. comunidad, en las comunidades aledañas así también como en tianguis mercados y ferias. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo está feliz.  Quiere este crédito para comprar lo necesario en pinturas, barnices, endurecedores y piedra para cumplir con los pedidos.  También espera con sus ganancia poder comprar una pulidora para ahorrar tiempo y sacar pronto sus pedidos ya que hasta hoy lo hace a mano. ElL. anheL. darles una vida y educación digna a sus hijos y seguir siendo el mejor ejemplo D. lucha para salir a delante.
texts.en:
This group is called LEO, and they are located in the state of PuebL. in Mexico. The group is maD. up of 10 members. Florentina L. is 50 years old, and studied in primary school. She is a craftswoman, and has two children: a daughter and a son. Her business is handicrafts, in plaster figurines, which she started 10 years ago.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy stones, since that is how the plaster comes, in a form in which she has to chip away first, and then grind. She wants to fulfill her customers requests. Some neighbors and customers of hers comment that she makes very beautiful figurines, both seasonal figurines as well as figurines that her customers request. She makes figurines from 10 cm to 3 meters tall, and what she sells most are angels.

Florentina sells her figurines in the community, and in neighboring communities, as well as in street markets and fairs. At the time of requesting the loan, she is very happy. She wants this loan in order to buy the necessary supplies such as paints, varnishes, hardeners and stones in order to fulfill her orders. Also, she hopes with her earnings to be able to buy a polisher in order to save time and get out her orders quickly since up until now, she has been doing it by hand. Her greatest wish is to give her children a dignified life and education, and to continue being a better example of the fight to get ahead.

loans.use: paints, varnishes, hardeners and stones

loans.name: G.s. Bendicion De Dios Group

texts.es: La señora Mercedes tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de un año de edad. La señora se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante y principalmente por encargos es que realiza sus ventas. Ella se dedica a esta actividad primeramente debido a la falta de empleo que aqueja a nuestro país, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de poder culminar sus estudios. Su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad en Managua. Ella está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de invertirlo en comprar mas mercaderías teniendo como objetivo el incrementar sus ventas.  Otra integrante de este grupo es doña Julia, la cual tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 18 y 22 años de edad respectivamente. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, principalmente trabaja con productos distribuidos por Avon de manera ambulante, tanto al crédito como al contado. Ella inicio con este negocio debido a la necesidad de generar un ingreso extra para la familia ya que el ingreso de su esposo no es suficiente para los gastos del hogar. La señora desea continuar invirtiendo en la compra de cosméticos y realizar inversiones en otros productos aprovechando que se acerca la época de verano.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 27, is married and has a one year old son.  She’s an itinerant cosmetics saleswoman.  Her sales are primarily order based.  She is in this line of work primarily because of the lack of employment opportunities in our country since she was unable to finish her schooling.  Her husband’s employed as a Security Guard in Managua. She is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise with the objective of increasing sales.

Another group member is Julia, 46.  She’s married and has two children who are 18 and 22 years of age respectively.  She sells cosmetics, mostly Avon products, door to door, both for cash and on credit.  She started the business because of the need to generate extra family income because her husband’s income was insufficient to cover household expenses.  She wants to continue investing in the purchase of cosmetics and invest in other products to take advantage of the summer season.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and other products.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly S. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 36 years old. Dolly is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living Dolly raises livestock. Her main source of income comes from buying and raising pigs for sale. She also butchers and sells meat. Dolly has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007 Dolly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dolly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase young livestock to raise and sell. Dolly is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Dolly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Amileidy

texts.es: Amileydi tiene 19 años, vive en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir, su formación profesional le ha dotado las herramientas para mejorar su trabajo, es así que ofrece sus servicios de costuras en la fábrica donde actualmente esta laborando, por lo que gana comisiones por ello. Recientemente hace unos meses, con unos amigos empezó a abrir un proyecto de negocio para realizar  este servicio de confección que hasta el momento esta emergiendo positivamente y le trae buenas rentas por lo que ha decidido implementar mejor su negocio para que de esa manera brinde un mejor servicio. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de una maquina de coser industrial, el dinero será solo una parte del pago ya que dispone de su propio capital.
texts.en:
Amileydi is 19 years old. She lives with her parents. For three years, she has worked making garments. Her professional education has provided her with tools to improve her work. Her sewing skills have allowed her to in a factory. She is currently working in one and earning commission.
In the last few months, Amileydi and some of her friends have started to open a garment making business project. At this time, the business is going well and it is making a good profit. So she has decided to improve her business in order to offer better service.
