This is her first loan with MFP. She is very pleased to know she has financial support and she is grateful to the people funding this loan. The loan will be very useful for her financial progress. 
With the requested loan, Amileydi will invest in the purchase of an industrial sewing machine. The money is only part of the payment since she is also using her own capital.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Nyamtseren

texts.en: Nyamtseren is 31 years old and lives with her parents and three children in Uvurhangay province of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they have owned since 2007. Nyamtseren began retail trading of consumer goods in 2006. She bought a big container with her business revenue in 2008, which she operates as a clothing shop. In the summertime, she sells clothing by travelling to the countryside by car. She has gained much business experience so far. She is trying to expand her business and increase her working capital. She is a hardworking person with initiative. She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 tugriks to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: C4813 Abadahigwa Group

texts.en:
Immaculee is the president of a group called “Abadahigwa”, which has a total of seven members. Immaculee is the first person on the right in the photo. She owns a small business selling sugar, rice, bananas, sorghum, etc. She is 58 years old and is married with five children and three additional dependents who are relatives. Her business is open from 7am until 8pm every day. This is her fifth successful year in her business.

Immaculee will use this loan to purchase more products to sell such as salt, beans, soft drinks, bread, etc. With any profit, Immaculee would like to provide food for her family, pay school fees for her dependents, renovate her house, save money for the future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell, such as salt, beans, soft drinks, bread, etc.

loans.name: Dolores Ernestina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad. Se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dolores, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 12 y 10 años los mismos que estudia en colegio y  escuela. Su marido es albañil.

Ella vende productos para el hogar (planchas, licuadoras, ventiladores, camas, etc.), ropa y zapatos de todo tipo. Su forma de venta es por cartilla o por catalogo, enseña la revista donde están todos estos artículos y sus clientes deciden que es lo que quieren y luego ella al completar el cupo limite realiza los pedidos y entrega los productos de acuerdo al número que tengan sus clientes, cobra cada semanas o cada quince como prefieran sus clientes. Nos cuenta que lleva 4 años realizando esta labor y que le va bien.

Este crédito es para comprar planchas, licuadoras, ventiladores, camas, ropa y zapatos.  Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido sacar adelante su negocio.

Su sueño es tener su propia distribuidora de estos productos.
texts.en:
The Ilusiones ("Hopes") communal bank meets fortnightly at the El Progreso residential community, a deprived, densely populated area in the city of Portoviejo. It's known as the prison neighbourhood, as it's where Portoviejo's women's prison is located. Here we meet Dolores, 26, who lives with her partner and their two children, aged 12 and 10. The children go to school and her partner is a bricklayer.  

She sells all kinds of household products (irons, blenders, fans, beds, etc..), clothing and shoes. She sells via catalogue. She shows her customers the brochures of the different articles and they decide on what they want. Upon reaching the minimum quota of orders she places the orders and delivers the products to her clients as requested. She gets paid weekly or fortnightly, depending on what her clients prefer. She explains that she has been in this line of business for 4 years and that things are going well for her. 

This loan is to buy irons, blenders, fans, beds, clothes and shoes. This is her fourth cycle with the communal bank and she enjoys it because thanks to the loans she has been able to succeed in her business. 

Her dream is to have her own distribution company for this kind of products.

loans.use: to buy irons, blenders, fans, beds, clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith M. is now 45 years old and married with two school-aged children. Edith is a farmer working in the Philippines. She earns PHP 9,000 per month. 

Edith is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. Edith grows rice and has been doing it for 25 years.

In the future, Edith hopes to have a large crop of rice in order to earn more income to be used in financing the education of their children. She hopes that someday she will improve their living conditions and she dreams that their children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: Vicenta, de 54 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo. Está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. El negocio al que Vicenta se dedica es la venta de ropa de forma ambulatoria, ella todos los días recorre las instituciones públicas y privadas, en busca de clientes que deseen comprar algo de lo que vende. La ropa la solicita por catalogo, es por eso que los modelos que vende son muy novedosos y llamativos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las prendas que están de moda, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes. En adelante, espera tener el dinero suficiente, para poner una tienda, donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad sus productos y dejar de exponerse del peligro que hay en la calle. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para pagar a tiempo sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que siempre le pone mucha a alegría a las reuniones. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de donde escoger.
texts.en: Vicenta is 54 years old and she is a very kind and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home together with her husband. She is ready to work very hard to succeed in life. Vicenta's business is to sell clothing itinerantly. She travels to the private and public businesses every day in search of clients who wish to purchase something. She requests the clothing by catalogue which is why the styles that she sells are very trendy and appealing. What she most enjoys about her work is giving clients advice on the articles of clothing that are in style. She has 15 years in the business. She considers the most difficult part of her work is having to walk all day in search of clients. In the future she hopes to have enough money to set up a store where she will be able to sell her products in greater comfort and she will no longer have to expose herself to the dangers of the streets. This is her sixth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is ready to work very hard to make her payments on time. She is very well liked in her communal bank especially because she is always brings so much joy to the meetings. With the one thousand five hundred nuevos soles she requests she will purchase more clothing to have a wider variety of products for her clients to choose from.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Juana Flor

texts.es:
Juana de 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande, que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Juana es a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (arroz, leche, aceite, azúcar, verduras, etc), en su propio domicilio a colocado su negocio desde hace algunos años, al tener su tienda en su casa puede atender a cualquier hora y así pueda obtener más ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades familiares .

El crédito solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1000 nuevos soles, lo utilizara para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y poder ampliar su negocio con otros productos, una vez que sus ventas aumenten cubchofer de  su mototaxirirá su crédito y mejorará su nivel de vida.  Juana con mucho empeño y trabajado desea tener un tienda más surtida y más adelante poder tener comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Juana is 40 years old and lives with her husband in her own home.  Her house does not have basic services and is located in Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  The people in this area farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

Juana's business is selling essential household products (rice, milk, oil, sugar, vegetables, etc.).  She sells these products from her home where she set up her business some years ago.  As her store is located in her home, she is able to serve her customers at any time which means she can make more income with which to cover her family's needs.

Juana has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use this money to buy a larger quantity of merchandise.  She will expand her business with other products once her sales increase.  Through a lot of effort and hard work, Juana would like to have a better stocked store and, in the future, she would like to be able to have more comforts in her home.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of merchandise to expand her business

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Don Marcial tiene 58 años, está casado con Norma tienen 4 hijos.
Se dedica a la dulceria hace mas de 20 años, realiza sus ventas en zonas de la capital de pais según los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes.
Cuenta con su clientela formada a quienes en forma semanal los visita dependiendo de los pedidos que recibe. Gracias al esfuerzo conjunto con su conyuge no precisan de mano de obra de terceros y el margen de ganancia es mayor.
Con los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo comprar azucar en menor precio, ya que su compra fue en mayor volumen y en forma contada.
Con el credito podra seguir implementando su negocio, para poder comprar todos aquellos elementos que necesita, como azucar, y dulces esenciales.
texts.en:
Marcial, age 58, is married to Norma.  They have four children.  

He has had a sweets business for over 20 years.  He sells in areas in the capital of the country according to his customers’ orders.  He has regular customers who he visits weekly, depending upon the orders that he receives.  Thanks to the joint effort he makes with his wife, they do not need more workers.  This makes their profit margin larger.

With the loans that he has received from the Fundación Paraguaya he was able to buy sugar at a lower price.  This is because his purchase was in greater volume and in cash.

With the loan he will be able to continue implementing his business.  He will do this to be able to buy the things he needs like sugar and essential sweets.

loans.use: to buy essential ingrediants to prepare sweets (sugar and essential sweets, etc.)

loans.name: José Marcial

texts.es: El Sr. se desempeña como electricista industrial   tiene  Veinte y dos    años de trabajar en esta área, es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  cinco  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la  agricultura, siembra de maíz, estos créditos los paga con cuotas mensuales de sus ingresos en la empresa, estos créditos le benefician para el desarrollo y mejora del nivel de vida de su familia ya que al vender la cosecha tiene la oportunidad de realizar inversiones en mejoras de la vivienda e incluso para la compra de electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Jose is employed as an industrial electrician. He has been in this occupation for 22 years, and is presently married. 

Jose has had 5 loans with CEPRODEL, each was invested in agriculture, sowing corn. He paid off these loans with monthly deductions from his earnings in the enterprise. The loans helped him to develop and improved the standard of living of his family.  As Jose sold each harvest, he has taken the opportunity to invest in home improvements and even to buy domestic electrical appliances.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel is 29 years old and married. She has 2 children ages 7 and 2.

Russel is in a food vending business. She cooks viands (meat dishes) that she sells to the people in her community. She also provides prepaid mobile phone load credits. Russel is also an AVON dealer. She plans to use her loan to buy raw ingredients such as pork, chicken meat and spices. She will also buy more mobile phone load credits to sell.

In the future, Russel hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as pork, chicken meat, spices and more mobile load to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 70 years old and married. She has three children.

Cecilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Cecilia has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from coconut farming.

Cecilia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Resty has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for 6 years.    
	
To help expand her business, Resty has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase charcoal for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Resty hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Resty hopes to expand her business.  Resty is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Samali

texts.en: Samali lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all go to school. She has one additional family member. She has a retail shop that she operates on a retail basis in a rented shop. She has been in business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 700,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of rice, flour and sugar. Her inspirational goals are to have a wholesale shop, to educate her children to the university level and to buy a plot of land. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She lives in a rented house and her family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expense includes rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, flour and sugar

loans.name: Josefa Micaela

texts.es:
La señora Josefa Micaela es casada, tiene 32 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría, inicio este trabajo gracias al apoyo de sus señores padres. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien también se dedica a la tejeduría.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de hilos de diferentes clases y colores para seguir produciendo más tejido, ya que producen cortes típicos, sabanas y servilletas. Espera que en el futuro pueda generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa Micaela is 32, married and was unable to receive an education.  She has three children who are in school and she has a weaving business which she began with help from her parents.  Her husband also helps with the weaving business.

She is requesting a loan to buy different types and colors of yarn so she can continue producing more products, as well as typical garments, sheets and napkins.  She hopes to improve her earnings in the future.

loans.use: To buy different colored yarn.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años es soltera y tiene un hijo de 9 años, vive en O. con su familia. María de describe como una persona humilde y sencilla con deseos de seguir adelante.

Trabaja sola en la confección de bolsos, bufandas y pantalones. Es la primera vez que trabaja con Fodemi, el crédito que solicitó es para la compra de hilo de seda y tela para la confección de pantalones lo cual le ayudará a incrementar su producción, sus ventas y sus ingresos.

Su sueño es poder construir su casita y darle la educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old and has a nine-year-old son. She lives with her family in Otalvo. María describes herself as a humble and simple person who has the desire to move forward.

She works alone making bags, scarves, and trousers. This is the first time she has worked with FODEMI. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy silk thread and fabric for making trousers. This will help her increase production, as well as her sales and her income.

Her dream is to build a small house and provide her son an education.

loans.use: to buy fabric and silk thread for making trousers.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 26 years old and single.  For the last two years, he has been managing a retail shop to make a living. He also does farming to earn extra income. He has retained his business because of his good reputation with his customers. In the next 5 years, he wants to become successful in his business. With this loan for 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to buy sugar and wheat flour for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to manage his business through his previous loans.

loans.use: To buy sugar and wheat flour

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is married and has three children. Elma is 37 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, the Philippines. Elma sells rice and corn to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm.

Elma has been a member of GDMPC for six years. In the future, Elma hopes to improve and expand her business so she can support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Lenna Rosbita D.

texts.es:
Lenna es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 19 años de edad, estado civil soltera y sin hijos, tiene estudios superiores.
	
Desde hace dos años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 200.00 nuevo soles dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de  prendas de vestir. 

Con éste nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/.  100.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital de su negocio y comprará telas de polistel, poli-algodones, etc, estos los compra por fardos y metros.  Lenna trabaja junto con su mamá, mayormente confeccionan para pedidos.

Lenna desea que su negocio crezca, tener una empresa grande y ser una gran empresaria

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la alegría de las socias.
texts.en:
Lenna is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Amigas” (Friends) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 19 years old, single, and does not have children. Lenna received a higher education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was in the amount of 200 PEN and the money was invested in her business of selling clothes.

With this new loan in the amount of 100 PEN, she will increase her business capital so that she can buy polyester fabrics, poly-cotton blends, and other materials in bales and by the meter. Lenna works with her mother, who does most of the sewing for her orders.

Lenna wants to grow her business so that she can have a large enterprise and become a successful businesswoman. What she likes about her Communal Bank is the joy of the other members.

loans.use: to buy polyester fabrics, poly-cotton blends, and other materials.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Myrna has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Myrna is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a very hard-working woman who practices farming in the town of Narok. She has been farming for over three years. She is 35 years old and married with two children.

Joyce has been a good client with KADET LTD, and she is applying for her third loan. She plans to use the entire loan amount for farming, specifically preparing her land and buying seedlings (maize and wheat). 

Joyce intends to use the additional income generated through this loan to reinvest in farming. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to prepare her land and buy seedlings.

loans.name: Marietou

texts.fr:
Mariétou est une femme veuve âgée de 50 ans et mère de 6 enfants .

Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 05/03/2009 ou elle fait parti du groupe de solidarité Sope Malick.

Mariétou fait du petit commerce dans la vente de friperie.

Elle dispose d une bonne expérience dans son domaine d activité et avec son nouveau prêt de 400000 francs Cfa elle acheter 20 balles de friperies qu elle va revendre au détails.

Madame Mariétou va payer à ses enfants des fournitures scolaires et des médicaments grâce à ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mariétou is a 50-year-old widow and mother of six.

She has been a member of the “banc villageois” since March 5, 2009, and is a member of the Sope Malick solidarity group.

Mariétou works in small-scale sales of secondhand clothing.

She has considerable experience in this area of business, and with her new loan of 400,000 CFA francs, she will purchase 20 bales of secondhand clothing which she will then sell retail.

Mariétou will be able to pay for her children’s school supplies and for medicine, thanks to her profits.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 51 years old and he lives in Pambak village, Lori area, with his mother, wife, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.  Samson has a higher education and he works at the village school as a geography teacher. Samson’s son and daughter-in-law also work as teachers at the same school. Samson’s mother is a pensioner, and his wife works in village administration.   

Simultaneously with his job at school Samson also engages in farming.  He keeps a cow, a calf, a pig, fifteen chickens and two bee families as well. Samson says that teacher’s salary is not enough to keep a family, so farming helps him to support his family as he uses agricultural produce for his family's use. 

Samson intends to develop his farm and thereto he is asking for an AMD 600,000 loan to buy three young calves for his farm.

loans.use: to buy three young calves for his farm.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Marine lives in the village Natanebi (West Georgia) with her family: husband – Eduard, 7 year old son and parents-in-law. Eduard owns a tractor and provides agricultural services to local farmers. Marine and her parents-in-law are involved in the family agriculture business, which is an important source of the income for the family. They have 3 milk cows and 2 calves. The cheese that they produce is sold locally. Along with the dairy farm, the family also grows maize, citrus and nuts on a family owned 0.5 hectare piece of land. The total average monthly income of the family is 750 Laris. 

Marine has requested credit for purchasing feed for their live-stock. After purchasing good natural feed, the cows will give high quality milk. Part of the requested credit will also be used for purchasing a spare part for Eduard’s tractor, as it is out of order and needs repair.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Mr. Net, 54, is in the business of cultivating rice crops and fishing in the river for his livelihood. After fishing, his wife takes the caught fish to sell through the commune to generate income. This couple has tried to work very hard for the family and they typically earn an average of $3.50 per day. 

Net tells us that he doesn’t own any animals for his farming yet, and he wishes to have some to better the way he works. Also, they’ll help to keep his family from hiring other neighbors’ animals. So now, he decided to ask for some funds from HKL to buy buffaloes for his farming work. 

In the future, he hopes to improve his living conditions and provide his children a good education. He now lives with his wife and four single children in the Pouk district.

loans.use: to buy buffaloes for his farming work.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Pich, 48, is widowed and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice for over 20 years and is successful in her career. Her daily income is USD 1. Her children are working in a garment factory, earning USD $6 per day. Each month, she has to spend on food USD $25, utility USD $7 and other expenses USD $30. In order to generate more income for her family, Pich is requesting a loan of USD $600 to purchase cattle to breed in order to sell when they gain weight. In the future, she wants to raise many animals and she wants to build a new house. Moreover, she wants to live with her children in harmony.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed and then sell

loans.name: Susuna

texts.en: Susuna is married to a farmer and has 6 dependents. She has been.extracting and selling  palm kernel oil for 8 years in Abrafo, near Abura. Susuna uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase palm kernels to extract oil for sale. With the new profit,  Susuna will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm kernels to extract oil for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Mawuto

texts.en:
Ms. Mawuto A. was born in 1964 in Gati. She is divorced and takes care of three children. After primary school she soon realized that her calling was in business, so from a young age until today, she has been selling cloth, prepared rice and other goods. She has already received and repaid four loans.

She is currently requesting a loan of $1000, which will allow her to continue running her cloth-selling business and her restaurant in addition to building a stock of palm oil. She hopes this loan will allow her to increase the profitability of her business and to better improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1964 à Gati, Madame A. Mawuto est divorcée et a à sa charge trois enfants. Après ses études primaires, elle a vite compris qu’elle serait plus à l’aise, si elle faisait du commerce. Ainsi depuis son jeune âge jusqu ‘à ce jour, elle vend des pagnes, du riz préparé et autres. Elle est à son quatrième de crédit qui a été bien soldé.

Elle sollicite aujourd'hui un montant de $1000 qui va lui permettre de continuer son commerce de pagne et son restaurant mais au même moment, elle va faire son stockage d’huile de palme. Avec ce crédit, elle espère rentabiliser son activité, et contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To buy traditional cloth and other items

loans.name: Agustín

texts.en:
Agustín is 51 years old, he is a driver and four years ago he started to sell tacos and cakes at weekends. Gradually he was gaining clients and the demand by its products was increasing. So he decided to dedicate himself full-time to his food business. He invested all his savings to buy a bigger stove and kitchen accessories.

At the moment Agustín requires a $700 loan to purchase ingredients to continue to produce the food he sells. He expects to pay it back in 6 to 12 months. He wants to grow his business and you can help him, your support will be very important to Agustín.

Translated from Spanish by Virgilio Russi, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Agustín tiene 51 años de edad, él es chofer y desde hace cuatro años, los fines de semana atendía su negocio de venta de tacos y tortas, pero poco a poco fue ganando clientes y la demanda por sus productos se incrementó, así que optó por dedicarse toda la semana a la venta de comida, poco después necesitó comprar una estufa más grande y más accesorios de cocina, en lo que invirtió todos los ahorros que tenía.

En estos momentos Agustín requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 700 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los ingredientes que necesita para continuar haciendo los alimentos que comercializa, ofrece devolverlos en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Él quiere hacer crecer su negocio y tú puedes ayudarlo, tu apoyo será de gran utilidad para Agustín, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: Purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela is married and has 2 children, 8 & 12 years old. Her husband, Pablo, is a welder but his salary is not enough to cover the family's monthly expenses. Adela used to work at a maquiladora, but they laid her off. She used up her savings to start her own business two years ago. She sells stationery and rents computers for internet use.

In order to boost her sales and to provide better customer service, Adela is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 USD. She will use this loan to purchase computer accessories and stationery. She has agreed to repay this amount within 3 months. Become a part of the success of this business by helping Adela improve her business and her family's living conditions. They greatly appreciate your support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Adela es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 8 y 12 años de edad, su esposo Pablo se desempeña como soldador pero con el salario que recibe no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar, anteriormente Adela trabajaba en una maquiladora pero por recorte de personal fue liquidada, con los ahorro que tenía decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace dos años, en donde vende papelería y renta computadoras para el uso de Internet.

Para darle un impulso a su negocio y mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece a sus clientes, Adela solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares, que utilizará en la compra de accesorios para las computadoras y papelería, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a Adela a mejorar la vida de su familia, ellos agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: To purchase inventory & computer accessories

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs Em S. is a 58-year old widow. She has one child and lives in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since her husband passed away many years ago, S. has had to struggle in life to cover all the family’s expenses on her own. She has worked selling grocery products to the people in her area, where she generally earns around $ 5 each day. Recently, she has requested  a loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more grocery items to meet her growing customer demand.

(S. is sitting at the left side of the picture with a red scarf around her neck)

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing more grocery items to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok S., age 39, works with her father buying and reselling recyclable items, earning together around $5 per day. She has four children, one who is a garment worker earning around $2.30 per day, one who is a welder earning around $2 per day, and two who are students. She would like to request a loan of $500 to purchase more recyclable items in bulk, lowering the purchase cost and increasing her margins on the resale price. She plans to use the additional income generated from her business expansion to reinvest in her inventory and save funds for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase recyclable materials to resell.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en: Dilrabo started her business in 2005. The first loan she received from MLF Microvinest helped her significantly and that is why she always comes to Microinvest to take out loans. Now she is intending to get funds for purchase of winter clothes.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Banco Comunal Unión Ii Group

texts.es:
Felicitas, Roxana and Adelaida belong to the Communal Bank Unión II for 8, 4, and 8 years respectively. They tell us that their Communal Bank has learned to be responsible, punctual, united, and through the lessons how to run their business and how to educate their children.

Felicitas is 21 years old and has 2 children, she sells “Donofrio” brand ice cream as a street vendor in the Santa Clara market. She has been selling ice cream for 15 years.

Roxana is 25 years old and has 2 children, she sells clothing in the 12 de abril market, an activity she has done with her mother since she was a little girl, and three years ago she began her own business. She bring the merchandise from Lima to sell.

Adelaida is 50 years old and has 4 children. She has a bakery and makes bread typical of Ayacucho, called chapla. Her oven is located in the San Sebastián neighborhood and she tells us she learned this trade from her mother.

Felicitas, Roxana and Adelaida need loans of 900 soles, 900 soles, and 750 soles respectively that will be invested in the purchase of ice cream, jackets, pants, pull overs, shirts, sweaters, flour, sugar and wood. Their savings will be used to purchase machines for the bakery, for the education of their children, and for the construction of a house. Felicitas, Roxana and Adelaida have dreams of having their own homes, a united famly, a large business, and children who finish their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Felicitas, Roxana y Adelaida pertenecen al Banco Comunal Unión II desde hace 8, 4, 8 años respectivamente. Ellas nos cuentan que en su Banco Comunal han aprendido a ser responsables, puntuales, solidarias y a través de las capacitaciones a cómo manejar su negocio y cómo educar a los hijos.

Felicitas tiene 32 años y 2 hijos y vende helados “Donofrio” ambulatoriamente por las calles del mercado Santa Clara, actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años.

Roxana tiene 26 años y 2 hijos y vende ropa en el mercado 12 de abril, actividad que realiza desde pequeña con su mamá, y desde hace 3 años su negocio es propio. Ella trae la mercadería desde la ciudad de Lima.

Adelaida tiene 50 años y 4 hijos; tiene su panadería y elabora el pan típico de Ayacucho, el pan “chapla”. Su horno está ubicado en el barrio de San Sebastián y nos cuenta que esta actividad la aprendió de su mamá.

Felicitas, Roxana y Adelaida necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 900 soles y 750 soles que serán invertidos en la compra de helados, casacas, pantalones, polos, camisas, chompas, harina, azúcar y leña. Sus ahorros los utilizarán en la compra de maquinarias para implementar su panadería, para la educación de sus hijos y para la construcción de su casa. Los sueños de Felicitas, Roxana y Adelaida son tener una casa propia, una familia unida, un negocio grande y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios superiores.

loans.use: Felicitas, Roxana and Adelaida need loans of 900 soles, 900 soles y 750 soles respectively that will be invested in the purchase of ice cream, jackets, pants, pull overs, shirts, sweaters, flour, sugar and wood.

loans.name: Nazenan

texts.en:
Ms. Nazenan is a 54-year-old local resident of Saatli town. She is married and lives with her husband and three children. She and her husband have been breeding cattle in their yard since 1988. They now are quite experienced in this business. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries.

Cattle breeding is traditional in this region, where it is the only source of income. You can earn a good income in this business. Nazenan wants to develop her business and increase the number of calves. She wants to buy two more calves, so she has applied for a loan of $500.

loans.use: To buy more calves to increase income

loans.name: Almacia

texts.es:
Two years ago Almacia was abandoned by her significant other and was left alone with her 4 year old son. It was difficult for her to recover. Still she had the strength of character to get ahead and her business selling natural products was a great help for her and her child. Now her son has been her motivation for progress and she shows great affection for him through her dedication and success in her work. She would like to expand and improve her business and renovating and remodeling her store will be a beneficial factor in her business. With this purpose in mind she is asking for your support to start improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Almacia, tuvo que afrontar el abandono de su pareja hace 2 años y al quedarse sola con su hijo de 4 años fue muy difícil reponerse. Sin embargo tuvo la entereza de salir adelante y el negocio de venta de productos naturistas fue una gran ayuda para ella y su hijo ahora su pequeño se ha convertido en el único motivo de su progreso y demuestra el gran cariño por él, a través de la dedicación y surgimiento en su trabajo.Ella desea ampliar y mejorar su negocio y el renovar o remodelar su tienda seria un gran factor beneficioso para su negocio, con este propósito en mente solicita vuestro apoyo para poner en marcha su propósito.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve the conditions in her workplace

loans.name: Kam

texts.en:
Mrs. Kam S., age 58, collects firewood and sells it to the local people in the village. She earns approximately $3 a day. Her husband, Mr. Chem Sart, age 68, is a chief in the community and also owns a plot of farmland where he grows rice. He earns around $1.50 a day.

Three children live away home, and two are garment workers, who each earn $60 a month. The other children are students. (Mrs. Kam S. and her daughter are pictured here.)

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for their children to commute to work and reduce daily expenses. She plans to use the remainder of the loan to buy wood to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commute and repair house.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Zahanati 1 Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 30 years old and is a single woman with 2 children, ages 5 and 2 years old. Elizabeth is a food seller. She started her business in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Anna, who has a business in clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en:
R. Suhrob is 24 years old. He is not yet married. Suhrob has been running his business for five years. Suhrob sells cell phone accessories, such as chargers, earphones, and cell phone cases. The business is located in the central local market. Suhrob manages his business with success and there is a strong trend for development of the business in future.

This year is a most important one for Suhrob, because he is planning to arrange his own wedding. Thus, Suhrob is planning to expand his business and purchase more cell phone accessories to sell.

For this purpose, he requests 2700 Somoni ($800 USD) for a term of 8 months. Suhrob has already taken out a loan and proved himself to be a reliable client. He promises to repay the current loan in time and thanks all for support. Your support will really help him. Be an important part of arranging of Suhrob’s wedding.

loans.use: To buy accessories for cell phones

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Sra. Estela P. is 32 years old and has been married for 13 years to 35-year old Ever Cristaldo. They have two children aged 14 and 6 years. The older one is in 9th grade and the younger in primary school.

Estela owns a clothing store which she opened five years ago using the small amount of capital given to her by her husband who makes furniture. With the money she bought second-hand clothes, and as time passed, her business became a clothing store.

Estela wants to see her business to expand so that her income also increases. Then in the future her children can go to university, and she will be a well-regarded person. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as pants, shorts, footwear, blouses, outfits for children, shirts, T-shirts, sneakers etc. In this way she will increase her stock and offer more variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Estela P. de 32 años de edad está casada hace 13 años con el señor Ever Cristaldo de 35 años, el matrimonio cuenta con dos hijos de 14 y 6 años respectivamente, el primero está en el noveno grado y el otro está en el primer grado de la escuela primaria.

La señora Estela posee una tienda de ropas la cual empezó el negocio hace 5 años con un pequeño capital que le dio su esposo que se dedica a la fabricación de muebles, con dicho dinero compro ropas usadas y con el correr del tiempo lo convirtió en una ropería.

La señora desea que su negocio crezca cada día y con eso aumentar sus ingresos, para que el día de mañana pueda hacer estudiar a sus hijos una carrera universitaria y que en el futuro sea una persona de bien. Solicita este préstamo para compra de mercaderías como pantalones, short, zapatos, blusas, conjuntos para niños, camisa, remeras, zapatillas. Así aumentará su Stock de mercaderías y ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes

loans.use: To purchase men’s and women’s jeans, shorts, footwear, blouses, children’s outfits, shirts, T-shirts, underwear, sneakers etc.

loans.name: Carmen Ventura

texts.es:
Carmen is a hard-working woman who has 6 children, and together with her husband she grows crops and raises animals. She rasises horses, dairy cows, sheep; sells cheese and milk that her own dairy cows produce, and she has been doing this for 18 years. Every day she gets up early to take care of her animals and then take them to pasture, and every so often she milks her cows to sell the milk. She also earns money growing hay, some of which she sells and the rest is food for her animals. Now she needs a loan to invest in seed and to contract laborers to help her plant, and part of this money will also be used to start a small store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen es una mujer muy empeñosa y trabajadora, tiene 6 hijos y junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería; ella cría caballos, vacas y carneros, vende queso y leche que producen sus propias vacas, a esto se dedica desde hace 18 años, cada día se levanta temprano para atender a sus animales y luego llevarlos a pastear, cada cierto tiempo, ordeña a sus vacas para vender la leche.También obtiene ganancias cultivando pastos una parte la vende, y la otra es alimento de sus animales.Necesita ahora, el préstamo que solicita para invertir en su siembra y contratar obreros para ello, y parte de este dinero también lo utilizará en implementar una pequeña tienda en su casa.

loans.use: invest in crops and paying workers to help plant.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: M. Nazira is 35 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband left her six years ago; since then, Nazira has been raising her children alone and has been their sole provider. She earns income selling clothing for children, and, thanks to her perseverance and dedication to her work, little by little the business has progressed and resulted in increasing satisfaction and joy to Nazira herself. Her hard work has also helped improve the quality of life for her family. In the future, however, Nazira would like to further increase the income generated from the business in order to be able to pay for her children's studies. To achieve this goal, Nazira is asking for a loan of US$ 600 for a term of 9 months, which she will use to purchase additional children's clothing articles for sale. Nazira is an exemplary businesswoman and mother, and will highly appreciate your support.

loans.use: Purchase of additional children's clothing for sale

loans.name: Sanan

texts.en: Sanan was born in 1962 and lives in Baku city. He is married and has two children. Sanan started a cafe business ten years ago. Now, he needs a loan of $1200 to improve his cafe to provide his clients with the best service.

loans.use: To improve his cafe

loans.name: Pal

texts.en:
Pal K. S., 52, is a true entrepreneur, who lives with one child in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has a business selling rice noodles, or in Cambodia language “Nom Banchok”. It is one of the favorite foods among Cambodian people. Rice noodles are served with many kinds of vegetables such as: mint, banana blossoms, string beans, English cucumber, mung bean sprouts, and other vegetables. Moreover, there are two types of soup for it:  green and red soup. Green soup is cooked with boneless fish only, and called in Cambodian language “Nom Banchok Samlah Khmer”. The other soup can be cooked with pork or chicken, and is called “Nom Banchok Namya”.

On average, she makes $1.50 of profit per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi and is able to make $2 as well.
Mrs. Pal K. S. would like a loan from Kiva of US$1000 to grow yams for extra profit. She sees this as a good opportunity to better their standard of living.

loans.use: To grow yams.

loans.name: Burigul

texts.en: B. Burigul has had a trying life but still maintains an optimistic outlook.  She is a widow with three children. When her husband passed away, she was left without a steady income. Supporting her large family on her own is very difficult. She nonetheless remains a strong and persevering person and is intent on improving her family’s standard of living. She dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle.  The income she generates provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. Burigul has a lot of experience after so many years of hard work. She is requesting a loan for 1700 Somoni ($ 500 USD) in order to buy more young cattle to raise and well.  With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to expand her business

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia A. sells gallons of palm oil. Palm oil is an essential commodity in Nigeria. The demand for her palm oil is high. She is 34 years old and married with 8 children. Felicia needs the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more gallons of palm oil to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more gallons of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Maria S. D. J. tiene 51 años, ella es tesorera D. su Banco Comunal, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito D. Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio Secretariado Ejecutivo, carrera que ejerció durante 9 años, dejo D. trabajar cuando se caso, tiene  02 hijos y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Rosa inicio su negocio en una pequeña bodega donD. vendía arroz, azúcar y verduras, con las ganancias que obtuvo y con dinero D. juntas en las que ella participaba logro adquirir mas productos para la venta, logrando tener ahora una tienda granD., su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra D. gaseosas para su negocio.
Con el crédito D. 1200 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. cerveza y gaseosas.
Rosa sueña con tener un minimarket y un local para venta D. cerveza.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria S. D. J. is 51 years old and the treasurer of her cooperative bank. She lives in Buenos Aires, located in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She studied as an executive secretary, a career she followed for nine years. She stopped working when she married, and has two children who are no longer financially dependent on her. Rosa started her small business in a small bodega where she sold rice, sugar, and vegetables. With the money she maD., she managed to purchase more goods to sell. She now has a large store, and carries out her business in her own home. With the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Las Palmeras”, she invested in the purchase of sodas for her business. With the loan of 1,200.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in six months, she will invest in the purchase of beer and sodas. Rosa dreams of having a mini-mart and a location to sell beer.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beer and sodas.

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
C. is a 57-year-old and has been running two businesses for a long time: raising pigs and growing vegetables on her own farmland. She is married and the mother of six children: three are single and other three are married and live outside the family home. One of her single sons and her husband assist her in the business.

The family lives in a rural area of Pursat Province. Because C.'s farmland is small for them, they have difficulty growing crops; thus, she would like to ask for a loan to purchase one more plot of farmland. The loan will help them increase their productivity higher than the previous year.

loans.use: To purchase another plot of farmland

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina M., 39, married, ventures into fish vending to keep-up with the day to day needs of their family. It is her way of helping her husband, who only works as a carpenter, raise their four children. Given that demand for carpentry jobs is not constant, relying on her husband's income would not do good for their family. Gina was happy that HSPFI granted her loan to finance her fish vending business. She will be on her 4th loan cycle and she is requesting PHP 14000 loan to buy fish buckets for storage and additional capital to buy more fish for sale. She hopes that she would be able to get a space/stall in the public market someday.

loans.use: To buy additional fish buckets for storage and capital to buy fish for sale.

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Idris

texts.en: Idris M. is a hard-working man who strives every day to provide for his entire family, which consists of his wife and three children. He manages a grocery store where he sells many staples, such as bread, juice, sweets, and other preserved foods. Although he started this business only six years ago with less than $100, Idris has attracted a strong base of customers who are impressed by his efforts to travel to neighboring cities to purchase especially valuable items. In order to purchase additional foodstuffs and increase his inventory, Idris is requesting a loan of 1200 USD.

loans.use: To purchase more food items

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela cuenta con 27 años de edad, tiene una hija preciosa de 2 añitos, y vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Durante el día, Mariela trabaja en una institución muy reconocida de su región, al terminar esta labor se dedica a la venta ropa y zapatos al crédito o al contado, cuando tiene pedidos de sus  clientes o de personas con las que tendrá un contacto seguro, opta por dejarles pagar en partes, y según el tiempo convenido, las busca en sus casas o centros de trabajo para cobrarles. La idea de emprender este negocio, surgió a raíz de querer incrementar los ingresos económicos  para su hogar, de esto hace ya 5 años. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a mucha gente y su gama de clientes aumenta, por lo que le es rentable, además sólo trabaja a pedido, así no pierde en comprar mercadería que demore vender o no venda. Posteriormente, Mariela quiere tener una tienda de ropa y zapatos de mejor calidad. Con MFP ya tiene 3 préstamos, y lo que más le gusta de trabajar y pertenecer a su banco  comunal es que todos los integrantes son organizados. Con el dinero que en esta ocasión solicita, comprará la ropa y zapatos de los pedidos que hasta el momento tiene.
texts.en:
Mariela is 27 years old and has a cute little daughter who is 2 years old. She and her husband live in their own home. During the day, Mariela works for a well-known institution in the area. After that she works selling clothes and shoes. When she has orders from her customers or from people that she knows, she lets them buy on credit and make payments to her. When the payment date arrives, she goes to their houses or workplaces to collect her money. She got the idea to start this business five years ago, when she wanted to increase her home’s income. What she likes most about her job is getting to know many people and her client base is increasing. It is profitable for her because she only sells by the order, so she doesn’t waste money on merchandise that will not sell. In the future, Mariela would like to have a store that sells clothing and high-quality shoes. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she enjoys working with her community bank because all of the members are very organized. With the loan money she will by clothes and shoes to fill the orders that she has right now.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase merchandise

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana T., a 33-year-old trader who belongs to a village bank called ‘wonderful Jesus,’ is the mother of five children, four of whom are currently attending school through the help of government free compulsory education. It is her daily dream to provide quality education for her children to give them a better future life. Her husband is a farmer on a palm nuts plantation.

Susana owns and operates a grocery shop selling items including rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, and evaporated milk. She also sells cooking pots, ladles etc., but business progress is limited due to a lack of funds. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With this increased stock, Susana hopes to earn more income to provide for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: To buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Đắc Nguyễn Thị is a 74-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Đắc owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income comes from raising chickens for sale. Đắc has been engaged in this business for over 24 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month.

In 1998, Đắc joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Đắc has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Đắc is now requesting a loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be her tenth loan from TYM Fund. Đắc plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. No. 434981299.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn G. is 28 years old, married, and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She joined Paglaum Cooperative in April 2009 in order to enjoy the financial assistance and the programs and services they offer. She requests a loan of Php5,000.00 for her sari-sari store. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks, such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries, drinks and other household items. She aims to have a successful business in a concrete building and hopes that her children can finish their college degrees and have good futures.

loans.use: additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Elohor

texts.en: Elohor L. sells provisions retail. She is married with 4 children and she is 30 years old. She is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. Elohor says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Musofir

texts.ru: Назиров Мусофир проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 62 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Сын находится в России на заработках. Мусофир более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает мелко рогатый скот. Кредит просит для закупа скота и корма.
texts.en:
Musofir N. lives in the Rumy district. He is 62 years old, married and has 4 children. His son is working in Russia. Musofir has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years. He feeds and sells small livestock. He is requesting this loan to purchase livestock and feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and feed

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo is married with three children who are in school. She sells drinks. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
K. Mahbuba is a 40 year-old married mother of 4 children. She has been selling clothing for kids and men’s shoes at the local market for the past 15 years. Because of this, she will be able to pay for her children to finish school. With low capital, she is not able to buy larger quantities of clothing to sell.

Mahbuba would like to use the loan to buy more bales of clothing that contain more variety to increase her stock. She hopes to raise enough income to support all of her children to finish school. Be an important part of the well being of this humble family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of working capital with the purpose of business development.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es:
la sra. Maria de la Concepcion C. R. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, segun ella nos comento le va bien y tiene muchos clientes ya que a sus clientes les gusta la forma en que ella los atiende, tambien les gusta mucho el precio de venta que ella maneja y que los productos son de buena calidad.
en estos momentos Maria solicita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir mas su pulperia, este negocio es su unica fuente de ingreso, nos dijo estar muy feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo muy bien.
su meta es poder remodelar su casa y hacer mas grande su negocio para atender mejor a sus clientes, ya que tiene pensado vender golosinas y poner mesas para que sus clientes coman ahi.

loans.use: compra de huevos, leche, jugos, cafe, arroz, azucar, paletas, churros, refrescos, pan, galletas, sal, especias, papel higienico, toallas sanitarias, sardinas, chile, lacteos, manteca, margarina, aceite,

loans.name: Mrs. Nary Khin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of nineteen people, is located in Svay Prey village in Kandal province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Nary K. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare (5-acre) field on which she cultivates rice. On this plantation, she faces a problE. because her field has infertile soil which it is bad enough to affect her crop production. In order to solve this problE., she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make the crop more productive.

Mrs. Nary K. is 38 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Theng Khan, is a construction foreman.

Nine members in this group loans have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Litas

texts.en:
Litas E. is from the village of Obay. She is 44 years old. Litas is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Litas owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Litas has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Litas joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Litas has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Litas is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Litas from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As working capital, and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes P.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 38 years old, married and has five school-age children. They are from the village of Barra Puntod. Lourdes is just starting this business.

In 2001, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 pesos from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 20,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be Lourdes's 15th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: The Violets Group

texts.es:
El grupo las violetas las integran cuatro féminas trabajadoras y  luchadoras ellas son Reyna Estela O., María José C.,  Flora Delgadillo y Lidia G.. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora O. que hace como diez años inicio vendiendo ropa. Ella aprendió de este negocio por su mamá que también vendía ropa en un comienzo le trabajaba a ella y luego se independizo.

Las otras integrantes son C. de 28 años que desde hace un año y medio empezó vendiendo frijoles cocidos y tortilla actualmente puso un pequeño comedor; Gadillo de 55 años tiene 4 años de realizar  trabajo a domicilio de belleza y Ligia Mercado que vende cosméticos de la Avon, Bogue, Zermat, Romacel y productos baratos.
texts.en:
The Violets Group consists of four hardworking and strong-willed women: Reyna Estela O., María José C., Flora Delgadillo, and Lidia G.. Sra. Reyna is the group coordinator and has been selling clothes for ten years. She learned the business from her mother, who also sold clothes as a means of becoming independent.

The other members include Sra. María José, who is 28 years old and has been selling cooked beans and tortillas from her small diner for 1½ years. Sra. Flora is 55 years old and provides housekeeping services. Sra. Lidia sells cosmetics from the Avon, Bogue, Zermat, and Romacel lines as well as other inexpensive products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Balikudembe Group Of Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Rehema, 32, is a married lady with six children in Senior 2, Primary 7, Primary 4, Primary 3, Primary 3 and Infant school. She also helps to take care of two dependents: an orphan and her mother.

Rehema is a coffee seller plus she has had a retail shop in Buwoola for five years. She is able to make 80,000/= as profits each week. She says that she has been successful because of the good relationship she has with her clients plus the help of the loans. She works so hard to ensure that she educates her children to the highest level as well as to expand her business further.

Rehema needs a loan to help grow her business further by increasing her capital. In future, she would like to buy a plot of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: To recapitalise her business with more products

loans.name: La Pintura Group

texts.es:
Marcia A., Lisseth A., Dina M. y Ruth A. conforman al grupo La Pintura.  Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras que han administrado de forma formidable sus negocios. 
Dina Rebeca M. empezó vendiendo lápices y cuadernos, pero poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo hasta convertirlo en un cafetín y librería escolar. Asimismo paso con Marcia Nohemí A. quien inició con la venta de fresco y hoy en día vende comida y queso. 
Ruth A. vende ropa de diferentes estilos y Lisseth Jaqueline A. vende golosinas y helados. Todas ellas invertirán sus créditos en sus negocios para mejorarlos y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Marcia A., Lisseth A., Dina M., and Ruth A. make up the group named “La Pintura” (The Painting). They are hardworking and enterprising women who have managed their businesses admirably.

Dina Rebeca M. began selling pencils and notebooks. Her business grew over time until it was eventually converted into a café and school bookstore. Around the same time, Marcia Nohemí A. started a business selling soft drinks. Today she sells prepared foods and cheese.

Ruth A. sells different styles of clothing, while Lisseth Jaqueline A. sells candy and ice cream. They all are requesting loans to invest in their businesses so they can increase their revenues and improve their income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Raúl Alfredo

texts.es: El señor Raúl Alfredo R. G., tiene 45 años de edad, vive en la Comunidad Sandino, es casado su esposa trabaja vendiendo cosméticos y en el ramo de la belleza, aportando a la economía del hogar, El señor Raul es guardad e seguridad, ellos tiene tres hijos entre las edades de 15, 9 y 5 años de edad  los tres estudian, pero la mayor apoya con los quehaceres domésticos, para ellos el mayor deseo que poseen es el tener los recursos necesarios para poder preparar profesionalmente a sus hijos y hacerlo en un ambiente mas cómodo y seguro para toda su familia, pero para alcanzar este sueño han considerado solicitar un préstamo con la intención de realizar mejoras a la infraestructura de su hogar, con el préstamo comenzaran una primera etapa de compra de materiales tales como , cemento, arena y cal para darles un repella fino a las paredes de su hogar, ellos desean se les brinde un  apoyo en este proceso de remodelación de su hogar en donde toda su familia habitaran de una manera más justa socialmente.
texts.en:
Raúl Alfredo R. G. is 45 years old and lives in Comunidad Sandino. He is married, and his wife works in the beauty industry selling cosmetics to support her husband with the family finances. Raul is a security guard. They have three children, ages 15, 9 and 5, all of whom are in school, and the oldest one helps out by doing some chores around the house. Their biggest wish is to have the necessary resources to be able to professionally educate their children and for the entire family to live in a more comfortable and safe environment. In order to reach this dream they have requested the loan with the intention of making improvements to their home's infrastructure. With the loan they will take the first step of purchasing materials such as cement, sand and lime to put a fine plaster on the walls of their home. They desire this support in helping them remodel their home so the entire family can live in a more socially just way.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make improvements on his home

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita C. makes sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Angel C., a carpenter, they are blessed with nine children.  She earns money so their family can have a better life.  Rosita has two businesses: she has made curtains for 10 years and has operated a food cart as a vendor for more than three years.

Rosita is a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT).  She attends their weekly meetings and pays her dues consistently.  Because of her good repayment performance, she was able to borrow a sixth time from CCT.  The reason she was consistent in paying her dues was because she used almost all the money she borrowed to buy Filipino finger foods to resell.   Her business earns a profit of PHP 13,000 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan to expand her business by buying flour, fish balls and seasoning for her food cart business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and that she and her family will have good health always. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Bjy food to resell.

loans.name: Candela Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal "Candela" esta representado por la señora Yovana y conformada por 12 amigas, socias muy unidas y activas, emprendedoras que desean realizar actividades crediticias para confraternizar y así unirse mas como grupo. Yovana que es la presidenta se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos desD. hace 3 años atrás, Cristina venD. en una pulpería la misma que atienD. desD. hace 20 años atrás, Marleny se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos y tiene una experiencia D. 3 años en este rubro, Isabel venD. sodas D. manera ambulante desD. hace 1 años atrás, Martha es tramitadora realiza diferentes tipos D. papeleos desD. hace 10 años atrás, Martha venD. masetas desD. hace 2 años, Elena atienD. en su punto internet desD. hace un año en el mismo lugar también ofrece servicios D. llamadas nacionales e internacionales, Patricia venD. D. ropa desD. hace 4 años, Elizabeth es promotora cosméticos desD. hace 10 años atrás, Carmen venD. ropa interior y tiene una experiencia D. 1 año, Dory venD. salteñas y atienD. su negocio desD. hace 20 años atrás, Adela atienD. su venta/pulpería y tiene experiencia en este negocio desD. hace 15 años atrás. Todas desarrollan sus  actividades en su propio domicilio y como ambulantes. 

En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio, las socias tienen sus clientes fieles que constantemente  generan el movimiento económico necesario para la subsistencia D. las mismas, en caso D. que no les vaya bien el barrio se dirigen a otro lugar como ferias y mercados vecinales D. forma que puedan cumplir con sus obligaciones y con sus familias. El crédito esta destinado a surtir sus tiendas con la compra D. mercadería, material D. trabajo y la compra D. insumos en mayor cantidad para poder generar mejores ingresos que permitan darles a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias van cumpliendo un segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. salir adelante para mejorar más sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Candela Communal Bank is represented by Yovana and is comprised of 12 friends. The members are very united and active entrepreneurs who want to carry out credit activities to develop camaraderie and unite more as a group. Yovana is the group president, and has been selling cosmetics for the past 3 years, Cristina has been working at a paper supply store for the past 20 years, Marleny has 3 years of experience selling cosmetics, Isabel has been selling soda on the street for the past year, Martha has been selling pots for plans for the past 2 years, Elena has been working at an internet cafe that offeres local and international phone calls for the past year, Patricia has been selling clothing for the past 4 years, Elizabeth has been selling cosmetics for the past 10 years, Carmen has been selling underwear for the past year, Dory has been selling salteñas (Bolivian meat pastries) and running her business for the past 20 years, and Adela has been running her paper supply store for the past 15 years. Some do their activities in their own homes, while others are traveling merchants. As far as competition goes, we can mention that their competitors are present in the neighborhood. The members have their loyal customers who constantly generate the economic movement that is necessary to support themselves. In case it is not going well in the neighborhood, they go to other locations like fairs and neighborhood markets so they can meet their own obligations and those of their families. The loan is to stock their stores buy purchasing merchandise, work material, and supplies in greater quantities. Then they will be able to generate better earnings that will allow them to give their families a better quality of life. As far as experience goes, the members are completing their second cycle. They demonstrate responsibility, honesty, and the desire to get ahead to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Perlina

texts.en:
Perlina S., 55, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. Married to Jess S., a chef, she is blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn S. that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own eatery for quite some time now.

Perlina has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow ten times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her eatery.

Now, with your help, Perlina would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business and will be used to buy raw ingredients needed for her recipes.

Perlina dreams that her business will continue to grow S. that she can have enough money for her children to finish their education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients needed for her recipes

loans.name: Imani

texts.en:
Imani K. is a small-business married man. He runs a business selling clothes to customers: both secondhand clothes and new clothes for men, women and children.

Imani purchases his business goods from the wholesale shops at Kariakoo and Mnazi Mmoja business city center. His business market is at Zakiemu Mbagala in Dar es Salaam.

Imani has been in the business for four years and the business income pays school fees, house rent and meets his daily family needs. He needs a loan of TZS 1,200,000 to capitalize his business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Hevert Antonio

texts.es: Hevert Antonio tiene 37años, su actividad económica es la venta de sorbetes.
