Hace más de 10 años que se dedica es este negocio pues él, tiene muchos clientes por lo que el sale todos los días en su bicicleta con su humilde termo en donde guarda los diferentes sabores de helados. El tienen 2 hijos menores de edad que están a su cargo Hevert les ofrece estudios necesarios para su negocio, pues siempre se ha dedicado a vender este tipo de productos. El solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que es necesario para su materia prima. El sueña con mejorar su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Hevert Antonio, 27, sells sorbetes (frozen treats). He has been in this line of work for over 10 years. He has many customers so he goes out daily on his bicycle with his humble cooler where he keeps the various flavored frozen treats. He has two minor children under his care. Hevert provides them with education for his business; he has always sold this type of product. He is asking for funding to buy needed raw materials. He dreams with improving his commercial activity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for his frozen treats.

loans.name: William José

texts.es:
William es un joven que al morir su padre él como hijo mayor se hizo cargo de la finca y de su madre que con el tiempo ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo brindado por organismo como ceprodel además que gracias a su desempeño en la finca esta ha logrado mejorar enormemente ya que busca como sacar provecho de todos los recursos existente en la propiedad, el ya ha tenido dos préstamos con ceprodel el cual le ha brindado que el ya tenga su propia casa dentro de la misma finca  ya que anteriormente vivía en la casa de su madre.
El crédito el cual se le financio es para la compra de terneros de desarrollo el cual los engorda y al término de 12 meses este lo vende a un mayor peso del que lo compro lo que le permite tener una ganancia.
texts.en:
When his father died, William, as the oldest child, took charge of the farm. He also became responsible for his mother. In time he was able to get ahead thanks to the support from Ceprodel. Thanks to his work on the farm, he made enormous improvements because he looks for how to take advantage of all of the existing resources on the property. He has had two loans with Ceprodal. They helped him get his own house on the farm. He previously lived in his mother’s house. The loan is to buy calves to raise and fatten. After 12 months he sells them at a greater weight than they were when he bought them. This allows him to have earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calves to fatten

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
35-year-old Saidat is married with two children and they live in Lagos. She is a businesswoman who she sells groceries like tomato paste, milk, tea and more to make a living. She operates the trade with the support of her husband. She started the business thirteen years ago and works hard to meet her customers’ demands.

Saidat is asking for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase groceries in bulk to sell as this will enable her get a better discount, attract more customers and earn more profit on her sales. She promise to pay back promptly and says thank you.

Saidat is a member of LAPO micro-finance and has been borrowing for the past four years. She expresses her gratitude to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries in bulk

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.en:
Odiljon, a livestock breeder with 10 years experience, was born in Djabbar Rasulov district in 1975. He is married and responsible for 3 people, including his wife and two children (pictured, one of the children) who are all engaged in Odiljon’s business. 

Very dynamic, serious, and entrepreneurial, he is proposing to expand his flock and to repair his enclosure. This will meet the needs of a rather large clientele from his village and from neighboring villages. Some of his clientele come to buy animals from as far away as more than 20 km from his village. With this goal in mind, Odiljon is requesting a loan that will serve him as business capital. Part of the loan, he is planning to spend for his farming business. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve living conditions for his household and he will also make some investments.  
  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase small cattle and fertilizer for his business.

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Buen Pastor está conformado por Isabel  V., Ana María Borge R. y  Melida Rosa Guzmán tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras que en este tiempo han ido mejorando su negocio.  La coordinadora del grupo es Isabel V. de 46 años quien vende comida en el Mercado Oriental y desea poder ampliar y mejorar su negocio el cual ha mejorado poco a poco.

Las otras integrantes son Rosa María Ortiz Estrada quien vende producto Avon y fresco y Melida Rosa Guzmán quien vende ropa y cosméticos por encargo.
texts.en:
The Buen Pastor (Good Shepard) Group is composed of Isabel, Ana María, and Melida Rosa, 3 hard-working, forceful, and enterprising women who have been improving their businesses lately. Coordinator of the group is Isabel, 46 years old, who sells meals in the Oriental Market and wishes to expand and improve her business, which she has been growing little by little. The other members of the group are Rosa María, who sells soft drinks and Avon products, and Melida Rosa, who sells clothing and cosmetics by order.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING BASIC GRAINS, MEAT, SPICES, ETC. TO PREPARE MEALS TO SELL

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old. He is married and has three children who are between the ages of three months and five years. Two of the children are attending school.

He is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. He has been farming for 10 years. His main products are bananas and maize, which he sells to the local market. He also runs a hotel business in the area and sells clothes to the local market.

His major challenges in farming are a lack of finances, a poor transport network, and natural disasters like hailstorms that destroy his crops.

He has requested a loan of KES 40,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable h1m acquire a dairy cow that will produce enough milk for both domestic consumption and for sale. In the future, he would like to expand his hotel business by offering more services.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Saltanat's Group

texts.en: Saltanat A., 52, is a school teacher in Bokonbaevo. Her income, however, is not enough to live a comfortable life. Since she has been widowed, she receives no additional financial help in her household. She has two sons: one in college and the other in high school. Saltanat, though, is a strong woman and has taken care of the necessities by filling up her day up with other activities like cattle breeding, which she has now been doing for four years. She started cattle breeding with an initial investment of 5,000 KGS and now makes a 3,000 KGS monthly profit. She plans to use this loan to purchase a personal computer for her younger son to use in school. Saltanat’s longer term plans are to increase the number of cattle on her farm and to contribute money to her elder son’s wedding. Saltanat has three partners: Baktygul A., 42, is the treasurer of the group. She is also in the business of purchasing cattle and reselling them after fattening. She has been doing this for three years, ever since she divorced and her friends suggested she start this business. She began with a 10,000 KGS investment and today makes a 4,000 KGS monthly profit. With the loan, Baktygul wants to purchase four cows to increase her turnover. Farhat A. is an impressive 22-year old. He successfully graduated from second year at the university and, in order to do this, had to take out a loan. To pay off his loan he began selling cattle, fish, and agricultural products. He started this business one year ago with 5,000 KGS and now makes a 4,000 KGS profit. He would like another loan to buy more cattle and increase the amount of his herd. His future plans are to graduate, to marry, and to find a good job. Sabira B., 69, wants to have enough money to support her daughter and grandchildren. Her daughter is 25 and works in a nursery, earning 5,000 KGS per month. Sabira looks after her grandchildren and breeds cattle. She is a widow and, following her neighbors’ advice, began to breed cattle with an initial investment of 10,000 KGS. Now she makes 1,500 KGS per month. She would like to use the loan to purchase hay for her cattle. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a personal computer for her son to use in school

loans.name: Fotu

texts.en:
Fotu L. is 46 years-old and married with two children (aged 12 and 15 years-old).  She owns a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Fotu has many years of experience in this business.  Fotu needs a loan of WST $1,750 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2007, Fotu joined Kiva partner SPBD.  This is her four loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fotu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii andTonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops.

loans.name: 2000 Poty Group

texts.es:
Este comité se denomina 2 000 Poty, están en el Primer Ciclo con 10  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable.
Tienen un gran espíritu emprendedor, y lo demuestran realizando actividades para recaudar fondos y asi estar al día con las cuotas. 
Son muy activas y trabajadoras, y solicitan el crédito cada una para destinarlos a sus actividades y para otros gastos de la familia.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Hilda quien se dedica al negocio de compra de varios productos de uso de hogar.
Ella compra la producción de sus compañeras y los ofrece en su negocio de esta manera ayuda también a las demás integrantes para que puedan contar con un ingreso para sus familias.
Ella solicito el préstamo para la compra de leche, huevos, quesos, frutas y verduras, carne.
texts.en:
This group is called "2000 Poty." They are in their first loan cycle, and the group has 10 members. As a group in their neighborhood, they stand out as being very united, cooperative and responsible. They have a great entrepreneurial spirit, and they demonstrate it carrying out activities to make money so as to keep up with their payments. They are very active and hardworking, and they are each requesting a loan to use in their business activities, and in some cases to cover family expenses. One of the members is Hilda, who has a business selling a variety of household products. She buys products made by her fellow group members and offers them for sale in her store. In this way she also helps the other members so that they can count on an income for their families. She requests a loan to buy milk, eggs, cheese, fruit, vegetables and meat.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy eggs, milk, meat and other products

loans.name: Los Triunfadores Del Rimac Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lo conforman nueve personas un varón y ocho mujeres todos ellos se esfuerzan día a día para salir adelante cada uno con su negocio. Prosperar es uno D. sus tantos objetivos que tienen tal es el caso D. Epifania quien es una mujer muy trabajadora, a raíz D. la separación que tuvo con su esposo empezó a trabajar vendiendo comida en una carreta cerca D. su casa, fue su suegra quien la motivó hacer esto, ella también es microempresaria.
Hace nueve años empezó a vender tunas (fruta D. la sierra) donD. se extrae D. la penca la cochinilla, parásito muy utilizado en dar color a prendas textiles. Esta fruta lo vendía D. casa en casa ofreciendo, iba además por los mercados. También trabajaba como empleada doméstica esto lo hacía desD. muy joven nos cuenta.
Con el primer crédito que recibió compró los insumos para hacer lo que tenía en mente cachangas, café, pollo frito; fue captando clientes con el tiempo es así que ha aumentado más en capital y actualmente por la buena sazón que tiene para sus comidas la contratan para cocinar en ciertos eventos como cumpleaños, aniversaR..
Este negocio le ha ido bien hasta el momento supo educar a sus hijos con el ingreso D. estas ventas, así mismo construyó su casa en el terreno que heredó D. sus padres fallecidos. Sus hijos son profesionales, tiene un último hijo D. 14 años quien aún estudia en la escuela. Necesita invertir en los insumos para seguir vendiendo anticuchos, pescado frito, cachangas, dado a que está cerca el aniversario D. país Perú y habrá muchos turistas por la zona.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of nine people, one man and eight women. All of them strive day to day to get ahead in their businesses. To prosper is one of the objectives that they have. That is the case with Epifania, a very hard-working woman. Upon separating from her husband she started to work selling food from a cart close to her house. It was her mother-in-law who urged her to do this. She is also a small businesswoman. Nine years ago she started selling prickly pears (fruit of the mountain range). She extracts the cochineal insect, a parasite that is often used to give color to clothing fabrics, from the pulpy part. She sold this fruit by going door to door and at the markets. She also worked as a domestic employee, which she says she has done since she was very young. With the first loan that she received she bought supplies to make “cachangas” (a type of bread maD. from wheat flour), coffee, and fried chicken. In time she was attracting customers. That is how she has increased her capital. Now, because of the good seasoning that her food has, she has been hired to cook for special events like birthdays and anniversaries. This business has gone well for her. With her income from these sales she knew to give her children an education. At the same time she built a house on land that she inherited from her deceased parents. Her children are professionals. Her last son is 14 years old, and he is still in school. She needs to invest in supplies to continue selling kebobs, fried fish, and cachangas. The anniversary of the country of Peru is near, and there will be lots of tourists in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies: chicken, fish, and beef heart to make her kebobs

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en: Patricie is 42 years old; she has 5 children aged 14-23 years. Three of her children are in primary school, one is in secondary school, and the last one does not attend school due to a failure to pay school fees. Patricie owns a store in which she sells a few home items, such as soap, matches and condoms. She has done this business for two years and she is requesting a loan in order to increase her inventory. With the profits she plans to pay for all of the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is married with a housewife and four children. One child is married and two still attend school. He has been operating his poultry business for the last seven years, and sells in a shop and at the market to restaurant operators. Previously, he was a carpenter.

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase chickens to increase his stock. Hamisi faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to be a wholesale marketer in future. 

He is working with Yehu after learning its procedures and that it is community-based. He owns a home with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and medicine.

loans.use: To purchase chickens to increase stock.

loans.name: Ena Paola

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

La señora Ena tiene 22 años y es madre soltera de una hermosa bebe de 7 meses de nacida, vive con su pequeña en la casa de sus padres, en la cual viven 5 personas ya que tiene un hermano menor. Dice que su vida ha sido muy difícil por su condición pero que poco a poco está saliendo adelante.

Tiene un pequeño puesto en su casa donde vende frutas y verduras, trabaja desde 6am hasta las 16h00, trabaja sola y comparte su tiempo entre su trabajo y el cuidado de su hija a pesar de que su mama le ayuda, compra sus productos en Portoviejo ya que allá los consigue mas baratos y de mejor calidad para brindar a sus clientes lo mejor y es por eso que la prefieren.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar mas productos para surtir mejor su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya 4 ciclos y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de realizar.
 
Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su pequeña y construir una casa para ella.
texts.en:
The Family Community Bank meets every 15 days in a town called Colorado, a few minutes from Montecristi. Most of the people in this area run businesses in different industries such as manufacturing tagua (type of vegetable ivory, an alternative to animal derived ivory) buttons, crafts, and general trade. Ena is 22 years old and a single mother of a beautiful 7-month-old baby. She lives with her daughter in her parents' house, along with 5 other people and her younger brother. She says that her life has been very difficult in her situation but she is slowly moving forward. She has a small stall in her home where she sells fruits and vegetables from 6 am to 4 pm. She works alone and divides her time between working and caring for her daughter, although her mother also helps out. She buys her products in Portoviejo because they are cheaper and better there, so she can offer her customers the best. This loan will be used to buy more products to better stock her business. Ena has belonged to the Communal Bank for 4 loan cycles and she likes it because payments can be made easily. Her dreams are to build a house and provide the best for her little daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bananas, papayas, coconuts, watermelons, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana, tiene 29 años, es una mujer luchadora y ambiciosa, vive en su casa propia junto a  su esposo y sus 3 hijos en el pueblo de Llanco. Cada mañana se levanta temprano para poder vender la arveja que siembra en el mercado central de su ciudad. Hace ya 10 años que se dedica a la agricultura y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, pues así podrá vender mucho más. En su localidad no existen muchos agricultores que venden al menudeo, es por ello que Susana está juntando capital para comprar su propio terreno y sembrar mayor variedad de verduras. Es el primer crédito con MFP y esta feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas, abono y fertilizantes para la arveja que cultivará.
texts.en: Susana is 29 years old, a fighter and very ambitious woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and 3 children in the town of Llanco. Every morning she wakes up early to be able to sell her crops of peas in the central market of her town. For 10 years she has devoted herself to agriculture and what she likes most about her job is to reap what she sows, since she will be able to sell much more. In her community there are not a lot of farmers that sell retail, and this is why Susana is putting together the capital to buy her own land and to sell a larger variety of vegetables. This is her first loan with MFP and she is happy to belong to the communal bank. With the loan she is requesting she will purchase seeds, manure and fertilizers for the peas she will plant.

loans.use: purchase pea seeds, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is 53 years old and a father of four.  Besides being a farmer, he provides computer services such as photocopying for a fee. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has developed an open mind for business.  He hopes to have a fully established cyber café in the future.  He has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a photocopier and USB device.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier and USB

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a widowed lady with two children. To raise her family, she sells second-hand clothes in her shop, W. New Arrivals. It has been eight years since she started the business. She also does farming so as to earn extra income.  

She hopes to grow her business into a wholesale one in the future. She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy blouses, skirts, trousers, jeans and jackets.

loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts, trousers, jeans and jackets

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith N. lives in the Makerere Kikoni neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Edith has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for five years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Edith sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. Edith has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. She also generates additional income through a small restaurant. The main business challenges for Edith include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler.  Edith lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa M. is a single parent taking care of one child. She has been cooking rice for sale in Elmina for six years. Her husband is a mason. Adjoa uses her income to see to the well-being of her home. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase extra bags of rice and other ingredient to cook to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase extra bags of rice and other ingredients

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
N. Alice lives in the Kyebando neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has six children, all of whom are in school. Alice now operates a retail shop, having changed her business enterprise from a food stall.  She has been in this business for more than a few months, and she works seven days out of every week. She sells her products from home at retail prices. 

Alice has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Alice include seasonality and transportation.

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to open a wholesale shop and also educate her children up to university level. Alice lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana, de 22 años  de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su madre y dos hermanos, está soltera y no tiene hijos, en su hogar todos trabajan y aportan para cubrir los gastos diarios, por su parte administra una  tienda, que logro instalar por la ayuda de su madre, no tiene un horario fijo; por el momento su dificultad es que no cuenta con dinero para reinvertir en mercadería.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como detergentes, productos alimenticios como pastas, arroz, frijol, salsas, entre otros que son parte del inventario de su negocio, con esta ayuda estará fortaleciendo la tienda para atender de una mejor manera a los clientes.
Sueña con tener un negocio amplio, surtido en mercadería, con mucha demanda y formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
22-year old Anaa lives in El Transito, in the department of San Miguel, with her mother and two siblings. She is single and doesn’t have any children. Everyone in the household has a job and contributes to daily expenses.

Ana runs a store which she started with help from her mother. She doesn’t have a fixed schedule. The problem she has at the moment is a lack of money to buy merchandise, so she is seeking a loan for this purpose. She wishes to buy detergent, and food items like pasta, rice, beans, sauces etc. With this financial help Ana will be improving the store and providing a better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy detergent, pasta, rice, beans, sauces

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 40-year-old married man living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is an ambitious man who longs to educate his children and build a permanent house. He has worked in lumbering for six months now and the business is almost breaking even. His business dream is to plant trees. Christopher is requesting a loan to buy a piece of land to plant trees.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to plant trees

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoulaye N. est un agent commercial de profession dans une société de la place. Il habite dans la localité de Camberene. Il est âgé de 32 ans. En même temps monsieur N. pratique la vente de cartes  de crédit. Il a une expérience d’environ 3 ans dans ce domaine. Il est membre du guichet de Camberene  depuis avril 2009. Il sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs. L’objet de son emprunt est d’investir dans son activité en renforçant  son stock. Ce financement lui permettra d’augmenter ses gains et de mieux gérer ses besoins sociaux.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye N. is a sales person by profession in a local company. He lives in the town of Camberene and is 32 years old. He also sells prepaid cards. He has about three years of experience in this domain.  

Abdoulaye has been a member of the Camberene branch office since April 2009. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs. The goal of his loan is to invest in his business by bolstering his stock of goods. This financing will enable him to increase his profits and to meet the demands of society better.

loans.use: Increasing his working capital

loans.name: Ondina De Los Ángeles

texts.es: En la ciudad de Masaya del Departamento de Masaya, tiene un negocio de taller de Zapatería la señora Ondina de los Angeles
texts.en: Mrs. Ondina de los Ángeles

loans.use: To buy patent leather, yellow and white glue, Bontex cushioned insoles, and soles.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 28-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a fishing business. She lives in the municipality of Medellin, Cebu.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her general store and fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000.  Alicia is borrowing PHP 24,000 to purchase more products and a new engine for her fishing boat.  This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Alicia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more products and a new engine for a fishing boat

loans.name: Upendo Mloganzira Group

texts.en:
Upendo F., who is in her early thirties, is married with two children. For the past year, her business has been selling second-hand shoes from door to door. She works from 11:00am to 4:00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Upendo's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes for a loan to increase her capital. Her dream is to open a shop and start selling shoes in one place.

Upendo will share this loan with her loan group Upendo Mloganzila. The group has a total of 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

In the picture Upendo is in front holding a baby.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 50 years old, married and has five children. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store located in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells various products such as noodles, detergent soap, etc. She also buys and resells bananas. She goes to the next town to sell bananas.

Isabel requested a loan to purchase bananas and other merchandise to sell. She hopes to have a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and other merchandise to sell

loans.name: Henriette

texts.en:
Henriette is 29 years old and single. She owns a small business selling various styles of clothes from home. She employs one person from her community as a helper and her hours of business are from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. This is her tenth successful year of business.

Henriette has requested a first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing bales of clothes. This loan will allow her to attract more customers, which will help her earn more profit. Henriette plans to use the profit to reinvest in her business and to save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a drum of engine oil,top-up cards, break oil and Oil filters for his business.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Loreta works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Loreta is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Loreta has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas de Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao - Puno, tiene 58 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene  tres hijos (2 independientes).  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Juana trabaja junto con su esposo en el negocio de compra y venta de animales como: ovinos vacunos y porcinos, también cuenta que su hijo les ayuda en la chacra.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace un ciclo.  Su préstamo inicial, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio. 
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, incrementará al capital  de su negocio para comprar una vaca.
Su sueño es mejorar los ganados y así conseguir mejores ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Hermanas de Choquetanca II” (Sisters of Choquetanca II) which is in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 58 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three chidlren (two of whom are independent). Sra. Juana did not receive an education.

She and her husband work together in their business of buying and selling animals such as sheep, cows, and pigs. Their son also helps them on their farm. Juana has worked with Manuela Ramos for one loan cycle. Her first loan in the amount of 500 PEN was invested in her business.

With this new loan of 1000 PEN, she will increase her business capital so that she can purchase a cow. Her dreams include improving her livestock and continuing to earn more income. What she enjoys about her Communal Bank is the convenience of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Hongor

texts.en:
Hongor is 42 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. She manages a consumer goods business at a rented stall at a local market where she sells candles, socks, matches, beauty products, toilet paper, and other items. Hongor’s oldest daughter helps with the family business while her younger three children go to a local secondary school. Hongor’s husband is a herder with 100 animals. Since 2005, Hongor has been raising vegetables to supplement her family’s income. She plants a variety of vegetables for daily consumption including potatoes, carrots, and onions, and is able to harvest tons of vegetables annually.

Hongor started her retail business in 2000 and she has gained much experience. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase goods to sell. Hongor is a hardworking woman who says, “I want to have my own store in the future.”

loans.use: to purchase merchanise to sell

loans.name: San Blás Group

texts.es:
La formacion del comité lo inicio la Sra. Amelia, domiciliada en el Barrio San Blas de la Ciudad de Carapeguá.
“San Blás” fue denominado el comité y actualmente se encuentra en la  novena etapa, con 16 integrantes. Es un grupo de señoras muy responsables, trabajadoras y sacrificadas, ellas se dedican a la realización de diversas actividades.
La Sra. Higinia, es una tejedora que reliza todo tipo de aritulos, es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora, por medio del credito comprara los utensilios que necesite para la elaboracion de sus mercancias, ya sean hilos de todo tipo y los diversos kits de costura.
texts.en:
This committee was founded by Amelia, who lives in San Blas neighborhood, in the city of Carapeguá.  The committee was named 'San Blas' and it is currently in its ninth loan cycle with 16 members.  This is a group of very responsible, hard-working and self-sacrificing ladies who carry out a number of different business activities.

Higinia is a weaver who makes all kinds of goods.  She is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who will use her loan to buy the supplies she needs to make her goods: all kinds of threads and different sewing kits.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies (threads and sewing kits)

loans.name: Las Leonas Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento LAS LEONAS es un banco nuevo  y el Banco está conformado por 9 Integrantes todas son Mujeres  y las señoras se dedican al comercio y venta pollos y otros, y la Sra. DORA es la presidenta del Banco y  tiene un hijo y ella se dedica a la repostería a la elaboración D. galletas empanadas tortas queque, y variedad D. galletas, actividad donD. le v a muy bien y con el préstamo  comprara harina e insumos para la elaboración D. galletas es una persona muy trabajadora y siempre pensando en el bienestar D. su hijo, su deseo es el ve der a su hijo profesional y también poder tener su propia pastelería ya que ahora elabora sus productos y entrega en la zona y también en algunos colegios, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The entrepreneurs loan group Las Leonas (The Lions) is a new group and is comprised of 9 members who are all women. The women work in commerce and sell chickens and other things. Dora is the president of the bank and she has a son and works making cookies, empanadas, pies, cakes and a variety of cookies, a business that is doing very well, and she will use the loan to buy flour and supplies to make cookies. She is a very hardworking person and she is always thinking of the well being of her son. Her wish is to see her son become a professional and also to have her own cake store as she currently makes her goods and delivers them in the area and to some schools. She is grateful to the loan institution for the support offered to her.

loans.use: to buy flour to make cookies and tarts.

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en:
Cuong is 53 years old. She is married and and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and two children. Her husband is a bricklayer, which is a job that brings in an irregular income.
Cuong started a noodles sales business in 1991 in order to generate a stable daily income for her family. She is requesting a loan to repair her noodle stall, buy more furniture and buy raw materials for her business. Cuong hopes that through the loan her business will be able to attract more customers and generate a higher income to support her family.

loans.use: to repair her noodle stall, and buy more furniture and raw materials for her noodle business.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is in his forties, married and the father of two. He is a grateful farmer earning an average of 75,000 PHP by growing and selling corn used to support his family’s immediate needs and the studies of his children.

Elias has grown corn for fifteen years now. He does a lot of things to maintain it well. He is asking for a loan amount of 30,000 PHP that will be used to acquire fertilizer, insecticides and to pay for labor and the preparation of his land. He hopes to improve his harvest in the coming season.

In the future, Elias dreams of ensuring his family’s financial stability and comfortable living through his farming business.

loans.use: to acquire fertilizer, insecticides and to pay for labor and the preparation of his land.

loans.name: Neyda Fabiola

texts.es:
Neyda Fabiola tiene 27 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los tres hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE, se encuentra ubicada recinto EL ROSARIO, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol.

Neyda fabiola se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol . Compra sus productos en Comercial Guzman en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol, para la compra de abonos, insumos y semillas para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es superarse y trabajar mas. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear y se considera una persona emprendedora y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Neyda Fabiola, 27, lives with her husband and three children in Los Rios province.

The V.R.C. SAN JOSE is located near EL ROSARIO in the canton of Ventanas.  The group funds farming businesses and its members make their living growing maize, rice and beans.

Neyda Fabiola grows maize, rice and beans.  She buys supplies at Comercial Guzman in Ventanas and sells her crop at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

She is applying for a loan to buy supplies for her next crop of maize, rice and beans.  She will buy seeds, manure and other supplies that she needs for the business.  Your loan will help her buy the supplies she needs to sustain the business.  She faces challenges such as plant diseases and insects.  Her greatest wish is to continue working and getting ahead.

In her spare time, she likes to see her friends.  She is considered a hard-working, enterprising woman.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Security Group

texts.en:
Mainda, who is in her mid 30s, is married with three children who go to school. She takes care of her mother as well. She has been running a general store for four years now. She works from 8 a.m to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to run and expand her general store and bought a Bajaji house expenses. She has paid back all of her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to start another business of selling tea masala (containing ingredients cardamon, cinnamon, gider and tea). Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Security" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To sell tea masala (containing ingredients cardamon, cinnamon, gider and tea).

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y administra una tienda, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, desde hace 4 años está en el negocio, de este ha logrado contribuir para los gastos del hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para la tienda, como pastas, boquitas, bebidas, detergentes, y otros productos que agregar para los clientes, esto le ayudara para que los clientes la prefieran y consuman de sus productos.
La aspiración de María es agregar la venta de gas, a sus negocios, tener un lugar amplio donde pueda atender las tres ocupaciones, además quiere apoyar a sus hijos y que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
María sells tortillas and manages a shop. She lives with her husband and 2 children. She has had the business for 4 years and with it has managed to contribute towards the household expenses.

Cuirrently, she is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for the store such as pasta, snacks, beverages, detergents and to add other products for her customers. This will ensure that the customers prefer her store and buy her products.

Maria's aspiration is to add the sale of gas to her business and have spacious premises where she can take care of all three businesses. She also wants to support her children so that they can excel.
.

loans.use: to buy pasta, snacks, beverages and detergents for the business

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 64 years old, married and the father of several children, all of whom are married. For the last 20 years, he has earned a living by running a food kiosk. He was introduced to KADET by one of our clients and is applying for his first loan, which he will use to buy more items to sell to his customers and buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. In future, he hopes to own a large shop and be a very successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers and supplies for his farm.

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aracely de 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Aracely desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y aves de corral, sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada,  pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados para seguir engordando a sus animales y seguir ofertándolos a sus clientes, con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Aracely es una persona trabajadora, responsable y con muchas ganas de que su familia se supere cada día más.
texts.en:
Aracely, 24 years old, lives with her husband and children in their own home. They have electricity but no running water, since their home is located in a rural area of Tambogrande, in the department of Piura. This area is known for its agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.

For four years Aracely has been raising and selling sheep and barnyard fowl. Her pens, which are spacious and functional, are behind her house. She gives her animals balanced feed, grains, and grasses so they'll grow quickly and she can sell them in the regional markets. The profits she makes from selling the animals allow her to cover her family obligations.

She has requested a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed to keep fattening her animals and selling them to her customers. She will use her earnings to pay off the loan and improve her family's life. Aracely is a hard-working, responsible person who wants to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Hajran Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Hajran Bibi is 46 years old and married with six children: two daughters and four sons. Her daughters help Hajran in her sewing business, and her sons are in school: the eldest son reads in the 7th standard while the others read in 4th, 3rd and kindergarten. 

Hajran and her daughters have done sewing for many years. They receive orders from the neighboring customers and generate income for the family. They all also manage the household chores and take care of the family by fulfilling their needs. 

Hajran’s husband is involved in the business of selling chickens. He supplies chickens to different butcher shops and earns a good profit every month. He has been in this business for many years. 

Hajran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy chickens in a larger quantity to be able to complete the orders of his customers on time and earn maximum profits.

loans.use: to buy chickens for selling.

loans.name: Ramon Efrain

texts.es: Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, es uno de los lugares conocido por clima y condiciones fértiles para siembra y crianza de ganado, lugar donde habita el Señor Ramón ,50 años de edad,  de oficio ganadero, padre de 3 hijos. Comenzó por medio de su padre ellos son originarios de San Juan de Limay un pueblo localizado en las afueras de Estelí, el trabajo desde muy temprana edad, pero en ese entonces por problemas de la guerra tuvo que salir de ahí  e irse  a vivir a la ciudad de Estelí lugar donde aprendió hacer muebles pero el sentía que quería volver a sus raíces así que vendió su casa de Estelí y se fue a vivir a Pueblo Nuevo a comprar un terreno para empezar desde cero , comenzó sembrando hortalizas , criando ganado. Hoy en día su padre y sus hijos lo ayudan a criar ganado el comercializa su producto en Pueblo Nuevo. Realizo el crédito para comprar dos vacas paridas, para ayudarse a la reproducción de reses y producir leche para vender. Ya que una de sus metas es comprar un terreno para siembra para ampliar sus siembras y sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí Municipality, is one of the places known for its climate and soil fertile for farming and livestock raising.  It’s the place where Ramón, 50, lives.  

He raises cattle and is the father of three children.  He started out thanks to his father.  They are originally from San Juan de Limay, a town located in the outskirts of Estelí.  He’s worked since he was very young.  However, back then he had to leave there and move to Estelí due to the war and he learned how to make furniture there.  He then moved to Pueblo Nuevo to buy a piece of land and start again from zero.  He started growing vegetables and raising cattle.  Today, his father and children help him care for the cattle that he sells in Pueblo Nuevo.

He took out the loan to buy two nursing cows to help him breed cattle and produce milk to sell since one of his goals is to buy a piece of farmland to expand his crops so that his children will have a better future.

loans.use: to buy two nursing cows.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Amelita has a retail shop where she sells clothing like T-shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Amelita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Amelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is married and blessed with two children, one of whom is in school. He has been operating a motorbike transport business to support his family and he also is a poultry farmer to supplement his income. James has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. 

James is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy a motorbike. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr:
Sophie est une femme marié âgée de 48 ans et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis 05/03/2009.

Elle fait du petit commerce avec la vente de tissus et de lait caillé.

Madame dispose d une  bonne expérience dans son domaine pour y avoir exercé depuis plusieurs années.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 300000 francs Cfa elle va acheter 5 rouleaux de tissus et du lait caillé qu'elle va revendre au détails.

Les bénéfices qu elle va faire lui permettront de résoudre ses petits besoins financiers tels que la scolarité de son enfant et l alimentation de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sophie is a 48-year-old married woman, mother of one child. She is a member of the "Banc Villageois" association since 5 March 2009.

She is a retail merchant selling clothing fabrics and milk curd, and has accumulated several years of experience in this field.

With her new loan of 300,000 CFA francs she will buy five rolls of fabric and milk curd, and then retail her products.

Her foreseen profits will enable her to resolve her small financial needs such as paying tuition fees for her child and feeding her family.

loans.use: buy fabrics and milk curd

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wesakulila Group in Western Kenya! Rose is the facilitator of the Wesakulila group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had a good maize yield harvesting 13 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rose was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Rose will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 39 years old. She is married and has six school-age children. Eugenia is from Dalapang, Ozamiz City.

To make a living, Eugenia raises crops. She plants and harvests root crops to sell. Eugenia has been in business for 10 years and earns 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Eugenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Eugenia is requesting a loan of 6,970.26 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children and to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Zulay

texts.en: With the help of her first Kiva loan, Zulay was able to purchase fertilizers and also managed to buy one cow. Now she is applying for her second Kiva loan in the sum of KGS 100,000 to purchase two milk cows in order to raise her milk sales. In the future, Zulay plans to "broaden her household" by purchasing more cattle.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
My nade is Maria del Carmen and I have had a small cafe in my house for a few years now. I am able to contribute to family expenses and the cost of educating my children. It is the Christmas season and sales increase. I need to supply my business.

Loan Use: Purchase of meats, softdrinks, orange juice, rice, sugar, butter, vegetables, condiments and other supplies.

Mi Nombre es Maria del Carmen cuento con un comerdor, ubicado en mi casa de habitacion, con varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y de estudio de mi familia, ya se aproxima la navidad y el volumente de venta es mayor, necesito abastecer mi negocio.

loans.use: Compra de carnes, lacteos, refrecos, jugo de naranjas, arroz, azucar, manteca, verduras, condimentos y otros.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Madame A. Kossiwa was born April 19, 1950 in Tsevie. Her husband has left her with the care of five children. Even though she never attended school, she is a master of her work. Her dynamism has allowed her to begin sales of "Kom" that, today, is what allows the survival of her family. She is asking for a loan of $750.00 to stock corn which will be used to make "Kom." She will also be able to sell during the "stopping season." With her profits, she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame A. Kossiwa est née le 19 avril 1950 à Tsévié. Son mari décédé à laissé à sa charge cinq enfants. Quand bien même qu’elle n’a pas été à l’école, elle a une maîtrise de son activité. Son dynamisme lui a permis d’initier la vente de « Kom » qui aujourd’hui, fait survivre la famille. Elle sollicite un crédit de $750 pour faire un stock de maïs qui doit lui servir dans la préparation du met. Elle pourra aussi en vendre en période de soudure. Avec ces revenus, elle pense améliorer les conditions d’existence de toute la famille.

loans.use: Stock and sales of corn.

loans.name: Irma Alicia

texts.en:
Irma Alicia is a single mom with 5 children. In order to support her children and make sure that they receive education, and because their father does not pay the much needed alimony, Irma decided to start her own business selling clothes. She then switched to selling chicken, which was much more profitable, and now has more and more clients every day. Since then, she has incorporated more items to her menu such as bates, giblets, escalopes, flautas, salads, etc. Little by little she has seen her business grow with her dedication and effort.

For Irma, it has not been an easy task to raise her 5 children by herself, but she has achieved this with her hard work. Right now she needs a $200 loan to buy merchandise so her business is well supplied and so it can continue to grow. Irma needs your help and she is thankful for your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Irma Alicia es madre soltera de cinco hijos, ante la necesidad de darle sustento y educación a sus hijos, dado que el padre de ellos no les da la pensión que necesitan, Irma decidió iniciar su propio negocio vendiendo ropa, después inició con la venta de pollo, que le empezó a dejar mayores ganancias, y cada día tiene más clientes, ahora ha incorporado más variedad de pollo, bates, menudencias, entero, milanesa, flautas, ensaladas, etc., poco a poco ha hecho crecer con su dedicación y esfuerzo.

No ha sido fácil para Irma sacar adelante a sus cinco hijos ella sola, pero con su trabajo lo ha logrado, en estos momentos requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, para tener bien surtido su negocio y poder continuar creciendo con él. Ella necesita de tu ayuda, y agradece tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 30 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works as a farmer. She makes napkins and table cloths, which she subsequently embroiders and sells in the city of San Cristobal, at two hours traveling from her home. She belongs to the group "Espina 5". With the loan, she wants to buy thread and cloth to increase her production and make more money.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

ANTONIA TIENE 30 AÑOS , CASADA, 3 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE SERVILLETAS, MANTELES Y LUEGO LOS BORDA PARA VENDERLOS EN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL A DOS HORAS DE SU CASA.PERTENECE AL GRUPO ESPINA 5. ESPERA CON SU PRESTAMO COMPRAR HILOS , TELA PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION Y GANAR MAS.

loans.use: to buy thread and cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Renovate her food stall and add stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in many different types of merchandise

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is a native of Colpar, an annex in the Quilcas District in Huancayo. Juan has always opted to make his life in his land, and work hard and grow with it. That is how he decided to rear cows and bulls and dedicate himself to agriculture. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time for he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background, and now he is in charge of handing down all that experience to his children. His immense wishes for self-improvement, despite having encountered terrible times of crisis due to inclement winter weather that struck his growing fields on more than one occasion, have led him to choose to intensify his means of making a living. For this reason, he would like to buy cows with the hope of increasing his income and the well-being of his home with the innumerable benefits that these special little animals provide him. Extend your solidarity to Juan so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish each one of his proposed plans.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Juan, es natural de Colpar, un anexo del Distrito de Quilcas en Huancayo, siempre optó por apostar por su tierra, para forjarse y desarrollarse en ella. Así fue como decidió criar vacas y toritos y dedicarse a la agricultura y hace mucho tiempo que se viene dedicando a estas labores, pues él proviene de una familia netamente agricultora y ahora se ha convertido en el encargado de transmitir toda esa experiencia a sus hijos.Sus inmensos deseos de superación a pesar de haber enfrentado terribles épocas de crisis económica debido a la inclemencia del invierno que azotó en más de una oportunidad sus campos de cultivo, lo llevan planear la intensificación de su labor ganadera y es por esta razón que desea comprar vacas con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos económicos y el bienestar de su hogar con los innumerables beneficios que le otorgan día a día estos especiales animalitos.Solidarízate con Don Juan para que siga adelante y cumpla cada una de los planes que se ha propuesto.

loans.use: Buy more cows with the hope of increasing his income and the well-being of his family.

loans.name: Sofía  Del  Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Martinez works selling dairy products since she was very young; she's been working alongside her parents since she turned 8 years old.

With the loans she obtained from CEPRODEL she has been able to set up her business better and offer a variety of products to her customers.

In addition, the loans allow her to buy in cash and thus offer a better price to her customers.

One of her goals is to progress little by little in her business which will allow her a better quality of life as well as improving her house's roof.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. M. se dedica a la actividad de venta de productos lácteos desde muy pequeña quien tiene que trabajar con sus padres desde que cumple los ocho años de vida.

Con los financiamientos que obtiene de CEPRODEL le han permitido el acondicionar mejor su negocio , ofrecer una variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Además los financiamiento le permiten la compra en efectivo y ofrece un mejor precio a sus clientes.

Una de sus metas es ir progresando poco a poco en su negocio lo que permite un mejor nivel de vida familiar así como mejorar el techo de su local.

loans.use: Buying materials for her business (Compra  de materiales para su negocio)

loans.name: Mariela

texts.en:
MarieL. is twenty-eight years old and a budding entrepreneur.  She sells silver jewelry to the women in her neighborhood, and happily says her products are sold just as quickly as she can stock them.  MarieL. operates her business predominantly from her childhood home, but also visits regular customers at their homes.  

MarieL. plans on buying new and exclusive items – more expensive necklaces, bracelets, and earrings – that she believes will sell at a greater profit than her current inventory.  MarieL. explains that with her business’s continued growth, she hopes that someday she’ll be able to buy her own home.

loans.use: To purchase new necklaces, bracelets, earrings, and other jewelry for sale.

loans.name: Flor Consuelo

texts.es:
Flor Consuelo is 73 years old and has five children, none of whom are still dependent on her. She was only able to attend school until the 5th graD.. From the time she was independent, she looked for ways to work or have her own business. But when she married, her husband earned a sufficient salary to cover their household expenses.

Ten years ago, when her husband died, she realized she needed to go back to work. She began by selling stuffed potatoes and tamales to her friends and neighbors. She traveled often to her home town, where her friends were requesting many items they could not find in that zone. She began expanding the merchandise she offered.

She is part of the communal bank called Mujeres del Milenium, from whom she received her first loan for her business. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy more stock such as tablecloths and sheets, charcoal and wool, as well as school supplies because the school term is beginning.

La señora Flor Consuelo Y. D. T. tiene 73 años D. edad, sólo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado D. primaria. Tiene cinco hijos pero ninguno depenD. D. ella. Vive en el distrito D. Trujillo en la provincia D. la misma en el departamento La Libertad. DesD. que se independizó siempre ha buscado la manera D. trabajar en algo o tener su propio negocio, pero cuando se casó dejo D. hacerlo ya que su esposo era jefe D. campamento y recibía un sueldo muy aceptable con el cual cubría todas sus necesidades. Hace 10 años que él falleció y ella se vio en la necesidad D. volver a trabajar empezó vendiendo papa rellena y tamales el cual ofrecía a sus vecinos y conocidos, constantemente viajaba a su ciudad natal; amigos y mucha gente que conocía le hacían pedidos D. acuerdo a las necesidades que existe hasta ahora en la zona; frazadas, chompas abarrotes y otros. Así también venD. briquetas y leña (materiales que sirve para cocinar los alimentos). Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres del Milenium” lugar donD. recibió su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro panteones, por ese tiempo se acercaban las fiestas naviD.ñas. Con el préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 que lo pagara en 4 meses comprará media docena D. frazadas, una docena D. mantas y sabanas, 1 millar D. briquetas y 600 rajas D. leña. Además comprara útiles escolares ya que se aproxima la época colegial. La señora Flor sueña con comprar una moto para que lo trabaja su hijo en la sierra ya que es D. mucha necesidad para los pobladores D. la zona

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: SINCE HER HUSBAND DIED 10 YEARS AGO,  FLOR CONSUELO NEEDED TO GO BACK TO WORK AT THE AGE OF 73.  SHE WILL USE THE LOAN TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Rajya Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Rajya laxmi S. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband, Raju S., and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in primary school.

Mrs. S. and her husband opened a grocery shop seven years ago. They sell different types of grocery items in their shop, but due to a lack of funds they cannot purchase enough goods. So to expand their business Mrs. S. is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 ($US175) to buy grocery items. The shop is their only source of income and both of them work very hard to make their business a success. Mrs. S. wants to provide a better education for her daughter with their increased income

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop.

loans.name: Happyness

texts.en: Happyness M. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 38 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of three and 18.  She also cares for seven dependents, who live with her because they are disabled.  In 2003, Happyness established her timber selling business with the help of SELFINA, an organization that works towards the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback agreements. Happyness now requires a new loan of $425 in order to buy more timber stocks.

loans.use: To buy more stock of timber in bulk.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is an entrepreneur from the western Ukrainian city of Mukachevo. She has a small space at a market near the bus station in Mukachevo, where she sells women’s clothing. Ludmila has been in business for about six years. She is hard-working, honest, and disciplined in her business. She has a strong desire to work and work well. Ludmila is married and has children who are grown.

Ludmila has requested a loan of 4000 Ukrainian Griven to invest in purchasing new inventory. We are happy to have this opportunity to assist her with her business and look forward to her continued success.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
The RENACER committee is located in the Fatima neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo. The committee has worked with the Paraguayan Women's Foundation Committee Program for more than two years. This is their seventh cycle, and they do excellent work.

This group fosters a spirit of soliderity, as they are located in a poor area where there is great need for medical assistance and educaiton.

Thanks to this group, several comissions have been formed in their neighborhoods which actually manage various projects which beautify the neighborhoods. They hope to complete these projects this year.

They dream of a better quality of life for their children, and of opening and institute where young people might learn professions so that they can obtain dignified employment.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

El comité RENACER pertenece al barrio Fátima de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. Se encuentran trabajando con el Programa Comité de Mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya por más de dos años. Están en el séptimo ciclo y realizan una labor de grupo excelente.

Las señoras se dedican a actividades diversas como la costura, venta de carteras y cosméticos, despensas, venta de bebidas, ropas, lencerías, edredones, etc.

En el grupo se fomenta la solidaridad ya que se encuentran en una zona de pobreza donde hay mucha necesidad en cuanto a asistencia médica y educación.

Gracias a este grupo, se formaron varias comisiones en los barrios donde ellas viven que actualmente manejan distintos proyectos para hermosear los barrios, ellas esperan concluir estos proyectos este año.

Sueñan con tener una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos y realizar un instituto donde los jóvenes aprendan profesiones para poder tener u trabajo digno.

loans.use: Purchase of winter clothing, cosmetics such as lotions and perfume, and various merchandise for sale including sugar, milk, meat, dairy products, soft drinks, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Alida Elsa

texts.es:
Alida is a young woman with a lot of dreams and hopes, among them to have her own family. She's 24 years old now and she's been farming since she was a young girl. She grows grasses for feeding livestock, something she's been doing now for 4 years; she also grows vegetables such as lettuce and onions and, sometimes, potatoes. Most of her income comes from selling grasses for livestock feed. She's applying for this loan so that she can increase her production and, in turn, her income. She will invest in sacks of manure and fertilizer that she needs to cultivate her next crop. Let's support Alida so that she can continue with her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Alida es una joven con muchos sueños y anhelos, entre ellos está el de formar una familia, tiene actualmente 24 años, desde su niñez se ha dedicando a las tareas agrícolas, cultivando principalmente forraje para ganado, viene haciendo esto hace 4 años, también cultiva diferentes verduras como lechuga y cebolla china; y ocasionalmente la papa. Sus mayores ingresos están en la venta de forraje, para producir en mayor cantidad a fin de obtener más ganancias, solicita por este medio, un préstamo que será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono y fertilizante necesarios para la temporada de siembra. Apoyemos a Alida a seguir adelante en sus proyectos.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for farming business.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia G., a 60-year-old merchant, is married with nine kids. Five of them are currently schooling and four have completed college. She sells cereals such as maize and rice on top of a table in the local market. She is requesting a loan to enable her to buy an increased stock of maize and rice to grow her business and scale up her sales.

Afia says her major challenge has to with the kids' school fees. She hopes to increase her savings to support the kids' education to give them better future career opportunities. She belongs to the community group called Corn Buyers Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more maize and rice for re-sale

loans.name: Mkufu's Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en:
Mkufu, 49, is a widow with five children. She has sold juice and handbags since 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Mkufu has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Mkufu is now looking for a another loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Miraji, who also sells snacks.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Tit

texts.en: Tit R., 32, is married and lives with three children and her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2006, she has worked selling groceries to earn a living and is able to make about US$5 per day, while her husband works selling coconuts to earn approximately US$5 as well. Mrs. Tit R. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to diversify her groceR. inventoR..

loans.use: To diversify her grocery inventory.

loans.name: Toy

texts.en:
Mr. Toy N. is 42 years old and lives in the Ptasrong Commune in Pursat Province. He is a local farmer who grows rice and vegetables, and he has had much experience since selecting his work in 1986. His wife, Mrs. Sophal Khoun, 43, is a seller who makes a living selling groceries in her local village, with many regular customers. Sophal cares for five children, all of whom go to school.

Toy has requested a loan of 3,000,000 riel ($750) to buy piglets, a cow, and a cow-cart. The loan will allow him to improve his business and add to his fixed assets.

loans.use: To buy piglets, a cow, and a cow-cart

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith O. owns a phone booth where she makes calls and sell rechargeable phone cards. She hopes to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N40, 000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She is 27 years old and married with 2 children. She says thank you to all those who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Beto Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando  vive en la calle “Manuel caballero”  de la zona villa Adela en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa e hijos. Tanto El como su esposa trabajan como docentes en escuelas de la ciudad.

También poseen un tienda la cual funciona como una pequeña  librería y fotocopiadora.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de una nueva fotocopiadora ya que la que tienen se encuentra en malas condiciones. 
 
Es el segundo   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Orlando lives on “Manuel caballero” Road in the area of villa Adela in the city of El Alto. He lives in his own home with his wife and children. Both he and his wife work as teachers in city schools. They also own a store which functions as a small library and a place to photocopy. He will use the loan to buy a new photocopier as their current one is in bad shape. This is his second loan with Impro; our evaluation qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric A. is married and has 3 children. He has received schooling through senior high. Eric sells video CDs and DVDs at Nyankumasi near Cape Coast, which he has done since 2006. His wife is a petty trader. Eric uses his income to pay for their children’s school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Eric will use the loan as additional capital to enable him to increase the sale of video CDs and DVDs for both foreign and local movies and music to meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Eric plans to reinvest for the expansion of  his business in music and video CDs and DVDs.

loans.use: additional capital to  increase his inventory of video CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en: Kimberly C., 22, single mom of Krizaiah Jen C., ekes out a living by tending a sari sari (variety) store in Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City Southern Philippines. Her mother helped her finance the store. She also is engaged in dried fish retailing once every two weeks. With the help of the loan from HSPFI amounting to PHP14,000  she will be able to expand and put up another store at Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She only wants to give all the care, shelter and good future for her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for the store

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.en: M. Inoyat first applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and has stayed in its loan program to the present day so she trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure.  Inoyat is married with 4 children and she lives in Khujand. She has sold the national Tajik bread named “lepeshky” for 13 years.  Inoyat is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 2000 STJ for 8 months to take advantage of a trade outlet opening so she can trade out of any trading center.  Inoyat thanks KIVA for its support and contribution to the development of small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: trade outlet opening

loans.name: Fuente De Bendicion 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Members of Bank of Hope live in Hato Mayor, Dominican Republic. Their town is very small with few industries or services that generate employment. And although fishing is a largely practiced, it receives little support or funding.

The business activities of these entrepreneurs are varied: juice bar/ice cream shop, cosmetics sales, clothing sales and fish selling. Fish in this area are especially good, caught and sold on the same day.

Lourdes T. is the group coordinator. She sells fish for a living. Lourdes buys fresh fish at the Sabana D. la Mar port, where fishermen offer it after they come from work.
