She takes it home, clean it and sells to customers. Lourdes will use this loan to purchase more fish, which she can freeze if not sold in a short period of time. So far, her sales have been satisfactory. She hopes to increase sales to a level that in time, will allow her to finish building her house.

We'd like to thank you for your support these entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchasing more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Melle maïmouna S. est une fille célibataire qui a 31 ans, elle habite au quartier Diamaguène de Thiès  en face la grande mosquée. Elle est commerçante depuis octobre 1998, son commerce consiste à vendre des denrées alimentaires (sucre + lait en poudre) et aussi des habits  pour hommes et femmes. Elle a déjà intégré l’IMCEC et est à son deuxième prêt avec laquelle elle veut renforce son activité. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice de  80 000 FCFA sur l’ensemble des marchandises. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de rembourser son prêt et satisfaire ses propres besoins sociaux  et le reste elle l’investit dans son commerce.
texts.en:
Miss Maïmouna S. is a single lady of 31; she lives in the Diamaguène neighborhood in Thiès, opposite the big mosque. She has been selling goods since October 1998. She presently sells groceries (sugar and powdered milk) and also clothing for men and women. She has already joined IMCEC and is on her second loan with which she plans to bolster her business. She hopes to make a profit of 80,000 F CFA on the total goods. Her profit will allow her to reimburse her loan and support herself, investing any remainder back into her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering her business

loans.name: Joke

texts.en: Joke is 50 years old and is a widow with three children. Joke is a musician and has a band. She sings at weddings, funerals, and birthday ceremonies. She has been in this business for the past eight years. She hopes for a loan amount of N140,000 to purchase a channel mixer (a musical instrument). She says thank you and promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase a channel mixer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. sells clothing at Abura. Victoria has received a junior high school education.  She is married and has 4 dependents. Her husband is a commercial driver. Victoria has been selling clothing since 2001. She is responsible for paying the housekeeping expenses.  Her loan will be used to buy more clothing for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business to increase her capital and profit.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta A. sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is married with three children and she is forty-six years old. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. Benedicta says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Mahmadkarim

texts.ru: Хайдаров Махмадкарим проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 40 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Махмадкарим более 14 лет работает диспетчером на станции. Помимо этого, он более 9 лет занимается животноводством, т.е. откормом и продажей скота. Его сыновья тоже работают на станции. Клиент просит кредит, для закупа скота и корма. На полученный доход, хочет сыграть свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Mahmadkarim H. lives in the Rumy district. He is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. Mahmadkarim has been working as a dispatcher at a station for over 14 years. Besides this, he has been involved in animal husbandry, i.e. feeding and selling livestock, for over 9 years. His sons also work at the station. Our client is requesting a loan for purchasing livestock and feed. He wants to use resulting profits for his son’s wedding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and feed

loans.name: Jazmines Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Jazmines” con 12 integrantes,  llevan adelante su reunión con la orientación de una de las asesoras.

Todas tienen sus propios  negocios, tales como la  venta de ropa, refrescos, cosméticos, repuestos, comida, ollas, radios, tienda de barrio y costura de chamarras y necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería o materia prima, es el caso de la señora Dina C. de 23 años de edad, casada con un hijo, emprendió su negocio de costura de chamarras  hace 1 año, por la necesidad de mantener a su familia y generarse un ingreso, ella le entrega las prendas a su hermano que tiene un puesto de venta en la plaza “Eguino” y necesita el préstamo para comprar tela y forro.
texts.en:
You will find the community association Jazmines in one of Pro Mujer’s community centers. There are 12 members. They are having a training meeting with one of the advisors. All of them have their own business like selling clothes, soft drinks, cosmetics, replacement parts, food, pots, and radios. Some of them have neighborhood stores and some make jackets. They need a loan to buy merchandise or raw material. For example, Dina C. is 32, married, and she has one child. She started her business of making jackets one year ago. She did this because she needed to support her family and generate an income. She gives the jackets she makes to her brother. He has a sales place in the Eguino plaza. She needs a loan to buy material and lining.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise (clothes, soft drinks, perfume, pots) and raw material (fabric and lining)

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es: El grupo ”Virgen de Copacabana” esta representada por el señor Richard Nelson quien junto a los 12 miembros del grupo van cursando juntos su tercer ciclo demostrando puntualidad, responsabilidad y unidad. Una mayoría de los miembros del grupo se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, venta de comida, carnes frías y actividades como la construcción y la confección de prendas de vestir, los socios se encuentran en constantes viajes para acomodar su mercadería ya que su mayor mercado se encuentran en provincias alejadas de la ciudad. El propósito de este nuevo financiamiento es para incrementar su materia prima como tela y material de construcción y mercadería como mas ropa para poder abarcar a todas las provincias lejanas y así poder tener mayores ingresos para darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. El nivel competitivo es alto en los mercados centrales es por esta razón que se ven forzados a sacar su mercadería a las diferentes provincias de la ciudad buscando mercados donde no haya tanta competencia. En relación a la experiencia crediticia se encuentran juntos desde el primer ciclo en la institución por lo que conocen claramente de crédito solidarios.
texts.en:
The group “Virgen de Copacabana” is represented by Señor Richard Nelson, who along with the twelve members of his group, are in their third loan cycle and always demonstrate punctuality, responsibility, and unity. A majority of the members of the group earn their living selling second-hand clothing, food, and cold cuts, or in activities such as construction and dressmaking. The members travel around constantly selling their merchandise as their biggest markets are found in areas a long way from the city. The purpose of this new loan is to obtain more items such as material, building supplies, and clothing so the members can sell in distant areas and earn more money to provide their families with a better quality of life. There is a lot of competition in the central markets so the members are forced to take their products to more distant areas, seeking markets where there is not so much competition. With regard to their experience with credit, the group has been together since the first loan cycle with the institution so they have a good understanding of the group loan system.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operating capital

loans.name: Mirna Gladys

texts.es: Doña Mirna S. de 31 años de edad, reside en Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, casada,  su esposo es técnico forestal, ella tiene dos hijos de 5 y 7 años de edad, estudiante de la primaria. Su negocio es la venta de repostería y ropa, lleva seis años en las ventas el cual inicio con préstamos en pequeño banco comunal, poco a poco ha ido creciendo. Sus planes es poder instalar una repostería en una calle céntrica. Con este crédito va ha reforzar una pared de su casa en la parte inferior lo cual obtendrá mejor seguridad para su familia. Da las gracias a la institución por el préstamo, este es su séptimo ciclo y espera seguir con la institución ya que ha mejorado su negocio como su vida personal.
texts.en:
Mirna S., 31, lives in Laureles Norte in the capital of Managua. She is married, and her husband is a forest technician. She has two children, 5 and 7. They go to elementary school. She sells pastry and clothes. She has been in sales for six years. She started with loans with her small community bank. Little by little, sales have been growing. Her plan is to be able to set up a bakery on a central street. With this loan she will reinforce a wall on the inside part of her house. This will provide better security for her family. She is grateful to the institution for the loan. This is her seventh loan cycle, and she hopes to continue with the institution. Her business, as well as her personal life, has improved.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make a concrete wall

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 32-year-old married man living with his wife and three children. He has been working as a carpenter since 2006 to earn income to satisfy the needs of his family. Today, Ali is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy tools to develop his work.

loans.use: buy tools

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena G. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Lucena is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Lucena owns and operates a specialized retail store, where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Lucena has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lucena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucena is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lucena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family members. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es: María Inés T. reside en San Luis Talpa en el departamento de La Paz. María tiene 63 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con su hijo Aldo de 22 años de edad. María es una mujer sorprendentemente trabajadora ha sacado adelante a su hijo con muchos esfuerzos y sacrificios, actualmente Maria tiene 29 años de tener su negocio, con el que ha obtenido sostenerse todos estos años atrás, actualmente María solicita de un crédito para reinvertir en su tienda la cual aprecia mucho María y piensa trabarjar muchos años más
texts.en:
Maria Ines T. lives in San Luis Talpa, in the department of La Paz. Maria is 63 years old and she is a single mother who lives with her son, Aldo, who is 22 years old. Maria is a surprisingly hard-working woman and she has raised her son through great effort and sacrifice. She has now been working at her business for 29 years, and she has always supported herself through it. Maria currently needs a loan in order to reinvest in her store, which she appreciates a lot and in which she wishes to work for many more years.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To reinvest in her store/reinvertir en su tienda

loans.name: Leifa Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora   Leifa del Carmen V. M. es socia del Banco Comunal Mejía  ubicado en Portoviejo provincia de Manabí, ésta es una de las regiones más hermosas del Ecuador por sus playas y gastronomía.

Leifa  está casada desde hace muchos años, sus hijos son adultos estudian y trabajan en Quito, sólo le  acompaña su hijo menor de 23 años y un nieto de 4 años que ella  acogió cuando sus padres se separaron,  ella y  su esposo se dedican a la agricultura alquilan un terreno para sembrar, maíz, frijoles, entre otros llevan muchos años ejerciendo esta actividad.

Con el préstamo solicitado a la Fundación va a comprar pollos de cría, alimento y vitaminas para su crecimiento para montar un criadero y tener  un ingreso extra de dinero para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

El sueño de Leifa es montar  un negocio de ropa en el centro de la ciudad donde viven, solo que por falta de dinero y por el poco tiempo que le queda porque debe cuidar a su nieto  aun no ha podido cristalizarlo.
texts.en:
Leifa del Carmen V. M. is a member of the Mejía communal bank which is located in Portoviejo, Manabí province. This is one of Ecuador's most beautiful regions due to its beaches and gastronomy. Leifa has been married for many years; her children are adults and study and work in Quito. Only her youngest son, 23, and a 4-year-old grandson, who she has cared for since his parents separated, live with her. She and her husband grow, among others, corn and beans on leased land. They have done this for many years. With the loan which the foundation will grant they plan to buy chickens, feed and vitamins to set up a hatchery which will produce additional income which will help her husband meet family expenses. Leifa's dream is to set up a clothing sales store in the city center where they live but the lack of funds and time (she has to care for her grandson) have prevented this from happening yet.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, feed and vitamins to set up a hatchery.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera is married with one child. She runs a small business selling perfumes, cosmetics, etc. Vera received this business from her parents. During the five years that she has been in it, Vera has been able to develop the business and increase the number of clients as well as monthly sales. Vera's business goal is to grow the business further. She has already used microloans and found them very helpful. This time Vera would like to borrow 15,000 hryvnia to purchase more inventory. Vera will use the additional income to fix the house she lives in with her husband and son.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Batmonh

texts.en:
Batmonh G. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His three teenage children are students in a local secondary school. Batmonh does a small business in carpentry with his wife. He is a talented carpenter who makes traditional wooden furniture for locals. His wife sells his furniture at the local market where she rents a stall for the products. Batmonh has been running a small carpentry shop with one assistant since 2004, his assistant being paid according to his contribution on each furniture project. In addition to his furniture-making business, his family also has a small farm with about 20 pigs and five chickens. They sell the eggs from their chickens and plan to sell their pigs during this year’s New Year celebrations when pork prices peak.

Batmonh says that he would like to expand both his furniture business and his small farm, which can be run by his wife. He is requesting a loan to purchase wood and other necessary materials for his business.

About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase wood and other necessary materials for his business.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie D. C. is from the village of Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old. Analie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Analie owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Analie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Analie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. Analie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Analie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly comprised of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Oktyabr

texts.en: Oktyabr is a 48-year-old single mother who lives with her two children in Chingeltei district, Ulaanbaatar city, which is the capital of Mongolia. She lives together with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. She has two gers. She lives with her youngest daughter in one of them and her oldest son lives with his family in the other one. Oktyabr operates a grocery trading business in her town. She sells a variety of products such as vegetables, fruits, canned products and so on. Oktyabr started her business in 1995 in a rented stall at a local market called "Bumbugur". It is one of the popular and crowded markets in Ulaanbaatar city. Since then, she has built a stable operation and hopes to expand in the near future by expanding her product line. Now her working capital exceeds 2,500,000 tugrugs (~1800 USD) with a monthly net profit of 500,000 tugrugs (~350 USD). She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to purchase vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Boltagro Group

texts.es: El Grupo “Boltagro” esta representado por la señora Felicia y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales casi todos cuentan con la misma actividad, empleados D. una empresa D. semillas D. donD. sale el nombre del grupo, las únicas que cuentan con otro tipo D. rubro son la presidenta que venD. comida a los empleados D. la empresa y algunas D. las socias que venden refrescos y comidas al paso. Dentro D. este ámbito no tienen mucha competencia ya que cada una recibe una renumeración por su trabajo y esfuerzo. El destino del financiamiento es para la construccion D. un galpón D. venta D. comida, la compra D. electrodomésticos para algunas D. las socias  y para la apertura D. pequeños puestos D. venta D. dulces o comida en carritos comerciales ambulantes. A pesar D. ser su primer ciclo muchas D. las socias ya participaron en grupos anteriores y conocen la modalidad D. trabajo y están contentas D. tener un apoyo económico que les ayuD. a mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus hijos y sus familias.
texts.en:
The Boltago Group is represented by Señora Felicia and is maD. up of twelve members, almost all of whom are engaged in the same type of work. They are employees in a business that sells seeds (from which comes the name of the group). The only women who are in a different line of work are the president who sells food to the employees of the business, and some who sell soft drinks and food in the street. There is not much competition in this field for the women as each one receives pay for her work and the effort she puts in. They plan to use the loan money to build a structure from which they can sell food, to buy electrical appliances, and to start small businesses selling candy and food from carts in the street. Although this is their first loan cycle, many of the members have been part of other groups in the past and know how the system works. They are happy to have this financial support to help them improve the quality of their children’s and family’s lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Mr. Kem K. is 37 years old and has been a fisherman along the river for more than ten years. He is married to Mao Dy, 40, who is a fish seller. He always gives the fish that he catches to his wife to sell at the local market for a profit.

Kem K. has a piece of land and he hopes to cultivate crops on it, but he lacks some supplies. Therefore, he requests a loan to buy fertilizer and seed to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to grow

loans.name: Las Florecitas Group

texts.es: El grupo las florecitas realizan bondados a mano y como tambien realizan fajas para damas el cual les ayudado a mantenerce y  a sus hijos a que estudien y ellas relatan que lo han realizo mas de 5 años atras y esto los a sacado a vante y acuden a la asociaciòn Asdir para que se le puedan ayudar  para el incremento de su capital para cubrir los diferentes pedidos que tienen y asi poder ganar y sacar a sus hijos y a la familia avante y tener otro nivel de vida y ellas estan seguro con esta ayuda alcanzaran las metas establecido para este año 2010.-
texts.en:
The group "Las Florecitas" (The Little Flowers) do hand embroidery and also make girdles for women. Their work helps them support themselves and their children who are studying in school. They tell us they have been doing this work for more than five years, and it has allowed them to get ahead in life. They came to the Asociaciòn Asdir so they can increase their business capital to cover the different orders they have. This will allow them to move forward with their children and families and have a higher level of life. They are sure that with this help they will achieve their established goals for this year.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Maryurit Liset

texts.es:
La  Joven Maryurit Liset O. C. es maestra de en un colegio de secundaria en el municipio de Condega.

Ella solicita un crédito el cual va a utilizar para gastos universitarios de su hermano tales como matricula  compra de utensilios escolares. Ella quiere que su hermano tenga una profesión y en un futuro el tenga como valerse por si solo y que sea una persona exitosa.

Maryurit O. empezó a ser maestra desde hace 4 años, ella empieza sus labores desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 12 de medio día y el resto del día ella planea la lección de clase del próximo día. Antes de dedicarse a maestra ella era estudiante.

Ella espera con este crédito financiarle los gastos universitarios a su hermano menor para que en un futuro logre ser un profesional igual que ella y pueda triunfar y logra ser alguien en la vida.

Maryurit O. es una joven casada y no tiene hijos cabe señalar que ella vive con su mama.

Este es el crédito numero dos que Maryurit tiene en Ceprodel en u periodo de tres años  le han beneficiado positivamente ya que le han ayudado a sacar sus estudios adelantes y crecer profesionalmente así como espera ayudarle a sus hermano en sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Maryurit Liset O. C. is a secondary school teacher in the city of Condega. She is asking for funding to pay university expenses for her brother such as: tuition and school supplies. She wants her brother to have a profession so that he can support himself in the future and be a successful person. Maryurit O. has been a teacher for 4 years. Her work day starts at 7am and goes until noon; the rest of the day she prepares her lesson plans for the next day. Prior to becoming a teacher she was a student. She hopes to use the funds to pay for her younger brother's university expenses so that he will become a professional like her in the future and be successful and come into his own in life. Maryurit O. is married and has no children; it's worth mentioning that she lives with her mother. This is her second credit with Ceprodel in a three-year period. The loans have had a positive impact in that they helped her finish her schooling and to grow professionally as she now hopes to help her brother do.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for university expenses (tuition, books, etc.)

loans.name: Lailanie's Group

texts.en:
Lailanie G. is from the village of Sta. Isabel. She is 41 years old. Lailanie is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Lailanie G.'.

Lailanie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lailanie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and for sale. Lailanie has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lailanie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lailanie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the first loan taken out by Lailanie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking and honest woman and she is determined to pull her business and family out of poverty. She is 45 years old and married with six children. She is happy because her children are excelling in school. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. Her husband also works to support their home.

Janet sells foodstuffs like bags of garri (cassava flakes) and she has been in this business for a long time. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger.

Janet is a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) client. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more more bags of garri (cassava flakes) to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 35-year-old father of three. He has a retail shop where he sells maize flour, rice, soap, sugar and cooking fat and has been in this business for three years. He also does construction on a contract basis to earn more income to support his family since he is the breadwinner. He uses part of his income to pay fees for his children.

James is a new member of Faulu Kenya in a group called Destiny which was introduced to him by his friends. He joined the group so as to access loans easily from Faulu Kenya. He has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 to add to his stock of rice, maize flour, soap and cooking fat. He hopes to expand his shop into a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more rice, maize flour, soap and cooking fat

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie A. is from the village of Galas, Dipolog City. She is 49 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Rosemarie owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Rosemarie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials for the construction of a copra dryer (copra is dried coconut meat used for oil production). This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. Rosemarie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the construction of a copra dryer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To operate businesses.

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en:
Oyungerel is a widow who is 46 years old and lives with two daughters and one son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic tent). One of her younger daughters attends the university. Her son, Purevdorj, has just returned from the army so that he might be able to get a job in the city.

Oyungerel operates a fruit and vegetable retail business. She purchases fruit and vegetables from the Narantuul and Bars markets, the two largest markets in Ulaanbaatar, and sells them to people for a profit. Her business is doing very well, thanks partly to help from her daughter. Oyungerel has good communication skills and her business is very important to her. She has many plans for the future, and says, “My aim is to create my own shop by working hard and stabilizing my current business.” She is applying for a loan of 450,000 MNT to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale prices to resell to her many customers.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en: Bakhtiyar Q. is a 38-year-old trader who has sold different kinds of goods in a rented store for the last four years. A hard financial situation and unemployment pushed him to start his own business. His monthly income is 400 AZN and he is working very hard to increase it. He is married and has two sons. Bakhtiyar has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase more goods and expand the number of products he sells in his store.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Maria Narcisa

texts.es:
María de 36 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar habitado por comerciantes informales), ella tiene una tienda pequeña que la ha podido surtir con la ayuda de su esposo. 

María comenzó vendiendo “chifles” (plátanos en rodajas fritas), poco a poco tuvo ingresos para comprar alimentos y venderlos en un puesto. Por esa buena decisión ahora ella tiene una tienda un poco surtida y trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 222h00pm todos los días sus dos hijas le ayudan. 

Ella quiere que su tienda sea una de las mejores del sector por donde vive y para eso necesita comprar con el préstamo azúcar, café. En el futuro ella se proyecta con una tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old, and lives in El Guasmo, Guayaquil (a place where the residents are informal merchants). She has a small store that she has been able to stock with help from her husband. María started out selling “chifles” (fried sliced bananas), and little by little earned enough income to purchase food items and sell them at a stand. Because of this good decision she now has a store with a small selection. She works every day from 7:00 AM until 10:00 PM with help from her two daughters. María wants her store to be one of the best stores in the area where she lives. That is why she needs this loan to purchase sugar and coffee. In the future she plans to have a well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sugar and coffee for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a toilet and building supplies to make a bathroom

loans.name: Jenny Eliana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Jenny pertenece al Banco Comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 40 años.  Jenny nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad junto con su esposo.

Jenny es Ingeniero Zootecnista, ella viaja a las zonas rurales y realiza capacitación a los campesinos de las comunidades.  Jenny compra queso y carne de las comunidades y después vende a sus amistades en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 2 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para construir su casa. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 40 years old and was born in the city of Cusco. Jenny still lives in Cusco with her husband.

She works as a veterinary technician, traveling to rural areas and providing training classes to the residents of these communities. Jenny buys cheese and meat when she is in these communities and sells them to her friends in city of Cusco. She has had this business for two years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. The loan she is requesting will be used to build her house.

Jenny is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana A.  is currently in the business of selling local Sudanese bread such as legemat, gelabia, and tamia, and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour and cooking oil to sell.  Nana is 32 years old and is married with a husband that is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: buying more baking flour and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda V. is from the village of Flores, Naguillan, Isabela. She is 49 years old and married with eight school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda plants and harvests vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI to purchase  seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise and is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP for the same purpose. This will be the second loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Las Leonas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las leonas. El nombre del grupo se debe a que la persona que formo el grupo lleva el apellido León. Está ubicado en Puebla, México.  El grupo está conformado por 8  integrantes.
María P. L. T.   Es la tesorera del grupo. Tiene 45 años, estudió hasta el bachillerato, es casada tiene en total 3 hijos  (dos varones y una mujer).  Ella se dedica a atender una tienda de abarrotes, negocio que inició hace veinte años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercancía, con la finalidad de poder surtir más su negocio para que sus clientes encuentren los productos  que buscan. Sus clientes consideran que es una persona amable y de muy bonito carácter para atenderlas. La  Sra. María P. L. T. se siente respaldada, por que con este préstamo podrá tener productos mas variados ya que la comunidad se encuentra en zona rural y a los habitantes se les complica conseguir de manera inmediata sus víveres. Ella espera que a través de su negocio pueda seguir solventando los gastos de su familia.
 Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
Adriana M. T.		Venta de blancos (colchas, sabanas, cortinas)
Carolina M. C. 		Venta de ropa
Gabriela M. C.		Venta de calzado
Velma O. A. V.		Venta de calzado
Romualda B. A. V.	Tortillas
Fabiola M. S. C.	Venta de blancos
Estela D. A. V.		Venta de comida
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Leonas” because the person who started it has the last name of León. The group meets in Puebla, Mexico, and consists of eight members. María P.L.T. is the group treasurer. She is 45 years old, studied through high school, and is married with three children (two sons and a daughter). María manages a grocery store, a business she started twenty years ago. She is requesting a loan to acquire merchandise in order to stock her business with more of the products that her customers want to buy. They consider María to be a friendly person who displays the nicest personality when attending to them. Sra. María feels she has been supported because this loan will help her provide a wider variety of products to her rural community, thereby giving the residents immediate access to necessities. Through her business, she hopes to continue providing for her family’s expenses.

The other group members are as follows: Adriana M.T. sells linens (bedspreads, sheets, and curtains) Carolina M.C. sells clothing Gabriela M.C. sells shoes Velma O.A.V. sells shoes Romualda B.A.V. sells tortillas Fabiola M.S.C. sells linens Estela D.A.V. sells food

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Esther Deysi

texts.es:
Esther Deysi L. B. tiene 45 anos. Es casado vive con el compañero y un hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.

Esther es una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Esther trabaja en el Colegio Humberto y tiene una tienda donde vende helados y trabaja con el esposo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es ponerse un  local y comprar una casa.

Le gusta caminar con la familia.
texts.en:
Esther Deysi L. B. is 45 years old.  She is married, and lives with her partner and a son in the town of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province.  She has 1 son.

Esther is a member of the La Esperanza (“Hope”) cooperative, located 25 kilometers from the town of Ventanas.  This is a community that is primarily dedicated to commerce.  The group meets every month in the San Vicente neighborhood.

Esther works at the Humberto School, and has a store where she works with her husband and sells ice cream.  She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise so she can expand her business.

The support of this loan will help her financially, so that she can replace items she needs.  Her dream is to have her own store location and to buy a house.  

She enjoys going for walks with her family.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to expand the business.

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es:
La señora Salvadora F. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en en Barrio Arroyo Pora,  es separada, tiene 3 hijos. 
La señora Salvadora  es comerciante, hace 7 años que se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños. 
Mediante esta actividad pueden solventar  sus gastos y cubrir cualquier imprevisto que se le presente. 
Ella ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de más mercaderías como remeras, camisas, remeras, camisillas, shorts, y otros.
texts.en:
Salvadora F. is 42 years old and lives in the Arroyo Pora neighborhood. She is separated and has three children. 

Salvadora is a merchant. For seven years she has worked selling clothing for women, men and children. By means of this business they are able to cover their expenses as well as any unforeseen expense that may arise. 

She has requested this loan in order to buy more merchandise such as knit tops, shirts, T-shirts, shorts and other apparel.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, jeans, shorts, blouses, T shirts and dresses

loans.name: Mary Adjoa Mansah

texts.en:
Mary Adjoa Mansah E. is into the extraction of palm oil at Abrafo near Abura. Mary has received a junior high education. She is married and has four children. The loan she is asking for will be used to acquire more palm fruits to prepare oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education to her children.

Mary is standing by some palm fruits she will be using for the oil.

loans.use: To acquire more palm fruits to prepare oil for sale.

loans.name: Zaragoza

texts.es: El Sr. M. es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado dice que ya tiene mas de 20 años de profecion carpintero desde chico le gustaba mucho hacer pequeños detalles de madera y conforme paso el tiempo empezo a mejorar es una profesion heredada por su padre. el siempre ha estado al tanto de la educacion de sus hijos y con gran esfuerzo los ha sacado adelante, en este momento solo la mas chica estudia en preparatoria con la ayuda de su esposa ha sobrellevado esta ultima crisis economica, poco a poco se ha hido levantando el dinero lo quiere para comprar materia prima para su negocio.
texts.en: Mr. M. is a very hard-working and noble man. He states that he has been a carpenter for over 20 years. As a young boy, he really liked making little wooden products, and as time progressed, he started to improve his skills, which he learned from his father. He has always been on top of his children's studies, and after much effort, he has been able to push them forward. At this time, only the youngest is in high school. With the help of his wife, he has been able to withstand this last financial crisis. Little by little, money has been coming in. He needs the loan in order to purchase raw materials for his business.

loans.use: Purchase materials for his business

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Fatmata J.. She is married and has 7 children ages 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 15 and 18 years. She has two additional dependents who live with her. She helps to educate them while they help with her business. In 1990, Fatmata established her ready-made bags business. She began her business because she wanted to generate additional income to help her husband. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, Fatama earns about 700,000 Le  every month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 Le. Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to add additional stock to increase profits. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 475000 Le. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to sells bags in bulk. She wants to travel internationally to purchase modern bags to sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add more bags to her business inventory

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ángela reside en Semsembra, departamento de Morazán, tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 14 y 13 años de edad, ellos alquilan la vivienda y se dedica a la venta de lácteos y pupuseria desde hace cuatro años, negocio que nace por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con ingresos para solventar necesidades del hogar.
Los lácteos los vende por la mañana y las pupusas de 6:00pm a 8:00pm, ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos necesarios para hacer la venta como chicharrón, condimentos, tomates, el crédito le ayudara a realizar las compras en mayor cantidad obteniendo un mejor precio de los proveedores y con la posibilidad de ver mejores ganancias.
Sueña con crecer en sus negocios y que a través de estos pueda obtener ganancias que le permitan ahorrar y comprase un terreno para construir su propia casa, mejorando la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ángela lives in Semsembra, in the department of Morazán.  She is 30 years old, and she lives with her husband and two children who are 14 and 13 years old.  They rent their home and she has worked selling milk products and pupusas (maize dumplings) for 4 years.  This business was born from the necessity of helping her husband with income to meet the household necessities.

She sells milk products in the morning and the pupusas from 6-8pm.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy the things she needs to make sales, like sausage, condiments, tomatoes.  The loan will help her make purchases in greater quantity and thereby get a better price from the wholesalers, meaning the possibility of seeing greater profits.  

She dreams of growing her business and through it being able to make an income that would permit her to save and to buy land to build her own home, improving the quality of life for her children.

loans.use: To buy sausage, condiments, and tomatoes

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a tailoring business from home for the past six months, with neighbors being her potential customers. Esther faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the holiday season (August and December), the demand for clothing is high compared to the months of January and February, when demand is low. She hopes to establish another business in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of cloth materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cloth materials

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa, y golosinas, hace buñuelos, arroz de leche, cajeta por las tardes, ya que labora en horarios de la mañana como conserje. Y que por ser su salario bajo, busca las alternativas para solventar sus gastos personales.
Con los préstamos en Afodenic ha logrado equilibrar sus ventas, entre las dificultades que tuvo en el año es que fue operada de un ojo, en donde sus hijas menores la han apoyado haciendo las ventas.
Con este financiamiento invertirá en ropa escolar, ya que la demanda es mucha en estos meses por el comienzo del año escolar. Lo que espera obtener buenas ventas. Para poder pagar sus compromisos, a si como recobrar pronto su salud.
texts.en:
Martha has her own business selling clothing and sweets (she makes doughnut fritters, rice pudding, and fudge).  She works in the morning as a concierge.  Because of her low salary she had to look for alternatives to increase income to cover personal expenses.

With loans received through Afodenic she was able to increase sales despite the difficulties she had the year her eye was operated on.  Her two youngest daughters had to help her run the business.

She plans to use this loan to buy school clothing since the new school year is about to begin and there is great demand.  She hopes to increase sales so she can meet her payment obligations and gain her strength back.

loans.use: To buy school clothing for the new school year

loans.name: Jije Grace

texts.en:
Jije Grace is a single woman who lives in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: fishing and ready-to-wear clothing businesses. Jije Grace joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jije Grace has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14000, improving her family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12000, which she intends to use to purchase more fishing nets and ready-to-wear inventory so that she can continue to save up for future family needs and house repair. Jije Grace is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing net

loans.name: Chayrell

texts.en:
Chayrell is a married woman who lives in Manapla, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store/spices business and a fish vending business.  Her husband Richard, who is 40 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 13 to 18 years old.  Chayrell joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Chayrell has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children.  Chayrell is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomina T. is married and has one child. Philomina sells maize, yams, cassava, plantains, tomatoes and other food items at Korfofordo near Jukwa in Cape Coast. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband in the education of her children. Philomina will invest the loan into her business so she buys more food items to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Philomina plans to reinvest it for further growth.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth is 42 years old and lives in the Sémé-Podji district of Cotonou with her husband Arouna and their six children. All of their children are in school. 

For the past ten years Elisabeth has sold cloth and used clothing from her stall at Tokpa, Benin's largest market in the heart of Cotonou. This is her sixth loan with ALIDE, following successful past repayments. With this loan, she will purchase inventory from Missebo market, which specializes in cloth. Her aim is to strengthen her business in the short term.

loans.use: Purchasing used clothing and scraps

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara tiene 41 años, vive en compañía de sus 4 hijos en su casa que es propia. Desde hace medio años decidió emprender un negocio, y dese ahí vende gaseosas y comida rápida, en un pequeño local que arrendó, asimismo habilitó un espacio para vender productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, fideos y menestras, es así que  todo el día esta en su lugar de ventas para generarse los ingresos diarios que le permiten sostener a su familia. Con el tiempo ha logrado conseguir una estabilidad económica, por ello espera en adelante tener un negocio más amplio, y que este abastecido de productos de primera necesidad, para que tenga más dinamismo en la ventas y generarse más ganancias.  Es su crédito número 2  que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de tener un crédito que beneficiará  el crecimiento de su negocio y de compartir un ciclo mas de experiencia en crédito grupal junto a otra persona que considera es de su confianza. Con el crédito que solicita, lo  invertirá en la compra de productos para implementar su tienda.
texts.en: Sara is 41 years old and lives with her four children in their own home.  She decided to start her own business six months ago, selling fast food and soft drinks from a small rented stall.  She has also set aside a small area to sell basic products, such as rice, sugar, noodles, and vegetable stew.  She is there all day in order to generate a daily income so she can support her family.  She has managed to create financial stability and hopes to have a larger business in the future, and stock it with basic needs products so that she can increase her sales.  This will be her second loan through MFP and she is very happy to have financial backing to support her business’ growth and to enter another loan cycle with another person whom she trusts.  She will use the money from this loan to buy products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Las Chicas Superpoderosas Group

texts.es:
El comité "Las chicas superpoderosas" es de la zona de San Ignacio, surgió a través de promociones realizadas en el barrio, está integrado por 15 señoras.
Todas ellas se comprometen a cumplir con responsabilidad con sus actividades y con el pago de sus cuotas en caso de acceder al crédito que solicitan y así llegar hasta el nivel máximo del programa.
La señora Maria Bernardina R. se dedica a la venta de chipas (Masa típica de Paraguay hecha a base de queso y almidón), integró el grupo con el propósito de aumentar su actividad, así mismo ella ahora emprenderá la venta, además de la chipa, de empanadas y sopas paraguayas (sólido a base de maíz), para que pueda mejorar sus ingresos y la educación de sus hijos.
Todas las integrantes del comité esperan poder contar con la ayuda de Kiva, pues están esperanzadas en que algún día superarán la pobreza en que se encuentran.
texts.en:
The committee, "Las chicas superpoderosas" (superpowerful girls) is from the area of San Ignacio. It arose as a result of the promotions made in the neighborhood. It is made up of 15 women. All of them promise to do their jobs and to make their payments with responsibility in the event that they get access to the loan they have requested and to achieve the greatest level of the program.

Maria Bernardina R. is dedicated to selling "chipas" (typical Paraguayan dough made from a base of cheese and starch). She formed the group with the purpose of expanding her work. At the same time, she now will undertake the sale of not only chipa, but also empanadas and Paraguayan soups (corn-based) so she can improve her income and the education of her children.

All of the members of the committee hope to be able to count on the help of Kiva since they are hopeful that, one day, they will overcome the poverty in which they find themselves.

loans.use: to purchase starch, cheese and bags of polyethylene, in addition to maize, oil, meats, etc.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is a married with nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Modesta is 46 years old and has five children who are in school. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Modesta requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Modesta has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Modesta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Ruth Mery

texts.es:
L. señora Ruth  tiene 48 años D. edad y vive en una casa D. propiedad D. sus padres junto a sus hijos. Vivienda que esta ubicada en el barrio L. Pampa D. L. ciudad D. Tarija. Ruth es soltera pero tiene 2 hijos D. 20 y 15 años D. edad, Ruth desD. hace varios años se dedica al comercio su puesto D. venta D. alimentos, galletas refrescos y otros, este puesto se encuentra dentro D. L. universidad D. odontologia. Por circunstancia D. L. vida se quedo soL.. Ahora Ruth tiene que trabajar soL. para poder sacar  adelante a sus hijos que uno D. ellos ya esta en L. universidad. Ruth desD. hace  22 años que tiene su negocio en L. universidad. Es una persona muy conocida por los docentes y estudiantes que consumen sus productos, ahora Ruth quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante, pero elL. nos cuenta que tiene L. necesidad D. comprar un horno industrial y mercadería.  D. esa forma poder  surtir mas su puesto D. venta.  Como elL. ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el crédito será destinado para L. compra D. dicho horno y mercadería que es necesario para realizar su actividad para D. ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos.                                                                                                                                                                                                       
Ruth nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones D. vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones D. L. casa donD. vive.
texts.en:
Ruth is 48 years old and lives together with her children in a house that belongs to her parents.  The house is located in L. Pampa neighborhood, in the city of Tarija.  Ruth is single but she has two children aged 20 and 15.  For several years, she has had a sales location where she sells food, cookies, soft drinks, etc which is located in the University of Dentistry.  Through life's circumstances, Ruth was left on her own.  Now she has to work on her own in order to get her children ahead in life.  One of them is already attending university.

Ruth has had her business at the university for 22 years.  She is very well known by the professors and students who eat her products.  Ruth would now like to make better income in order to get ahead in life but she tells us that she needs to buy an industrial stove and merchandise with which to better stock her sales location.  As she already has experience in this field, her loan will be used to buy the stove and merchandise that she needs to carry out her business so that she can increase her income.  Ruth tells us that she would like to improve her living conditions.  She says that she will therefore request her next loan to improve the condition of her home.

loans.use: to buy a stove

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny is 39 years old, married and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari (or variety) store in the Philippines, and is applying for a loan for PHP 13,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store such as bread and other groceries. She has repaid three previous loans from NWTF and has been running her store for four years. She also earns additional money by raising pigs. Jenny's goals are to save money to educate her children and expand her livestock business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 40 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Jessica has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy snacks, candies and beverages to sell.

Jessica has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, candies and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Este cliente es un pequeño productor de granos básicos especialmente maíz y trigo, tiene mas de catorce años de dedicarse a esta actividad, cuenta con sus propios medios de producción tales como una yunta de bueyes, arado así como una cultivadora. Este y todos los créditos han sido para compra de Insumos agrícolas. La inversión la hace con el apoyo de la familia los que trabajan en conjunto para alcanzar sus objetivos el de obtener buenos rendimientos en la cosecha.
texts.en: This client is a small-scale producer of basic grains, especially corn and wheat.  He has been in this business for more than fourteen years.  He has his own means of production such as a yoke of oxen and a plow.  This loan, in common with all the other loans he has received, will be used to buy agricultural supplies.  He makes this investment with the support of his family who work with him in order to reach his goals of obtaining a good yield from his harvest.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing corn and kidney beans

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, a 42-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. Her husband no longer works. Anh earns an income to support her family by selling many kinds of beads and hair pins in front of her house. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Anh requires a loan to repair her store and to purchase a range of different products, including beads, pins, and assorted hair and beauty accessories, to provide for her customers. She hopes that will permit her to attract more customers, earn more income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beads, hair pins and different products for selling and to repair her store.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ambulant business of vending spices in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of spices to sell for her ambulant vending business.

Marites has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.
 
Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of spices to sell.

loans.name: Rosalia 	Angelica

texts.es: La señora Rosalía es una joven clienta que vive con su esposo y su pequeña hija, viven en la casa de su mama donde tienen  su tienda de barrio donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad, esta en buena ubicación por tal motivo es muy concurrida y la señora quiere aumentar y mejorar su capital con el cual trabaja y  la compra de mercadería para así surtir aun mas su tienda por este motivo solicito el crédito, su mama prácticamente le heredara la vivienda donde vive y con el tiempo ella quiere hacer construir una cancha de wali su sueño es tener su casa propia y hacerla construir para darles la comodidad que necesita su familia, es una persona joven con muchas ganas de superación.
texts.en:
Señora Rosalía is a young client.   She lives with her husband and young daughter in her mother's house where they have a neighborhood store that offers a variety of basic necessity products.  It is located in a very busy location and Señora Rosalía wants to increase and improve her working capital by buying merchandise to stock her store even more.  

For this reason she is requesting a loan.  Her mother practically inherited the house where she lives and in time she wants to build a Wally court [a type of volleyball in Bolivia].  Her dream is to have her own house and to construct it with her family's comfort in mind.  She is a young person with a great desire to excel.

loans.use: purchase merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
Wilma nació en la ciudad de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 33 años de edad. Ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Quillabamba del departamento del Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades. Ella es profesora y trabaja en el colegio Simón Bolívar de la ciudad de Quillabamba. Ella regresa a la ciudad de Urubamba  una vez al mes para ver sus familiares y para ver cómo va el negocio. Ella y su mamá tienen una pequeña cevicheria en la ciudad de Urubamba y quien administra el negocio es la mamá. El crédito que requiere Wilma es para comprar insumos como por ejemplo limones, pescado y otros insumos. 

El Banco Comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Urubamba (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Wilma was born in the city of Urubamba in the department of Cusco in Peru and is 33 years old. She lives with her partner and their two children in the city of Quillabamba, located in the department of Cusco. She works in Quillabamba as a school teacher at Simón Bolívar college. Wilma goes back to Urubamba once a month to see her family and check how her business is going. She and her mother have a small ceviche store in Urubamba which her mother manages. The loan that Wilma is applying for will go towards purchasing supplies such as lemons, fish and other ingredients.

The community bank “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” (Lord of Miracles of Urubamba) meet every month in the city of Urubamba in Cusco, Peru. Cusco is known for being a very commercialised touristy city because of its traditional festival, Inti Raymi, and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as lemons, fish and other ingredients

loans.name: Angela Pastora

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Buenas Amigas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Angela, tiene 55 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, todos mayores de edad e independientes y uno de ellos aun vive con ella. El marido es comerciante.
 
Nuestra amiga junto a su esposo y su hija  se dedican al comercio, ellos venden  sillas y perezosas ( sillas de descanso), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también venden bajo pedidos que le hacen de otras ciudades como Quito, Cuenca y Loja, ciudades  a las cuales se desplazan una vez cada quince días para realizar sus ventas. Nos cuenta que ellos compran estos productos en Rocafuerte a artesanos de este lugar para luego llevarlos a dichas ciudades en las cuales se quedan por dos a tres días hasta que terminen de vender lo que han llevado. Tienen más de 20 años este negocio y esta es la fuente de ingresos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar sillas y perezosas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con estos créditos. 

Su sueño es tener un local para no viajar tanto.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Buenas Amigas", ("Good Friends"), meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton, which is well known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are renowned on a national and international level.  It is the place where the famous toquilla straw sombreros come from.

In this area lives Señora Angela. She is 55 years old, and lives in a common-law marriage from which she has five children.  They are all fully grown and financially independent, and one of them lives with her.  Her husband works in retail.

Our friend works with her husband and her daughter in retail; they sell chairs and loungers (chairs for relaxing).  Their sales method is going door-to-door, and they also sell to orders that they receive from other cities such as Quito, Cuenca and Loja.  They go to these cities twice a month to make their sales.

She tells us that they buy their products in Rocafuerte from craftsmen, and then take them to the aforementioned cities where they stay for two or three days until they have finished selling what they have brought with them.  They have been working in this business for more than 20 years, and this is their source of income.

This loan is to buy chairs and loungers.  She has been a member of the Communal Banks since the beginning, and likes it for the help they provide her through these loans.

Her dream is to have her own premises, so that she doesn't have to travel so much.

loans.use: to buy chairs and loungers(chairs for relaxing).

loans.name: Norberta Isamar

texts.es:
Norberta tiene 20 años de edad y vive con sus padres.

Norberta es una joven muy emprendedora y trabajadora, tiene ocho años de sembrar maíz y dos años de cultivar el yute o kenaf (fibra natural utilizada para fabricar sacos, lazos, matates, artesanías, etc.). Su familia fue quien  le enseñó a trabajar la tierra desde muy pequeña para tener una fuente de ingresos.

Ella debe viajar en autobús durante una hora desde su casa para poder adquirir los insumos agrícolas necesarios para sus cultivos.

Norberta está solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de abono para el cultivo de maíz y para pagar por la mano de obra para recoger la cosecha de yute. Con el préstamo ella podrá obtener una buena cosecha de maíz, ya que el abono dará los nutrientes necesarios. El préstamo tambien hará posible el que Norberta recoga su cosecha de yute, ya que esta actividad requiere el trabajo de más de una persona.

Norberta es una joven visionaria con planes a futuro. Con los ingresos que resulten de la venta de sus cosechas, ella planea pagar el préstamo, y reinvertir para seguir cultivando. Además, ella pretende ahorrar para comprar un vehículo y asi poder salir a vender productos de la canasta básica a distintas comunidades. De la ganancia de estas dos actividades, ella quiere pagar por sus estudios universitarios, ya que por falta de dinero no ha podido seguir estudiando. Hace un año Norberta terminó su bachillerato técnico en contaduría, y lo que más desea es ser tener un título universitario.
texts.en:
Norberta is 20 years old and lives with her parents.

Norberta is an enterprising and hard-working young woman.  She has been growing corn for eight years and jute and kenaf (natural fiber used to make bags, rope, string tote bags, crafts, etc) for two years.  Her family taught her to work the land as a young girl so that she would have a source of income.   She has to travel an hour from her house by bus to buy the agricultural supplies she needs for her crops.   

Norberta is requesting a loan through Fundación Campo to buy fertilizer for her corn crop and to pay for labor to pick her jute crop. The loan will enable her to obtain a better corn harvest since the fertilizer will provide the necessary nutrients.  The loan will also make it possible to harvest her jute crop since this activity requires more than one person.  

Norberta is a young visionary with plans for the future.  With the income she earns from the sale of her crops, she plans to make her payments and reinvest in her subsequent crops.  In addition, she intends to save for a vehicle so that she can travel to sell daily use products in various communities.  With the earnings from these two activities, she wants to pay for her university studies since she was unable to continue her studies because of a lack of funds.  Norberta finished her technical high school degree in accounting and what she wants more than anything is to have a university degree.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and pay for labor to pick her jute crop.

loans.name: Carmen Lucy

texts.es:
Carmen  de 52 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y comercial.

Desde hace varios años aproximadamente Carmen se ha dedicado a la venta de golosinas, gaseosas y sanguches, su negocio es ambulante, sus productos lo ofrece por las calles de la zona donde vive, con las ganancias que adquiera por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Para poder  mejorar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercadería e insumos para seguir elaborando sus sanguches, con el único ideal de que su negocio tenga mas productos para ofrecer a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones familiares.  Carmen es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarle algunas mejoras económicas  a su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen, 52, lives with her family in her own house that only has electricity and is located in the rural part of Chiclayo Province.  This zone is noted for farming and commerce.

Carmen has sold snacks, soft-drinks and sandwiches for several years now.  She’s a street vendor and she sells her products throughout the streets where she lives.  With profits she earns through her product sales she tries to cover all her expenses and daily household needs.

In order to be able to improve her business she’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more merchandise and ingredients to continue making her sandwiches.  Her sole goal is that the business has more products to offer customers, to repay the loan and her family obligations.  Carmen is a responsible, dedicated and hardworking person who strives to provide some economic improvement for her family.

loans.use: to buy products she sells and to buy ingredients to continue making sandwiches to sell.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомчон житель района Хамадони. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей.  Он два года как занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. В основном он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Разводит скот у себя дома. В этом ему помогает его сын. Он берет кредит для закупа трех голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Ilhomjon is a resident of the Hamadoni region. He is 36 yeas old. He is married and has five children. He has been breeding large horned cattle for two years. Mainly he breeds the cattle for future resale. He breeds the cattle at home and his son helps him in this. Ilhomjon is taking out the loan to buy three heads of large horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy three heads of large horned cattle.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
Santa Ana se llama el comité formado por 16 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción. Ellas son mujeres luchadoras y muy trabajadoras que se unen con el propósito de luchar por el bienestar de sus familiares. Este comité se encuentra en su ciclo número 11,  en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las integrantes en la asistencia en las capacitaciones.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Norma, ella tiene una peluquería, la cual es su medio de subsistencia. Gracias al trabajo que realiza ella puede ayudar a su familia, dándoles por medio de su trabajo una vida digna, con las comodidades mínimas que necesitan. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes, por lo que le va muy bien en su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, gel, spray, cosméticos y demás insumos para su peluquería, lo cual le es de suma ayuda. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que estas le brindan
texts.en:
Santa Ana is a group of 16 women in Asunción. They are very motivated and work hard to provide for their families. This group is in their 11th phase of activities, and all of them attend training to achieve success and greater success.
Norma is a member who is a hairdresser.  She has done well for her family, giving them a good standard of living.  Her business is thriving and she has many satisfied clients.  She now seeks a loan to buy hair dye, gels, hairspray, cosmetics and other items.  She is very grateful to the group and to Kiva for their assistance.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, gels, hairspray, cosmetics and other items

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo is a 54-year-old married woman who has been residing in Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province.
