She has owned a general store selling mixed products like sweets, groceries, drinks, packaged foods, and other household products since 2009. She typically makes a profit of $6.00 per day through this business. Presently Keo has run out of products from her stock. Therefore, she is seeking a loan in the amount of $1,000 from Kvia’s funders to purchase additional merchandise to sell. With the increase in income, she will save to improve her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Katetei

texts.en:
Katetei has been a businesswoman operating a kiosk for the past two years. She is 33 years old, married, and supports three people in her family.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by the KADET staff and applied for her first loan, which she plans to use to purchase more stock of goods like sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour for sale. 

She hopes to make a profit and invest the income by expanding her business into a wholesale. She is hardworking woman who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods like sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour for sale.

loans.name: Soboulde/bamtare Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bamtaré a été créé le 17 Mai 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte 13 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles font toutes le petit commerce.

Madame  Khadiyatou (assise à l’extrême droite de la photo et le bras levé) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse de riz, de l’huile, du savon, du thé, sucre et autres produits divers qu’elle achète  à travers les marchés hebdomadaires pour les revendre dans son village. Activité qu’elle exerce de puis plusieurs années.

Son prêt va lui permettre de mieux s’approvisionner en ces produits qu’elle commercialise.

Les bénéfices lui serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille par le fait de soutenir de son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
The Bamtaré group was formed on 17th May 2011 after a local credit bank was established. It is made up of 13 women who all live in the same village. They all sell various goods for a living. 

Madame  Khadiyatou (sitting at the far right of the photo with her arm raised) is the group leader. She is 26 years old and is married with five children. 

She sells rice, oil, soap, tea, sugar and other mixed goods; she buys them at weekly markets and re-sells them in her village. She has been involved in this line of work for a number of years. 

Her loan will enable her to purchase greater volumes of these goods. 

The profits that she generates will enable her to improve her family's living conditions by helping her to support her husband.

loans.use: to purchase goods for re-sale

loans.name: Nyamawi

texts.en: Nyamawi is taking another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to boost his goat meat-selling business. With the loan, he wants to purchase more goats to boost his business. The previous loan improved his monthly income by 50 percent. He dreams of expanding his business to supply at wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To purchase goats to sell for meat

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Kokou est un homme âgé de 32 ans. Il est marié å une commerçante. Il a 2 enfants.
Kokou travaille comme revendeur depuis 2006. Il revend des pneus pour tous clients dans la zone portuaire. Il achète les produits au port autonome de Lomé. Il travaille seule. Au moment, n’as pas de difficultés.
Kokou a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pneus. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kokou voudrait ouvrir une boutique de vente de pneus. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Kokou  is a 32-year old man. His wife is a vendor. He has two children. Kokou has been working as a vendor since 2006. He buys and resells tires to the general public in the port area. He buys his goods at the autonomous port of Lome.   He works by himself. At present, he has no problems [with the business]. Kokou has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy tires. He would like to reinvest in his business. In the years to come, Kokou would like to open a store to sell tires. He says that he plans to use the revenues to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Chansomaly

texts.en:
Chansomaly, 29, is a weaver. Her husband, Soknoeun, 35, is a chef. He cooks for a restaurant in Phnom Penh City. They live in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have four children, three sons and one daughter. Two attend school and the others are still young.  

Chansomaly is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000. She will use $900 of the loan to pay for her house-building fees because she built a new house to stay in, but she lacks some money to pay for building fees.

She will also use the other $100 of the loan to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: to pay for her house-building fees and buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tejedores De Sueños Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Tejedores de Sueños” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; costuras, venta de productos naturales, venta de empanadas, venta de ropa, almuerzos, venta de chocolates, paquetería, venta de comida rápida, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Gipsy, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en la última fila, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste  una polera de color negro con rosas blancas, su cabello es de color castaño claro y lo  usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa y accesorios varios, desde hace 3 años. Comenta  que trabaja en su casa ofreciendo varios modelos de ropa y accesorios como carteras, pañuelos a su clientela.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de Santiago donde encuentra gran variedad de modelos, y tallas grandes que su clientela le ha ido pidiendo.
Con el crédito comprará chaquetas para hombres, mujeres y niños, de varios modelos y colores.
Una de las metas de Gipsy es instalar una tienda en su propia casa, habilitando algún espacio para atender a su clientela con más tranquilidad y no invadir el espacio familiar.
Gipsy vive junto a su hijo de 7 años de edad y su hermana quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel personal y laboral es tener su tienda y agregar otros tipos de rubros como la artesanía.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses, lo cual le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called ‘Tejedores de Sueños’ [Dreamweavers].  It is comprised of 17 entrepreneurs who work in different fields.  Among those fields is sewing, selling natural products, selling empanadas, selling clothes, lunches, selling chocolates, parcel service, selling fast foods, and services, among others.  All of them live in the city of Valparaíso.

Gipsy, a member of the communal bank, appears in the last row of the photo.  She is the first one on the left, and she is wearing a black top with white roses.  Her hair is light brown, and she wears it pulled back.

She has been selling clothes and various accessories for three years.  She says that she works at her house, and she offers her customers various styles of clothing and accessories like wallets and scarves.  She buys the merchandise that she needs in the city of Santiago.  This is where she finds a greater variety of styles and large sizes for the customers who order them.  She will use the loan to buy various styles and colors of jackets for men, women, and children.  

One of Gipsy’s goals is to set up a store at her house by outfitting a space to take care of her clientele more serenely, without encroaching on the family space.  Gipsy lives with her 7 year old son and her sister, who goes to school.  Her dreams on a personal and work level are to have her store and to add other types of products like handicrafts.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity given to her by Fondo Esperanza.  It has allowed her to invest in her business.  Also, she is very comfortable in the company of the rest of the entrepreneurs in her communal bank.  This is because they share different activities and interests, which has served as a means of recreation for her. The training provided at the meetings has taught her to better manage her business.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago. It’s the regional capital and also the seat of the country’s legislative branch of government. It’s the nation’s main port, and it has a variety of beautiful, picturesque places, like Nobel Laureate Pablo Neruda’s house, for example.

loans.use: to buy various styles and colors of jackets for men, women, and children.

loans.name: René Ovidio

texts.en: Rene, his parents, and two siblings, all work in their small family-run business. They sell toys, school supplies and non-perishable food products to local community members from their home. A few years ago Rene's mother was ironing the family's clothes when, in a brief moment, wanting to assist his mother, Rene grabbed the hot iron severely burning his index finger. In time this cause his finger to curl into his hand because of the resultant burn scar contracture. As a result Rene is unable to grasp different objects securely with his left hand. This loan will enable reconstructive plastic surgery to restore his hand function including the use of tools.

loans.use: corrective surgery of burn contracture on left index finger

loans.name: Amunafa Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Amunfa” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Isatu is the featured leader of this group. The 31-year-old is married to a businessman, and they have four children, two of whom are attending primary schools. Isatu has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She sells toothbrushes, toothpaste, soap, body spray, etc.

 With her share of this loan, she will buy the aforementioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy toothbrushes, toothpaste, soap, body spray, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Patron San Cristobal Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON SAN CRISTOBAL”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda Bernardina ella es soltera y tiene 61 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de hotel, la socia tiene un hotel donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de hotel. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar sabanas y camas para su hotel.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su rostro ya no pertenece al banco comunal Patron San Cristobal.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de hotel, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de cabina de internet.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the "Patron San Cristobal" community bank. This bank is located in the Cusco district, and belongs to the Cusco province and the department of Cusco.

The partner is Hilda Bernardina. She is single and 61 years old. She works in her hotel business. She has a hotel where she works from 8:00am until 10:00pm. She has had this business for 7 years, and it is going very well for her. She is applying for the loan to buy sheets and beds for her hotel.

The partners whose photos are stuck onto the group photo had their photos taken after the meeting, because they were not able to make the meeting due to work commitments. The member whose face is covered by a circle does not belong to the Patron San Cristobal community bank.

The other partners make their living in the hotel business, the clothing sales business, the grocery store business, and the internet access booth business.

The partner is grateful to whoever forms part of this dream through this loan, and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sheets and beds for her hotel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add on stock.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Born in 1968 at Anfoin in the Lakes Prefecture, Rose G. is married and responsible for 12 children. Having had the good fortune to inherit her mother's business, she adores baking bread. With experience in this trade that dates back to her childhood, Rose remains the principle baker for her area. She has over eight salespeople working for her. The lack of a mill to grind wheat is a serious handicap for her, in spite of having plenty of demand for her bread.

She is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase and install a wheat-grinding mill which will make her work easier and allow her to increase production. This in turn will lead to increased profits and improve living conditions for the whole family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Née en 1968 à Anfoin dans la préfecture des Lacs, Madame Rose G. est mariée et compte un total de douze (12) enfants à sa charge. Héritière bien heureuse de l’activité de sa mère, elle a fait de la production du pain, son métier adoré. Dotée d’une expérience de sa vie depuis l’enfance, Madame Rose G. demeure la principale boulangère du pain dans toute sa localité. Elle possède plus de huit vendeurs sur sa cour. Mais le manque de moulin à blé constitue un handicap sérieux à son activité malgré les nombreuses demandes sur le marché.

Aujourd’hui, le besoin se faisant sentir, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter et installer un moulin à blé afin d’alléger ses peines et produire plus. La satisfaction de ce besoin amènera Madame Rose à augmenter sa production et ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase and installation of a wheat grinding mill (Achat et installation d'un moulin à blé)

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has three years of experience as a seller of costmetics and jewelry in her own store. She began by working for other persons as a clothes salesperson in the center of the city. This was the motivating factor for her when she decided to begin to save money in order to begin her own shop. Because this work demanded much of her time outside of her house, she did not pay as much attention to her sons as she would like. With the help of her husband she obtained funding and invested in various products. She works every day of the week from 9 am until 6 pm.

Maria would like this credit in order to supply her business with other types of products. A larger supply of products would allow her to have more sales.

Maria is married and the mother of two sons, one of whom is a student. Her husband works in a factory, maintaining/repairing the factory equipment. He helps out his wife as much as he can. She goal is to be able to purchase a small terrain/piece of land, as her family is currently living in her parents' house.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene una experiencia de 3 años con su negocio de venta de cosméticos y bisutería. Se inicio trabajando para otras personas vendiendo ropa en el centro de la ciudad. Este fue el motivo por el cual ella decide comenzar a ahorrar para tener su propio negocio. Razón de que este trabajo le demandaba estar mucho tiempo fuera de su casa y por ende no estar pendiente de sus hijos. Con la ayuda de su esposo logra reunir un capital y lo invierte en dichos productos. Trabaja todos los días de la semana desde las 9 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.

Maria desea el crédito para poder surtir su negocio con otra clase de productos. Además al comprar un mayor volumen de productos ella obtendrá mayor ganancia. /p>

Maria es casada. Tiene 2 hijos. Uno de los cuales ya estudia. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa dando manutención a las maquinas de la compañía. Le ayuda en lo que mas puede a su esposa. Su deseo es poder ahorrar para comprarse un terrenito. Ya que actualmente ellos viven en la casa de los padres de el.

loans.use: Invest in cosmetics and jewelry

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mrs. Yan H. is a 41 year old widow, and lives with her one child in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To supplement the family’s expenses, she has two sources of income. First, she and her son grow a variety of crops on her farm and sell them to the retailers at a market. Second, she purchases seeds such as beans and sesame from the wholesalers and then resells them to people in her local area.

With the business activity, she typically makes around 5 USD per day in revenue. Recently, Yan H. would like to meet her expanded clients’ base, and needs a loan to purchase sesame seeds and beans to satisfy her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase more sesame seeds and bean to satisfy her clients.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok C. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She sells cooked meat to the people in her community, and earns up to $7 per day. Her husband is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver and can generate approximately $2.50 each day. One of her children works as a computer repairman and two are students.

Mrs. Sok C. wants this loan to purchase utensils and more supplies for her business. She would use the leftover money to buy a motor-bike for her husband to operate a business.

loans.use: To purchase utensils and more supplies for her business

loans.name: Pouy

texts.en: Mrs. Pouy S., age 41, makes baskets and sells them to a wholesale dealer, earning $3 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman earning $4 per day. They have five children, four who are students and one who is too young for school. In order to meet growing consumer demand, she would like to borrow $200 in order to purchase more bamboo, reeds, and other materials needed to create her baskets. This will increase her output and therefore increase her income. She plans to use the increased income to reinvest in her business and finance her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to weave baskets

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Ever since her husband passed away, Cecilia had to fulfill both parental roles for her children by searching for ways to make enough money to provide well-being and security for her beloved children, who are the reason she can continue vibrantly. She is a hardworking and exemplary mother. From 3AM to 10AM in the morning, she sells nutritious quinoa juice; from midday, after she prepares some food for her dear children, she is busy with manual labor to generate extra income to sustain her family. These activities add up to bring happiness in their lives. In this case, the loan will be used to buy more raw ingredients (sugar, quinoa ) to concoct her tasty, nutritious juices.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde que falleció su esposo, doña Cecilia, tuvo que desempeñar los roles de padre y madre para sus hijos, buscando la manera de generar ingresos económicos suficientes para ofrecerles bienestar y seguridad a sus queridos retoños, quienes son la razón por las que se anima a seguir adelante; ella es una laboriosa y ejemplar madre que desde las 3:00 hasta las 10:00 de la mañana se dedicada a vender sus nutritivos jugos de quinua y a partir del medio día, después de preparar los respectivos alimentos para sus amorosos hijos, desempeña su noble labor artesanal, trabajo que le genera ingresos económicos adicionales para su sustento familiar, estas actividades vienen atesorando mucha satisfacción en su vida.La solicitud que en esta oportunidad hace le permitirá comprar materia prima (azúcar, quinua), a fin de seguir preparando sus agradables y nutritivos jugos.

loans.use: To buy sugar and quinoa to make nutritious juices

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Mrs. Martha M. has been selling fruit for the past 10 years. Through loans, she has been able to purchase oranges in bulk and sell them in her neighborhood early in the morning.

Although she currently has only a small plot at the local market with a plastic roof, she has not lost hope that one day her business conditions will improve.

She believes that Ceprodel’s financial support has been the economic pillar that has allowed her to develop her business and improve her family’s quality of life. She hopes to continue developing her business little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Martha se dedica a esta actividad hace 10 años y es por medio de prestamos que logra adquirir naranjas al contado para venderlas en los barrios aledaños a su domicilio desde muy tempranas horas.

Aunque actualmente tiene un pequeño tramo en el mercado con techo de plástico no pierde la esperanza en que algún día las condiciones de su local se mejoren.

Considera que el apoyo financiero otorgado por Ceprodel ha sido el pilar económico que la ha permitido el desarrollo de su negocio y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y espera ir mejorando las condiciones de su local poco a poco.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Teresa's Group

texts.en:
Nancy, Teresa, and Josefina have been part of the community bank Imperio for four, two, and two years, respectively. In that time they have learned how to be punctual and responsible, educate their children, and avoid getting sick.

Nancy is 25 years old. She lives with her partner and two children. Nancy has a seafood restaurant located in the main square of the city of Ayacucho.

Teresa is 38 years old. She is separated from her husband and lives with her two children. Teresa buys grains from a variety of markets in the region. She then grinds them into flour and sells them at the markets in Ayacucho.

Meanwhile, Josefina is 24 and lives with her partner and one son. She has had a small grocery store located in her home for two years.

Nancy, Teresa, and Josefina need loans of 1600, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = about $1), which they will invest in buying corn, wheat, barley, quinoa, kiwicha, rice, sugar, oil, milk, and tables for the restaurant. Nancy will use part of her loan to build her house.

They plan to use their savings to educate their children and pay for any emergency or unexpected costs. Nancy, Teresa, and Josefina have many dreams, such as having bigger businesses, owning a store, building a home, and getting married.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses by buying corn, wheat, barley quinoa, kiwicha, rice, sugar, oil, milk, and tables for the restaurant

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario is 34 years old and completed her secondary schooling. She has 2 children but only one is still dependent on her. They live in an area called Victor Raul in Trujillo, in La Libertad. She has a small stand in the mini market called Los Pinos, located in the center of Trujillo. This is a place where they sell all kinds of vegetables, condiments. In order to increase earnings, she purchases her products wholesale at the La Hermelinda market every morning,

She began her business selling small quantities of clothing, which her friends had requested. Later, she sold fish, and finally settled on her current business and feels content that it is growing each day. She is part of the communal bank called Mujeres del Milenium, from whom she received her first loan to travel to Lima to purchase clothing. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase vegetables, ground garlic and other items to sell in her business.

Rosario has a goal; She would like to be able to purchase a car so she can begin offering a transportation service.

La señora Rosario I. A. tiene 34 años de edad, estudio secundaria completa. Tiene dos hijos en total pero uno aun depende de ella. Vive en el asentamiento humano Víctor Raúl del distrito El Porvenir en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. Actualmente tiene un pequeño puesto en el minimarket “los pinos”, ubicado en el centro de Trujillo, lugar donde vende todo tipo de verduras, condimentos, menestras y tubérculos. Para tener mayor ganancia compra al por mayor en el mercado “La Hermelinda”, todas las mañanas antes de dirigirse a su negocio hace sus respectivas compras. Su negocio se inicia vendiendo un poco de ropa el cual le hacían pedidos amigos y conocidos, posteriormente vendió pescado y por ultimo se dedico a su actual negocio, se siente contenta de prosperar cada día. Ella integra el banco comunal “Mujeres del Milenium” en donde recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero viajo a la ciudad de Lima para comprar algunos pedidos de ropa. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprará 20 kilogramos de menestras, verduras, tres docenas de ajos molidos, rocoto y ensaladas. La señora Rosario tiene una meta: Comprar un auto en el que ofrezca servicio como línea de transporte.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE VEGETABLES, GROUND GARLIC AND OTHER ITMES WHICH SHE SELLS FROM A SMALL STAND IN THE MINI MARKET OF TRUJILLO.

loans.name: Martins

texts.en: Mr. Martins N. is 31 years old and lives in Benin City. He is still single and deals in furniture decoration (Glass Tables & Shelves). He learned his kind of business for 7 years from his Uncle and started his own business in 2003. He needs a loan of $875  to buy more furniture decoration for sale. This will enable him meet the demand of his costumers. He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more furniture decorations for sale

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: My name is Khursheed B. and I live in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of five: three boys and two girls. My husband and sons run a breakfast stall business. They want to increase their business and want to start an additional stall, which will serve to double our income. To start an additional stall they need to buy peas and lentils, pickles, and other spices in bulk; they will also buy some crockery as well. I plan to save extra profits from their business for my kids’ marriages. (In the picture Khursheed is standing with her daughter.)

loans.use: Start an additional breakfast stall

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Born in 1959, Esther A. is married and has five children. She has been a very hardworking woman from the day she joined GHAPE. She explained how good it is for a woman to work for herself and care for the children, even if her work is just the rearing of pigs. Her desire is to work for her children’s education and pay for their apprenticeships so that they may learn a trade. She decided to become a member of GHAPE due to her inability to get investment capital, which could give her higher income to meet her children’s needs. With a loan of $1200, she plans to buy motorcycle parts to be resold, buy seeds to plant, and buy other products for retail. This investment will help people in her community to travel from one location to the other. She will also retail her goods to the public which will greatly help the poor who will not have to travel as far to acquire their daily needs. She is planning on using the profits generated to sponsor her children in school. She also wants to buy working tools for them, to help them get a start in their mechanic apprenticeships.
She plans to pay the loan in 24 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle parts, seeds, and products

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es:
Liduvina is a single mother with one daughter. She comes from a humble family with 10 siblings. Four of them work making and selling their own brand of clothing. Liduvina has followed in the footsteps of her parents who began the business. Liduvina has had her own small business selling clothing which she makes in the capital and in the interior of the country for the last 5 years. Thanks to her hard work she was able to finish construction on her home, open her own workshop, and pay for her university expenses. She plans to expand her business in the future, purchasing more machines to increase the production and sales of her products so that she can be a source of jobs to more people.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Liduvina es madre soltera, tiene 1 hija. Liduvina proviene de una familia humilde de 10 hermanos, cuatro de sus hermanos se dedican a la fabricación y venta de ropas de su propia marca. La señora siguió los pasos de sus padres quienes empezaron con el negocio.

Hace 5 años que Liduvina tiene su propia microempresa quien vende ropas de su propia producción en la capital y en el interior del país. Gracias a su esfuerzo pudo terminar de construir su vivienda, tener su propia fábrica y solventar sus gastos universitarios.

En el futuro tiene pensado ampliar su empresa, comprar más maquinas para una mayor producción y venta de sus productos y también dar fuentes de trabajo a mas personas.

loans.use: Purchase of material, zippers, buttons, thread, etc.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Mrs. Petrona has been married for several years. She and her husband have a lovely home with their two daughters, who are in middle school. The couple decided to set up a sewing workshop after they suffered a serious traffic accident. At that time they worked selling herbs. Currently, their workshop is growing and they are doing a lot of sales. As a result, they are able to live a more peaceful life, pay for their daughters' studies and earn a decent living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Petrona esta casada desde hace varios años. Tienen un lindo hogar tranquilo con sus 2 hijas que aún están cursando el nivel medio.- La pareja tomo la decisión de montar un taller de costura después de sufrir un grave accidente de transito cundo se dedicaban a la venta de productos de herba live.- Hoy día el taller esta solidificado, tienen muy buena venta, como resultante de esta pueden llevar una vida mas sosegada, pagan el estudio de sus hijas y llevan una vida decorosa.

loans.use: Fabric purchase

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en: Maimuna L. is a Tanzanian business woman. She is thirty-nine years old with one kid. Her son is in form three in secondary school. She runs two salons in Dar-es-Salaam city center. Profit from the business helps her to pay the school fees for her son and meet her family's daily needs. She requests a loan of $1200 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Kohsiwo

texts.en: Kohsiwo A. sells gari which she makes from cassava. She sells it at Duakro near Elmina. Kohsiwo has received no formal education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. Kohsiwo has been selling gari since 2000. She is responsible for helping her husband pay for the children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava so she can produce more gari. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more cassava

loans.name: Waza's Group

texts.en:
Waza has been selling dresses and lotions in Zanzibar since 2005. She works every day from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. and earns a profit of approximately 70 USD each month. She is looking forward to taking out her first loan through BRAC Tanzania in order to buy more inventory and increase her profit.

Waza is 23 years old, single, and has one 5-year-old chlid. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Subeha.

loans.use: To buy more dresses and lotions to sell

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadia T. est une  veuve de 54 ans qui vit avec ses 4 enfants dans la consession de son feu  mari situé dans le quartier Niebala de la ville de  Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école pour des raisons sociales, très tôt elle embrassa les activités génératrices de revenus. Elle décide de faire le commerce de bazins (tissus très prisé en afrique de l’ouest). Il achetera avec ce prêt, 15 piéces de bazins blancs auprès des commerçants du grand marché de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Ensuite elle signe un contrat de prestation avec des teinturières de Bougouni pour teindre les tissus en différentes colories et motifs prisés ou demandés par la clientèle..
Elle effectue ses ventes d’une façon ambulante dans les différents quartiers de la ville à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes. Par ailleurs elle effectue des ventes dans les prefectures voisines de Bougouni notamment Kolondieba et Yanfolila.
Avec ce prêt elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 30 000FCFA  qui sera utlisé essentiellement pour renforcer le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadia T. is a 54-year old widow who lives with her 4 children in the home of her deceased husband, located in the Niebala neighborhood in the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Since she didn't get the chance to attend school for social reasons, she started to work and make money early on. She decided to sell "bazin" cloth (highly prized cloth in Western Africa). With this loan, she will buy 15 pieces of withe "bazin" from merchants in the grand market of Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). She then contracts dyers in Bougouni to tint the fabrics in various prized colors or patterns, as requested by her clientele. She then sells the fabrics door-to-door in various neighborhoods in the city, to a mostly female clientele. Furthermore, she also sells in the neighboring cities, most notably in Kolondieba and Yonfolila. With this loan, she foresees to make a profit of XOF 30'000 (ca 60 US$), to be mainly used to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de bazins

loans.name: Khatira

texts.en:
Khatira H., 47, is a mother of five children.  For most of her family life, she has been dedicated to raising livestock.  The self-sacrifice and attention that she brings to raising each one of her sheep has increased the quantity of sheep.  As a result, she is able to give her children the opportunity to pursue university studies, giving her much pride and satisfaction. 

Her next goal is to expand the business into selling sheep, not only to local bazaar traders but also to local restaurants.  This business would generate enough additional income to sustain her home and enable her to pay the university costs for her children.  In order to meet her goals, Khatira is asking for a loan to buy more sheep. Khatira hopes that her expanded business will help her realize the dream of seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase 18 sheep

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 41 años, vive con su pareja, su hijo y unos inquilinos en casa. Para labrar la tierra hay que tener arte dice Juana, desde niña hizo las labores agrícolas, se levantaba a las 4.00am ayudaba a preparar el almuerzo a su madre, y hasta ahora hace la misma actividad, pero en esta vez es para su esposo e hijos. Esta familia siembra de 5 a 7 hectáreas de zanahorias y lechuga al año, y además  compran chacras sembradas de lechuga y espinaca de los vecinos para llevarlas a los mercados ganando por cada viaje de 200 a 300 soles, depende de cómo cotizan los productos en el mercado. Juana está muy complacida con sus cultivos y las reventas de los productos, por las gratificantes ganancias que obtiene cada vez que va al mercado, no cuenta que los precios de las verduras no tienen un precio estándar, hay épocas, como en el verano que la lechuga y la zanahoria llegan a costar hasta 50 soles el saco, pero a veces baja mucho como a hasta 20 o 25 soles por saco. Durante cinco préstamos consecutivos viene trabajando Juana con MFP, asimismo se compromete a pagar con la misma puntualidad este sexto crédito. Con el dinero solicitado comprará fertilizantes para el cultivo de sus próximas chacras de zanahoria, y también está muy agradecida con MFP por el dinero que le confían.
texts.en:
Juana is 41 years old and lives with her husband, her son, and some tenants in her house. Juana says that plowing the land is an art. Since she was a child, she has done agricultural work. She used to wake up at 4:00 am to help her mother prepare lunch, and now she does the same thing, but this time it is for her husband and children. This family sows 5 to 7 hectares of carrots and lettuce every year and then they buy plots sown with lettuce and spinach from the neighbors to take them to the markets. In each trip to the market, they earn 200 to 300 soles, depending on how they price their products. Juana is very pleased with their crops and the resale of the products, because of the rewarding earnings that she gets every time she goes to the market. The vegetables don’t have a standard price. There are times, like in the summer, when the lettuce and the carrots cost as much as 50 soles per sack, but at times, the prices are as low as 20 to 25 soles per sack. Juana has worked with MFP for five consecutive loans. As such, she will repay this sixth loan with the same punctuality. With the money she is requesting, she will buy fertilizers for the cultivation of her next plots of carrots, and she is also very grateful for MFP because of the money that they loan her.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her plots

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a village store owner who has been managing her business for almost a year and it really helps her in meeting the needs of her children.  She would like to borrow a loan of PHP 4,000.00 that she will to use to expand her business. She is planning to purchase additional merchandise for her store such as garlic, onions, bottled soft drinks, canned goods and so on.  She will do her best to help her husband earn money for their immediate needs and education of their four children.

Elisa is 33 years old and married to Isidro, a driver for Petron Company based in Hilltop, Naguillan, Isabela.  They are blessed with four kids: Ariel, 12, already in grade six; Arnie, 11, grade five; Alvin John, 4, and Isidro Jr., 2.  Despite the difficulties, they always do their best to be successful.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice Kwaje has a business selling groundnut paste and has applied for a loan in order to expand her business.  Rejoice is 30 years old and married; her husband is a policeman. They have four children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send the children to school.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To send the children to school

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.en:
Since she was a small girl, Bahriniso has been entirely dedicated to work. She buys and sells cattle. Until now, this has been the most important source of income for her. Her work consists of raising beef cattle. After fattening them, she sells at the best price and makes her profit. In the future, she wants to start another business. 

In the meantime she will continue dedicating herself to cattle-raising. Right now she wishes to expand her business and purchase more cattle. That is the reason that Bahriniso has asked for a loan of $1200 USD. You could become an important part of Bahriniso family's life. She deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cattle to expand her business

loans.name: Semilina

texts.es:
Semilina es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba, Semilina es D. L. comunidad D. Huascahura que se ubica a 20 minutos D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Semilina es soltera, tiene 41 años y 1 hijo, Semilina tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donD. venD. ropa. Además Semilina compra tara, cochinilL., cuero que luego venD. en L. ciudad D. Ayacucho a los intermediarios.
Semilina necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. pantalones casacas.
Semilina sueña con construir su casa y que su hijo salga adelante.
texts.en:
Semilina is a member of the Urubamba Communal Bank. She is from the community of Huascahura which is located 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Semilina is 41 years of age, single and has one son. She has a store in rented space where she sells clothing. She also buys tara (a raw material for making tannic acid), hides and suckling pigs which she later re-sells to suppliers in Ayacucho. Semilina needs a loan of 3,000 Sols which she will invest in the purchase of pants and jackets. She hopes one day to build herself a house and that her son will be able to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Dios Todo Lo Puede - Group 3

texts.en:
Paula G. owns what is called a fantasia in the Dominican Republic. It is a small store mostly dedicated to offering personal care products, accessories and school supplies. With this loan, Paula will ensure her fantasia is properly stocked for the months to come. She hopes to expand her business to transform it into a department store in the future. Her greatest ambition is to see her children practicing professional careers of their choice. She has four children: ages 19, 14, 13 and 11.

Paula has been appointed the group coordinator of this group of five entrepreneurs from San Pedro de Macoris. They are starting their microfinance venture with this Kiva loan. These are people who have been involved in trade activities for some time but who do not have financial support to sustain their businesses through the current economic situation.

Please help us support these new microentrepreneurs with a Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase articles for her store

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 45 years old and married to A. and they have four children. Flora sells sarongs and jewelry. She has been in business since 1995.

Flora hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Greetings from Yvonne T.. She is a 33 year old Rwandan entrepreneur. She is single however she has three dependents who are 18, 16, and 10 years old. She lives in the Jali sector of the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Yvonne does her business in Jali sector. She owns a restaurant that feeds many people in the neighborhood. She starts working at 6:00 a.m and finishes at 8:00 p.m and employs four workers.

She is requesting her first loan for 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company. She earns $440 in monthly profit and hopes to increase her profit after this loan. She will use this loan to expand her restaurant. With increased profits, she will continue to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther D. is 63 years old and is married with eight children. She sells native sarongs in the traditional cloth of the people of Asaba in Delta State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more native sarongs to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more native sarongs to sell

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad and her family have lived in the village of Palao Solana, Cagayan, for already ten years. She is married to Enrique and gifted with four children. Her four children are all now in their 20’s but they were not able to reach college due to financial problems. 

Natividad earns a living by maintaining her clothes repairing and sewing business. Some of the things she makes are uniforms for students and teachers, shorts, pants, bed sheets, and curtains. Aside from that, she is also engaged in selling different vegetables and salted eggs.

Natividad wants her businesses to become progressive and that is why she is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 15,000.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Dios Es Esperanza Group 1

texts.en: Miranda Y. is 24 years old. She is hoping to start a new business selling cooking fuels and food items, such as sugar and coffee, with help from her first loan from Kiva and Esperanza International. Miranda has just moved to the sugarcane-cutting community (called a 'batey') of El Prado, which lies in the eastern part of the Dominican Republic. She has never owned her own business before. Currently, Miranda, her husband, and their four children live in severe poverty. The family has no regular source of income.

loans.use: To buy cooking fuel and food items for small general store

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah Kwamboka is 36 years old. She is married to Caleb Bosire, who is 40 years and is a barber by profession, and they have been blessed with three children, Kevin, Miriam and Sarah.They live in Eastern Nairobi in a a semi-slum area known as Kware.

Dinah Kwamboka has run her business for the last year. She will use the loan to expand  and start processing cereals and eventually start a retail shop.

loans.use: STOCKING CEREALS (BEANS, MAIZE, WHOLEMONG, PEAS)

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
el sr. JOSE ARMANDO H. se dedica a cortar pelo de caballero, tiene una barberia la que ha funcionado por mas de 8 años prestando servicios de corte de pelo, barba, masajes. los clientes lo prefieren por su profesionalismo.
su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar muy estrategico lo que facilita a sus clientes para ir a su barberia, le visitan de diferentes sectores de la zona urbana y rural.
Esta casado y tiene dos hijos que estan estudiando en centros educativos publicos de la colonia donde ellos habitan.
El  Sr. H. nos comento y pudimos constatar que su su negocio es uno de los mas concurridos por las personas que necesitan cortarse el pelo, el tiene clientes durante todo el año.
EL Sr. H. piensa abrir una nueva barberia en otro lugar estrategico que le permita brindar  sus servicios como hasta la fecha los ha brindado, contribuyendo de esta manera la generacion de empleo que tanto se necesita en esta zona.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Armando H. is a barber and has a barbershop that has been offering haircuts, razor shaves, and massages for over 8 years. His clients prefer him because of his professionalism. His business is located in a convenient location for his many clients who visit from other urban and rural areas.

He is married and has two children who are studying in a public school in the suburb where they live.

Mr. H. told us and we observed, that his business is one of the most popular for people who need a haircut and he has clients all year long. Mr. H. is thinking about opening a new barbershop in another strategic location which would allow him to offer his services elsewhere and generate employment necessary in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying hair clippers, scissors, oil, shampoos, combs, and lotions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: repair the working place

loans.name: Good Will Outreach Group

texts.en:
Good Will Outreach is a group of five borrowers led by A.B Joseph C., a 40-year-old college graduate who is married with children ages 9-15 years old. His children's educational levels are from 2nd to 8th grade. He also cares for one sibling.

He lives and works in the Brewer V. community, north of the capital of Monrovia, Liberia. It is a community that is mixed with both poor and middle class Liberians, but the rate of poverty is high.

A.B Joseph's business is agricultural activities. He grows different kinds of plants for consumption, like cabbage, potatoes, lettuce, cassava leaves, etc., which he sells to the residents of Brewer V., northern Monrovia, Liberia. He started this business six years ago. When he graduated from university, he decided to get into agriculture. Since Joseph got into agriculture, that has been the means of taking care of his family. The way Joseph speaks and interacts with his customers makes them always want to buy from him. 

He needs this loan in order to purchase agricultural materials like fertilizer, seeds of different kinds, a digger and a shovel in order to improve his business. His dream is to have a big farm with which he can serve at least Monrovia, and to educate his children for their future to come.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds, and farming tools

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan Antonio C. C. reside en Ilopango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Juan tiene 45 años de edad vive con su esposa , su hija y la madre. Juan tiene una panadería ubicada en su domicilio, donde fabrica grandes cantidades de pan francés para ser distribuido en la zona, Juan tiene 10 años de estar al frente de su negocio, por el cual hoy solicita de un crédito para invertir en cantidades de materia prima para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio C. C. lives in the town of Ilopango in the department of San Salvador. He is 45 years old and lives with his wife, their daughter, and his mother. He operates a bakery out of his home where he makes large quantities of French bread for distribution throughout the area. Juan has been in business for 10 years. He is requesting a loan today to buy large quantities of ingredients to increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to increase production

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora tiene 48 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, Aurora es enfermera hace varios años brinda servicio a domicilio y también atiende en su domicilio particular, paralelamente trabaja en el cuidado a personas de la tercera edad como enfermería de cabecera, a ella le gusta bastante el trabajo que realiza.  Su esposo trabaja en una empresa constructora hace varios años es topógrafo y gracias a los prestamos de Agrocapital y la buena administración de sus ingresos lograron estabilizarse económicamente, es el tercer crédito al que accedieron en la institución el cual fue para cancelar una deuda personal de la operación de su hija, Aurora es muy responsable y honesta siempre cancelo los créditos sin problemas y siempre trabajo con la institución.
texts.en:
Aurora is 48 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and daughter. She has been a nurse for a number of years, working at patients' homes while also providing services out of her own. At the same time, she also works as a bedside nurse for seniors in the city. Aurora quite likes the work she does. Her husband has worked for a construction company for a number of years as a topographer, and thanks to the loans from Kiva partner AgroCapital and administering their income properly they have been able to reach some economic stability. This is the third loan Aurora has been granted, and she's using it to pay off debt from her daughter's operation. Aurora is very responsible and honest, and she always pays off her loans without problems and works well with this microfinance institution.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay off personal debt from her daughter's operation

loans.name: Diarraye

texts.fr: Diarraye S. est une femme de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants, elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Kounkané3 depuis le 13 janvier 2006. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide. Elle soutien son mari avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise de son commerce.
texts.en:
Diarraye S. is a 36-year-old woman who is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de Kounkané3 since January 13, 2006. She processes and sells peanut butter. She supports her husband with the profits she earns from her commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her small-scale peanut butter business

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita B., 57, is a widow who lives in Malibay, Pasay City. She owns a general store located on an alley in front of her house. She has been in business for nearly 20 years and earns more than 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

Emerita joined the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) in 2003. The loans provided by the cooperative have helped sustain her business. She is now applying for a 17,000 PHP loan from CCT which she will use to expand her store by purchasing more items to sell. She wishes to have a better place to conduct her business. She has also been dreaming of having her own house and lot for her children.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response to poverty and social injustice. It is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. CCT serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Doki

texts.en:
Doki S. is currently in the business of selling fish and fresh vegetables in a market and is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh and dried fish to sell.  Doki is 25 years old and widowed.   She has 2 children, who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more fresh and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha M. M. has a business located at Easleigh estate in Nairobi and it's known by the name "Kavumbu Fashions and Boutique". She is 47 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are still in school.

Martha is a dressmaker and she is using her loan to buy more material to grow her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to serve more customers and educate her children to the university level. She is generous, active and visionary.

loans.use: To buy materials for dressmaking

loans.name: Genobeba

texts.es:
Genobeba, es una mujer muy dinámica, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 51 años, es madre de cinco hijos, todos mayores de edad e independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, esta actividad la realiza llevando sus productos a caseríos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es trabajador independiente. Genobeba forma parte D. Banco Comunal “Nuevas Amigas” desde hace dos años y cinco meses.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de jugos (negocio que tenía anteriormente).
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, que será invertido en productos de abarrotes en general.  La meta de Genobeba es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Genobeba is a very dynamic woman. She lives in the district of Callería in the Ucayali region. She is 51 years old and the mother of five children, all of them are adults and live independently. She sells basic grocieries door to door. She has the support of her husband, who is self-employed. Genobeba has been part of the "Nuevas Amigas" Communal Bank for the past 2 years and 5 months. The first loan she received, for 300 soles, was invested in a business she previously had selling juices. Now she needs a loan for 2,000 soles, which will be used to buy basic groceries. Genobeba´s goal is to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries for her business

loans.name: Farouk

texts.en: Farouk is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents and 3 siblings. He has owned a mini market in his town since 2003. He opened this small business to help his father with the family's income and to improve his economic situation. His mini-market is situated in a busy area. Because of the shop location, he has been able to have an increasing number of clients pass by his shop and buy all types of food products. Today, Farouk is requesting to borrow $800 to buy more merchandise so he can increase his sales and, therefore, his income.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Laura Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Laura S. es de la Comarca de Cofradía, ella trabaja como profesora de primaria en la escuela Rubén Darío ella tiene de laborar ya veinte años,  el crédito ella lo ocupara para consumo personal, como por ejemplo pago de matricula de su hija que va a la universidad, comprarle los libros ya que son muy caros. Doña Laura se acerca a  CEPRODEL para que le  ayude en el bienestar de  su familia, brindar un nivel de vida mejor a sus hijos, y así  sacarlos adelante en sus estudio.
texts.en:
Laura S. is from Cofradía. She is an elementary school teacher at Rubén Darío school; she has been working for 20 years. She will use the funds for personal expenses like her daughter's university tuition and to buy her some textbooks, which are very expensive. Laura approaces CEPRODEL to seek help for her family's wellbeing, to provide a better quality of life for her children, and to provide an education for them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For college tuition and to buy books.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La Señora Alicia solicita un nuevo crédito para aumentar su capital y así traer una 
cantidad mucho mayor de mercadería, esto debido a que las dos ultimas semanas de febrero tendrá mucho movimiento y mas demanda del producto.
              
La señora Alicia se dedica a la venta de pescado al por mayor (en latas), se provee de sus parientes que viven en Tiquina (cerca al lago Titicaca) y se dedican a la pesca. La rutina de la señora Alicia comienza los días lunes que viaja a las 4 de la mañana hasta Tiquina para comprar el pescado que pueda a un precio mas bajo por ser pariente de los proveedores, para volver en la tarde y dejar la mayor parte de la mercadería en la Av. Juan Pablo II (final Los Andes) a sus clientes que se encargan de vender la misma por unidad. durante la semana de martes a jueves se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para llegar a la ciudad de el Alto a las 7 30 y cobrar por la mercadería, actualmente la señora incremento sus ventas ya que trae entre 2 a 3 latas mas de pejerrey (el producto que mas le sale) y también consiguió un trabajo de medio tiempo por las tardes como empleada del hogar en Calacoto y recibe un salario mensual e 600 bolivianos aprovechando que su esposo Ramiro sigue trabajando al frente de la casa como albañil y a cargo de los dos niños que todavía no van al colegio.

Esta agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Alicia is asking for a new loan to increase her capital and bring more merchandise because the last two weeks in February she will have a lot of business and more demand for the product. Alicia sells canned fish at wholesale. Her relatives who live in Tiquina (neal Lake Titicaca) are her suppliers; they are fishermen. Her typical routine is a follows: On Mondays, she rises at 4am to travel to Tiquina to buy fish. Because she buys from her relatives, the price she gets is lower. She returns in the afternoon and sells most of her product on Juan Pablo II avenue (cross street: Los Andes) to her customers who then resell it at retail. During the week, from Tuesday to Thursday she rises at 5am in order to be in the city of El Alto by 7:30 to collect on her sales. She has recently increased her sales because she brings between 2 and 3 additional cans of pejerrey (silverside fish), which is the product that sells the most. She also has a part-time job in the afternoon as a domestic employee in a home in Calacoto; she gets a monthly salary of 600 bolivianos for this work. She takes advantage of the fact that her husband, Ramiro, works as a bricklayer in front of their house and he watches over their two children who are not in school yet. She is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust they have placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy canned fish.

loans.name: Maguete

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Maguette G. a 33 ans et habite à Ouakam. Elle est membre de la caisse de Ouakam depuis 5 ans. Elle est célibataire  et a en charge deux enfants. Elle évolue  depuis un an dans le domaine de la restauration, activité qu’elle a hérité  de sa mère  qui est d’ailleurs une ancienne membre active de la caisse qui a beaucoup bénéficié  des services de l’institution(voir photo).Elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs pour acheter les denrées  de base qui lui permettent de préparer  en vue de constituer un stock. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et de leur payer les études.
texts.en:
Ms. Maguette G. is 33 years old and lives in Ouakam. She has been a member of the savings institution in Ouakam for the past five years. She is single and has two children in her care. She has for the past year been developing a restauration business, which she inherited from her mother; the latter was, by the way, an active member of the savings institution and benefited significantly from the institution's services (see photo). She is applying for a loan of 50,000 francs to buy basic groceries which will allow her to prepare food with a view to building up a stock. Her profits allow her to meet the needs of her children and to pay for their studies.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Resupply her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Berlinda

texts.en:
Berlinda M. is from the village of Gampis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 42 years old, married, and has 3 adult and school-aged children. To make a living, Berlinda sells fish in the market and nearby Barangays. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from the income of her husband as a fisherman. 

Berlinda has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.In 2008, Berlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Berlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for the tuition fee of her daughter. Berlinda is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital and for the tuition fees of her daughter. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Berlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and for the future of her child.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en: Shamil A. is a 29-year-old trader who sells home products as well as some cookies and sweets. He has five years of experience in this field. Shamil is married and has a son. His main clients are women because they usually come to buy something for their house. Shamil applied for a loan of 1000 AZN and will purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sreimoa

texts.en: Mrs. Sreimoa Y., a resident of Preaek Hang village in Kandal Province, was born 1979 and owns a small piece of the land upon which she grows crops to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Vany Sieng, is a fisherman.  In order to improve his catch, she is seeking a loan to buy fishing equipment for his business. Sreimoa is a mother of six children, four of whom are attending in local public school, while the youngest two are yet too young to attend.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal J. is a 29-year-old trader who sells different kinds of goods, such as candies, tea, cookies, pasta, shampoo, detergent and soap. Vusal has four years of experience in this field. He is married and has two children. 

Vusal runs his own store, which he built a year ago owing to his hard work and ability to save money. His monthly income is 400 AZN and he wishes to increase it to 700 AZN. For this purpose, he has applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to increase number of products he sells. 

Vusal wishes to build another, bigger shop as soon he can save enough. He believes the new loan will bring well-being to his two children.

loans.use: purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Estelle

texts.fr: L. Estelle est née le 29 Mai 1974 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Estelle vit depuis vingt ans à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à DOSSOU KOKO Germain, Estelle est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Estelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Ayant abandonné très tôt l’école, Estelle a appris la coiffure et l’exerce depuis huit ans. Parallèlement, Estelle vend des mèches, des produits pour cheveux et de façon secondaire, des bijoux dans son atelier de coiffure, situé à son domicile. Estelle achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Estelle sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit, en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de mieux équiper son salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
Estelle L. was born on May 29, 1974, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For 20 years, she's been living in Lokokoukoumè, in Sèmè-Podji. She's married to Germain DOSSOU KOKO, and the mother of three school-attending children. She lives with her husband and children. The couple provides for the family together. After dropping out of school quite early on, Estelle was trained as a hairdresser, a business she's been running for eight years in her salon located at her home. In parallel, she sells hair extensions and haircare products, as well as jewelry, as a secondary business. Estelle gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Benin. For the first time, she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster her working capital and better outfit her salon.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and haircare products

loans.name: Ana Yensi

texts.es: La señora Ana Yensi G. L., tiene 24 años es  casada  y su esposo se dedica al comercio, ellos habitan en una casa humilde en el Barrio San Pedro, ellos son una pareja de recién casados que han comenzado sus días a labrarse su porvenir, así mismo como el de su futuro hijo que viene en camino, es para su hogar que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de  materiales de construcción tale como cemento, laminas de zinc, bloques, con este material edificaran un muro trasero que les brindara una mejor seguridad por las lluvias que caen en este invierno y los proximos, asi como tranquilidad de la familia de brindarles comodidad a toda su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Yensi G. L. is 24 years old and married. Her husband works as a merchant. They live in a modest house in the San Pedro neighborhood. This couple is recently married and has started to carve out their future. In addition, they are expecting a child.

Ana is requesting a housing loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sheets of zinc, blocks, and other materials to build a rear wall that will provide them better protection from the rain during this winter season and in the future. This will give her peace of mind as she tries to provide every comfort for her young family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build a wall at the back of her house

loans.name: To Time Group

texts.en:
These are women with small-scale businesses in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They have come to SMT, also a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of SLL 1,400,000 for the group to enable them expand their businesses.

With a loan of SLL 1,400,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school and be able to feed and clothe them.

Kadiatu B. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. She was born in a place called Rotifunk about forty years ago. She is married and has three children who are attending schools: two in secondary school and one in primary school. Her husband is a carpenter.

For eighteen years now, Kadiatu has been selling house-building materials: cement, iron rods, paint, etc. With her SLL 800,000 share of the loan, she will buy more of the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more house-building materials such as cement, iron rods, paint, etc.

loans.name: Alioune

texts.fr: Monsieur Alioune N. est un jeune tailleur célibataire qui habite dans la localité de Cambérene. C’était depuis son enfance qu’il a commencé à apprendre le métier de tailleur. Cela fait maintenant 2 ans lorsqu’il a ouvert son propre atelier. Son activité consiste à travailler sur commande et aussi à exposer des habits confectionnés destinés à la vente. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Cambérene depuis mars 2009. Il a déjà remboursé 2 prêts  antérieurs. Il  sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et de fournitures  qui seront destinés a renforcer ses capacités a exposer des habits en vue de la préparation des fêtes  de korité  et de tabaski. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices et de mieux prendre en charge ses besoins sociaux.
texts.en:
Mr. Alioune N. is a young unmarried tailor who lives in Cambérene commune. He began learning the tailoring trade when he was a child and opened his own workshop 2 years ago. His business consists of custom-made clothing and ready-to-wear clothing displayed for sale. He has been a member of the Cambérene credit association since March of 2009 and has already repaid two previous loans. He is asking for a loan of 300,000 frs intended for the purchase of fabric and supplies that will be used to increase the volume of his clothing displays in preparation for the Korité and Tabaski holidays. This financing will enable him to increase his profit and better provide for his needs.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Sophak

texts.en:
Mr. Sophak P. (in the photo), 46, and his wife, Mrs. Channa Ponh, 47, were married in 2002 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of them are in school and another one has full-time employment. They are living in a small village on National Road Number 2 about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sophak has been raising pigs for two years. In addition, he grows rice as well. His wife is a garment-factory worker. He is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to purchase food for his pigs and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy food for his pigs and pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Roxana Maria

texts.es: La solicitante Roxana maría R. M. se dedica a la venta de ropa hace un año aproximadamente, vive con su madre ya que es soltera no tiene carga familiar le ayuda  a su madre en los gastos familiares . Solicita el crédito para  comprar mercaderia de media estación , desea tener un puesto de ropa en un centro comercial de Ica, se propone otorgarle el crédito ya que presenta experiencia acrediticia en otras entidades bancarias en la cual está pagando puntualmente y también tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en: The borrower Roxana María R. M. has had a business selling clothing for approximately one year. She lives with her mother since she is single and has no family burdens of her own and helps her mother with the family expenses. She is seeking the loan in order to purchase mid-season merchandise. She would like to have a clothing stand at a shopping center in Ica. She is recommended as a loan recipient because she has credit experience already with other banking entities with which she is making payments punctually and also has good personal and work references.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Sheyla Yolanda

texts.es: Sheyla Yolanda tiene 23 años su actividad es la venta de pollo hace mas de 5 años que tiene este negocio. Esta es la primera vez que solicita crédito para su actividad, ella tiene 1 hijo de 3 años menor de edad y que está a su cargo inicio esta actividad para ayudar en los gastos del hogar quien le enseño este medio de vida fue su Mama ya que anteriormente ella tenía una pulpería así fue que Sheyla aprendió a ganarse la vida. El financiamiento es para la compra de pollo en pieza para ofertárselo a sus clientes.
texts.en: Sheyla Yolanda is 23 years old, and her work is selling chicken, which she has done for more than 5 years.  This is the first time she has asked for a loan for her work.  She has a 3-year-old son, and it is because he is in her care that she started her business in order to help with the household expenses.  Her mother, who earlier ran a store, was the one who taught her this means of making a living.  The loan is to buy chicken parts in order to sell them to her customers.

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Nar

texts.fr: Madame Nar S. est une femme de 53 ans. Elle habite à Yoff. Elle mariée et mère d’un  enfant de 29 ans. Elle s’active dans la confection d’habits. En plus elle vend  du petit déjeuner dans une école du quartier. Elle a une expérience de plus de dix ans dans ces activités. La vente de petit déjeuner est une activité qu’elle a héritée de sa mère. Et c’est sous l’influence de cette dernière qu’elle a fait son choix. C’st un grand plaisir pour elle de confectionner des habits et de les vendre a crédits a ses clients. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis janvier 2004. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et de garnitures destinés à la vente. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices afin de pouvoir faire face au règlement de la scolarité de ses petits fils. Elle souhaite aussi renforcer son épargne de sorte à parvenir à acquérir un terrain dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Ms. Nar S. is a 53-year-old woman who lives in Yoff.  She is married and the mother of one child, who is 29.  Ms. S. is active in making clothing.  In addition, she sells breakfasts in a district school.  She has over ten years of experience in these activities.  Selling breakfasts is a business that her mother passed down to her.  And under her guidance, Ms. S. then made her choice.  She really enjoys making clothing and selling them, on credit, to her customers.
