Ms. S. has been a member of the Yoff branch since January 2004.  She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs for buying cloth and some trim to be sold.  Her goal is to increase her profits in order to cope with schooling costs for her grandchildren.  She also wishes to bolster her savings, so that she is able to acquire a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: Buying cloth and trim

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
YASAIDA LUPE, ES MADRE SOLTERA, TIENE 27 AÑOS DE EDAD, Y TIENE 2 HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD. ACTUALMENTE ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO "LOS ANGELES", EL CUAL RECIENTEMENTE ACABA DE FORMARCE, Y SE ENCUENTRA INTEGRADO POR 07  SOCIAS QUE RESIDEN EN LA ZONA DE VILLA JUANITA EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO.
DESDE HACE UN AÑO, LA SRA. YASAIDA LUPE SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MAZAMORRA DE CALABAZA EN LAS AFUERAS DE UN COLEGIO. SE INICA EN ESTE NEGOCIO YA QUE EN EL COLEGIO DE SU HIJO, A LOS NIÑOS LES GUSTA MUCHO ESTE POSTRE, ASI ES QUE YASALDA DECIDE PONER ESTE NEGOCIO, Y ES ASI COMO INICIA UNA FUENTE DE INGRESOS PARA SU HOGAR, PERMITIENDOLE MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA Y LA DE SUS HIJOS Y CRECER CON SU PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO.
CON EL ESFUERZO DE SU TRABAJO YASADIA LUPE HA LOGRADO INCREMENTAR SU NEGOCIO Y LOGRAR LA CAPTACION DE UNA MAYOR CLIENTELA, SU GRAN ANHELO ES PONER UN PUESTO EN EL MERCADO.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN SU NEGOCIO Y EN LA COMPRA DE JUGUETES PARA LA CAMPAÑA NAVIDEÑA.
texts.en:
27-year old Yasaida Lupe is a single mother of two young children. She is the current president of the recently-formed “Los Angeles” group. The group is comprised of seven members who live in the neighbourhood of Villa Juanista in Carabayllo district.

For the last year Sra. Yasaida has earned her living by selling mazamorra de calabaza (a Peruvian pumpkin-based dessert) outside a school. She started this business because at her son’s school, the children really like this dessert. The job provides an income for the household and allows Yasaida to improve the standard of living of her children.

By putting a lot of effort into her work, Yasaida has managed to expand the business and gain more customers. Her great wish is to open a stall in the market. The loan she is seeking will be invested in the business and the purchase of toys for the Christmas season.

loans.use: purchase of toys to resell in the Christmas season

loans.name: Flordesa

texts.es:
La señora Flordesa O. D. C. es casada tiene 40 años D. edad, apenas estudio hasta el nivel D. primario, tiene 1 hija. Flordesa vive con su esposo, tienen su vivienda en la zona D. Caico al sud oeste  D. la provincia Cercado del departamento D. Cochabamba. 

La señora Flordesa y su esposo se dedican a la producción D. leche cruda, toda su producción lechera entrega a un modulo lechero D. la zona, para su posterior recojo por parte D. PIL ANDINA. 
Las condiciones en las que viven son modestas, su vivienda cuenta con los servicios básicos, su ganado se cría en la misma propiedad. La señora Flordesa es una señora muy dedicada a su trabajo, pues ella su esposo y su hija se levantan muy temprano todos los días para orD.ñar las vacas. Y durante todo el día se dedican al cuidado D. las mimas, actividad en la que participa toda la familia. 
  
La señora Flordesa solicita el crédito para la adquisición D. alimento en general, ya que en esta época  escasea y sube considerablemente D. precio. Así mismo pueda mantener la producción D. leche D. manera que no bajen sus ingresos y estos se mantengan estables. El ideal que tiene la señora Flordesa es que por lo menos su hija termine D. estudiar y pueda  posteriormente alcanzar alguna profesión
texts.en:
Flordesa O. D. C. is married and is 40 years old. She has only an elementary education. She has one daughter. Flordesa lives with her husband. Their home is in the Caico zone in the Southwest of the Cercado province, in the Cochabamba department. Flordesa and her husband produce cruD. milk and sell all of their dairy products to a local dairy company to later be collected by PIL ANDINA [a Bolivian dairy company]. 
      They live in modest conditions; their home has basic services. Their farm is on the same property. Flordesa is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. She, her husband and their daughter all get up very early every day to take care of the cows, which they do all day-the whole family participates. Flordesa is requesting this loan to buy general food, since in this time of shortage the price has increased considerably. This way, she will be able to maintain milk production and not see a decrease in her income, so that her income will remain stable. Her dream is for her daughter to at least finish her studies and then achieve a profession.

loans.use: the purchase of food for her dairy farm

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
This is 46 year old Fatu K.. She is married and has one child, age 22. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because she helps in Fatu's business and around her home. 

In 1995, Fatu established her pans and rubber bowls business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about  700000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3000000 in order to add more stock to her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 545000 SLL. 

In the future, Fatu plans to educate her child to university level. She would also like to use a portion of her profits to support her husband in building a home. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more pans and bowls

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
En Yaguarón,  se reunieron unas mujeres con el fin de  invertir en su actividad y otras para emprender actividades productivas, de ahí que se dispusieron a realizar la reunión para interiorizarse sobre el programa, quienes aceptaron por los beneficios brindados por el programa.
El comité lleva por nombre Virgen del Rosario, actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo, integrada por 18  emprendedoras señoras, quienes ponen lo mejor de si para aumentar sus ingresos.
 Todas las integrantes son luchadoras y guapas quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades y por medio de eso brindarle lo mejor posible a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Concepcion quien se dedica a la venta de mercasderias de primera necesidad para el consumo familiar.
Ella se encuentra satisfecha con su negocio ya que nos comenta que la ayuda a alimentar muy bien a su familia por que cubre con todos los gastos. 
Por ello para ella siempre conviene invertir en la compra de mercaderias para surtir la despensa .
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderias como fideos, azucar, arroz, panificados y otros.
texts.en:
In the city of Yaguaron a group of women came together with the common goal of investing in their businesses and to learn about new productive businesses. Since then they have endeavored to join the program, a welcome event for the benefits the programs brings.

The group's name is Virgen del Rosario and they are currently on their fourth loan cycle. It is made up of 18 enterprising women who put their best foot forward with the goal of improving their incomes.

The members of the group are hard working, beautiful women who have invested their loans in their respective businesses in order to provide their families with the best possible. One of the members is Concepcion and she has a general store from where she sells basic needs products for the entire family.  She is very happy with her business because it helps keep her family well fed and she is able to cover all their expenses. 

She is always ready to invest in the purchase of merchandise to supply her store. She requests a loan to purchase pastas, sugar, rice, and pastries among other items.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to stock a general store.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel S. de 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos niños de 10 y 4 años de edad, por quienes trabaja muy duro para darles lo mejor. Ella reside en el departamento de San Salvador don vive junto a sus hijos, su hermano y una cuñada, con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, lo que le ayuda mucho a Reyna ya que puede brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos. Reyna posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, en la cual invierte gran parte de su tiempo ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee, es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir, comprando mayor cantidad de productos tanto alimenticios como de uso para el hogar, así de esta manera ella espera mejorar sus ganancias y salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel S. is 32 years old and she is a single mother of two children, aged 10 and 4. She works very hard to provide them only with the best. She lives together with her children, her brother and sister-in-law in the region of San Salvador. She shares the household expenses with them which is a great help because this way she is able to provide her kids with everything they need.

Reyna has a general store and she invests a large part of her time because it is her only source of income. She requests a loan to invest in her business by purchasing a larger quantity of products, both food products and household products. She expects to improve her profits and she will come out ahead together with her family.

loans.use: To purchase general store merchandise.

loans.name: Aida Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Aída Z. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la comunidad de Paccha, esta comunidad se caracteriza por la belleza de su naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Doña Aída tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad. Su esposo labora en la rama de la construcción ya que es albañil, con su trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora. Aída se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de su hijo que aun es pequeño, pero como pasa en casa tambien se dedica a la cría de animales como: pollos y cuyes a los cuales los vende en su propia comunidad.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue motivada po su suegrea para que ingrese al mismo, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. Su meta es  crdeecer mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Aída Z. is a member of the "Mujeres Floreciendo" community bank.  She lives in Paccha, a community which is noted for its natural beauty.  Its residents work raising livestock and farming crops.

Aida is 24 years old, married, and has one 4 year-old son.  Her husband works in the construction industry.  He is a builder and, through his work, they have managed to build their own home.

Aida carries out her housework and looks after her son who is still young.  However, she also raises animals such as chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in her own community.

Aida is taking her second loan through her community bank which she was encouraged to join by her mother-in-law.  She will invest her loan money in buying chickens and chicken feed.  Her goal is to grow a lot more in her business.

loans.use: To buy chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer G. is from the village of San Jose, Mahinog, Camiguin, Province. He is 49 years old and married. To make a living, Elmer owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks & other delicacies like roasted peanuts in the local community. He is also making and selling cocoa powder or bars. Elmer has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elmer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Elmer is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients like peanuts & cocoa fruits. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elmer from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional raw ingredients like peanuts & cocoa fruits

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn D. is from the village of Tagpako, Gingoog City. She is 34 years old. Roselyn is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Roselyn owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks & other delicacies, like rice and cheese cakes, in the local community. Roselyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Roselyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roselyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients, like eggs & flour, needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Roselyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients, like eggs and flour, needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Ekua Essoun Mary

texts.en:
Ekua Essoun Mary K. has been selling banku (a staple made from fermented cassava dough) and stew for the past 9 years. She is from Kokowada, near Elmina, and is married to a farmer. Her earnings help pay for their three children’s education and household utility bills. 

Ekua plans to expand her food business and needs a loan to purchase larger quantities of ingredients. The profits from the extra sales will be reinvested into her business for greater growth.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Badegna, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des familles nucléaires  dans le village de Belenikoro, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de savon et du charbon de bois. Les femmes du groupe Badegna sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                             
ASSAN D.  compte acheter des condiments avec les revendeurs du marché de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes à la maison et au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Bedegna group are all married, are on average 36 years old, and have three children.  They live mostly in nuclear families in the village of Belenikoro, in the Fana prefecture, in the region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the republic of Mali).
They know each other through family ties, as neighbors, and as friends.  They are in the business of selling condiments, soap, and charcoal.  The women of the Badegna group on are their second joint loan.
ASSAN D. plans to buy condiments from the vendors at the Fana market.   She makes her sales from home and at the market, for cash and on credit, to a clientele of men and women.
She foresees making an average monthly benefit of 10,000 FCFA which will be used to pay the interest on the loan, to make contributions to the costs of social ceremonies, and the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.es: Crisanta tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa que es propia. DesD. hace 4 años posee una tienda en donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad, es así que atienD. todas las mañanas a sus clientes que acuden a su establecimiento, en ocasiones su esposo y su hijo la apoya en las ventas, puesto que también posee animales a las que debe dedicarle tiempo, para ella amabas actividades son importante por que son una fuente D. ingresos para ella y para su familia. Actualmente Crisanta ha perfeccionado su forma D. trabajo en administrar adecuadamente sus recursos y ganancias a fin D. que su negocio se auto sostenga, además D. desarrollarse en la ganadería. Ella esta muy satisfecha D. lo que ha logrado, por ello procura abastecer su tienda con variados productos y ese es su prioridad. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos  ya que es nueva integrante en su banco comunal y esta my agradecida por haber sido admitida en su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. productos para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Crisanta is 62 years old and lives in her home with her husband and son.  She has had a store where she sells primary needs products for the past four years.  Every morning she tends to the customers who visit her establishment.  Sometimes her husband and son help with the sales because she also has animals that she must care for.  To her, both activities are important because they both represent a source of income for her family.  Crisanta has mastered her form of adequately managing her resources and earnings so that her business has become self-sufficient and she can develop her livestock.  She is very satisfied with what she has accomplished.  She wants to stock her store with various products.  This is her priority.

This will be her first loan through MFP and she is committed to being on time with her payments.  She is new to her communal bank and is very grateful for having been allowed into the group.  She will use the money from this loan to buy products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Gulsaara's Group

texts.en:
Gulsaara S., the treasurer of this group, is 39 and lives in Tashkomur – a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Unfortunately, she is a widow and has two daughters, both of whom study at school.

In order to earn money, Gulsaara takes orders and sews and sells Kyrgyz national blankets, cloth and dressmaking supplies. She is also engaged in livestock breeding; reselling livestock animals after fattening them, she earns an additional 1500 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Gulsaara wants to purchase more livestock, and dreams of building a big house for her daughters in the future.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena D. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old. Lucena is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lucena owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products  including fish like milk fish & sardines in the local community. Lucena uses their motorcycle in delivering and selling fish with her husband as the driver. Lucena has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lucena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucena is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell like sardines & milk fish. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lucena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell like sardines & milk fish.

loans.name: Umaru Fullah

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Umaru. He is single and does not have children. In 2006, Umaru established his ready-made shoes and clothing business. He began this business to help him get enough income to take care of his family.  Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 800,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Umaru requires a loan in order to buy shoes and ready-made clothing for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Umaru plans to construct a dwelling house, buy a car, and open another shop in the city. Changes in prices due to inflation are his challenges. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for his business.

loans.name: Mann

texts.en: Mrs. Mann, 33, is a businesswoman who currently lives in the best territory of Kompong Chhnang Province. Since 1990, she has owned a small kiosk in her community which she uses to store many kinds of clay pots to sell to her neighbors and tourists. Mrs. Mann is able to earn an average profit of US$2 per day to pay for daily expenses. She also depends on the income of her husband who is a firewood seller in and around his village. Mrs. Mann has also been working in farming as an annual activity. As the rainy season is coming, Mrs. Mann is looking for a loan to buy two cows because her old cows do not support her farm work.

loans.use: to buy two cows to support her farming

loans.name: Diabandor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 27 avril 2008. Il est composé de sept femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Siré, à la droite de la photo levant la main, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de patte d'arachide, de poisson sèche et de l'huile de palme. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis huit ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, scolarité etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on 27 April 2008. It comprises seven women who live in the same area. Their main activity consists of running small businesses.

Ms. Siré, whose hand is raised on the right in the photo, is responsible for the group. She is 35 years old. She is married and has six children.

She is active in selling peanut paste, dried fish, and palm oil. She has gained lots of experience in this field, which she has been involved in for eight years.

This loan will allow her to increase her capital and better develop her business.

The profits will allow her to improve her family's standard of living (health, nutrition, education, etc.) and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, dried fish, and palm oil.

loans.name: Jonás De Jesús

texts.es: Este cliente se desempeña como gestor tributario, tiene dos años de trabajar en esa institución, es casado tiene un hijo, en total se le han financiado tres créditos con CEPRODEL, los cuales los ha destinado para reparación de su vivienda, estos créditos le han beneficiado para su calidad de vida de él y la de su familia.
texts.en: This client works as tax manager.  He has worked with this institution for two years.  He is married and has a son.  He has had three loans with Ceprodel.  The loans have been to repair his home.  The loans have helped his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like sand, cement, and zinc to expand and repair his home.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien, 42 years old, is married and has a son. She lives with her husband and her son in Ho Chi Minh City.

Her husband earns money as a builder. Hien supports her family with the income that she earns washing laundry and repairing old clothes in her local community. She intends to use her loan to buy a washing machine to expand her business.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 31 years old and married with five children. The oldest child is nine years old and the youngest is one.

Leah is a farmer who tills land in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She grows rice crops to sell. Leah works hard to improve her business and support her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase quality rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She is hoping that through her business, she will be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase quality rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Obdulia Maria

texts.es: Obdulía deseaba tener un negocio pero en su propia casa, y con el cual poder atender a sus hijos, ella sabía coser pero no le abastecía los ingresos de esta actividad. Así es que ahorró algo de dinero y decidió poner un negocio de Venta de bebidas como jugos, colas y helados. Su trabajo lo realiza en horario de 8:00 a 6:00 pm sin ayuda ya que sys hijos son mayores de edad  y cada cual realizan sus actividades. Lo que mas quiere es ver su casa terminada y por eso solcitará un préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: Obdulia wanted to have a home-based business so that she could watch her children.  She knew how to sew but that activity didn’t quite produce enough income so she saved up a bit of money and decided to start selling beverages like juices, colas and ice-cream.  She works from 8am until 6pm without any help because her children are all adults now and each does his own thing.  What she most wants is to see her house finished and this is why she’s asking for a loan to buy building materials to reach this goal.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Palermo

texts.es:
Palermo nació en la ciudad del Ollantaytambo de la provincia del Urubamba (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 30 años de edad. El tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, él vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde realiza sus actividades. El y su familia se dedican a la agricultura ósea siembran papa, zapallo y maíz. El también en sus horas libres trabaja para una agencia de viajes como chofer. Ya son varios  años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. El crédito que requiere Palermo es para comprar abono y semillas. 

El Banco Comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Urubamba (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Palermo, 30, was born in the city of Ollantaytambo in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.  He and his partner have two children.  He's now living in the city of Urubamba where he operates his farming business.  He and his family grow potatoes, pumpkins and maize.  When he's not tending his farm, he works as a driver for a taxi business.  He has operated the farm for several years now and is happy with his progress.  Palermo will use this loan to buy seeds and manure for his farming business.  

The Senor de los Milagros de Urubamba community bank meets every thirty days in the city of Urubamba (Peru).  The region around Cusco is famous for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and for Machu Piccu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for his farming business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 22 años, vive en concubinato con Elvis, con quien tiene una hija: Yeimy, a la que quieren mucho. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana).  Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura. Hace 3 años que comenzó a producir la tierra; en 2 de sus 5 terrenos agrícola, plantó café, los cuales están creciendo sin mayores dificultades, y dentro de poco darán sus primeros granos. Pero consiente que durante todo este tiempo  tiene que generar ingresos, planto plátanos los cuales le proporcionan frutos cada 15 días. También trabaja en la hacienda de la señora María, haciendo matapaleo (proceso de extracción del fruto maduro mediante un palo). Ahora ella desea adquirir un buen capital de trabajo para poder abrir una tienda de comestibles en su localidad, además que comenzará a estudiar cosmetología para abrir en el futuro un salón de belleza y así tener un dinero extra. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde es una secretaría comprometida a cumplir los acuerdos que se tomen en cada reunión. Razón por la cual pagará de manera puntual sus cuotas.  Elizabeth de recibir su apoyo; invertirá en la compra de varias plantitas de café que piensa sembrar en su terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
22-year-old Elizabeth lives with her partner Elvis and the couple have a daughter, Yeimy, who they love very much.  The family live together in their own home which is located in the indigenous community of Kivinaki (in the central Peruvian rainforest).

Elizabeth's main business activity is farming.  She started working the land three years ago.  On two of her five plots of land she planted coffee which is growing without any real problems.  The plants will soon produce their first beans.  However, aware that she needed to make income in the meantime, she also planted bananas which provide her with fruit every two weeks.  In addition, Elizabeth works on María's farm doing 'matapaleo' (a way of harvesting ripe fruit with a stick).  Elizabeth she would currently like to acquire a good amount of working capital so that she can open a food store in her town.  She will also start studying cosmetology so that she can open a beauty salon in the future and make extra money.

Elizabeth belongs to the "Flor de Almendra" community bank and this is her second loan from MFP.  She is the bank's secretary and in charge of ensuring that the agreements that are reached in each meeting are observed.  For this reason, she will make her repayments punctually.  With your support, Elizabeth will invest her money in buying several coffee plants which she plans to grow on her land.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants

loans.name: Nueva Gabriela Group

texts.es:
Éste Banco comunal se llama “Nueva Gabriela” lo conforman 17 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros, pero principalmente al comercio entre los cuales se encuentran diversos negocios como la venta de ropa, puestos de fritura, repostería y preparación de masas y ensaladas. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de La Cisterna, ciudad de Santiago. 
Jimena integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila, sentada en el puesto de al medio y quien usa anteojos. 
Se dedica a preparar y vender comida rápida, entre estas masas, pizzas, pan amasado, sopaipillas, frituras, completos, churrascos y papas fritas. Trabaja en éste rubro desde hace tres años, comenta que le ha ido muy bien en su negocio y ha tenido buena aceptación con su clientela. 
Sus preparaciones las vende en el patio de su casa.
La mercadería la compra en una distribuidora y en la vega (feria de ventas para comerciantes)
Su horario de trabajo es durante los fines de semana. 
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio, entre los cuales dos galones de gas, saco de papas, tomates, paltas, carne y vienesas. 
Las metas en su negocio son establecer su negocio en un local y ubicarlo en su casa, para que también los clientes puedan comer al mesón. Actualmente cuenta con un horno industrial y una freidora. Sin embargo le faltan algunos muebles y materiales de construcción para su local. 
Jimena vive junto a sus dos hijos de 15 y 8 años de edad, ambos estudian.
Las motivaciones de Jimena para continuar con el negocio, son para costear los estudios de su hijo en la escuela de aeronáutica. Por ende sus sueños son seguir pagando los estudios de sus hijos para que sean profesionales. 
Jimena está muy contenta y agradecida con los créditos y servicios brindados por Fondo Esperanza, debido a la oportunidad y ayuda en sus negocios. Además disfruta de las reuniones del Banco comunal y del grupo, ya que también son vecinas y existe una gran confianza. Para ella estas reuniones son un momento de distracción. 
La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
The Nueva Gabriela communal bank is made up of 17 business owners who engage in various lines of work, though principally in retail, including in clothing sales, food stands, pastries, and the preparation of doughs and salads. They all live in La Cisterna, a community located in the south central part of the Santiago metro region. It's a residential and commercial community, though in its early days it was a rural area of large tracts. Nonetheless, with the growth of the population and emergence of greater services, it has become a 100% urban area. 

Jimena, a member of this communal bank group seated in the front row wearing glasses, prepares and sells fast foods, such as fried masa, pizzas, pan amasado (Chilean biscuits), sopapillas, french fries, hot dogs, and barbecued meats. She's been doing this for three years and says that she has been very good with her business, maintaining a good base of customers. She sells her food items from the patio of her house and buys her merchandise from a distributor in the La Vega market to sell on the weekends. With this loan, she will buy merchandise to supply her business with items including propane, potatoes, tomatoes, avocados, meats, and hot dogs. 

Her goals are to better establish her business in her home so that her customers can eat at the counter. Currently, she has an industrial oven and refrigerator. Nonetheless, she is lacking a few pieces of furniture and construction materials for her setup. Jimena lives with her two children of 15 and 18, both of whom are in school. Her inspiration for keeping up her business is to support her son's studies in aeronautics. In brief, her dreams are to go on providing for her children's studies so that they can become professionals. 

Jimena is very happy and thankful for the loans and services provided by Fondo Esperanza [Kiva field partner] to her business. Also, she enjoys the communal bank and group meetings, as they are also neighbors and share a great trust between them. For her these meetings are an opportunity to relax and have some fun.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to supply her business with items including propane, potatoes, tomatoes, avocados, meats, and hot dogs.

loans.name: Selvin Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Selvin Antonio  es soltero, tiene 23 años de edad, esta graduado en nivel medio como bachiller industrial,  se dedica a la tapicería de muebles, inicia este trabajo como operario y hasta el momento lleva 2 años de experiencia.

solicita un préstamo para ampliar su capital de trabajo, para la copa de materiales para tapizar mas muebles y mejorar sus ganancias, espera en el futuro contar con una fabrica de muebles.
texts.en: Selvin Antonio is single, 23 years old and has a degree from an industrial school. He makes a living doing furniture upholstery. He started out as a operator and at the moment has two years of experience. He is requesting the loan to increase his capital so he can purchase materials to upholster more furniture and increase his revenue. In the future he wants to have a furniture factory.

loans.use: to purchase upholstery materials.

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Koeun (pictured here), 66, is a security guard. His wife, Phany, 56, stays at home and does housework. They have been married since 1972 and have four children--two sons and two daughters.  Three of their children are married; two live in a separate home, one still lives in the family home and another is a garment worker. The family is living in a village along National Road Number Three, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Koeun is in the process of building a new house, but has not yet finished it. Koeun has decided to ask for his first loan of $1,200 to complete the construction.

loans.use: to finish building his house.

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en:
Rasela is 27 years old and is married with three children. Rasela owns and operates a business venture, running bingo games. She has four years of experience in this business. Rasela needs a loan of WST 2000 to purchase game prizes. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Rasela joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Rasela's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase game prizes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 43 years old and widowed, with four children.  She owns rental houses, which earn her a living.  She has employed one person in her business.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children.  This is because she has improved her business. 
Mary hopes to build other outlets of her business in the future.  She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to install separate power meters for the rental rooms.

loans.use: To install separate power meters for the rental rooms

loans.name: Alibala

texts.en: Alibala is 56 year-old man who has grown seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 12 years. He is married and has two sons. He usually sells his crops in the central bazaar and to the local vendors. His monthly profit is 250 AZN and he would like to increase it.  His elder son helps him to raise crops and sell them in the bazaar. Alibala applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and new land.

loans.use: to purchase land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es una persona tranquila, optimista y con muchos valores. Miguel tiene 3 hijos, vive en San Gabriel en la Provincia del Carchi al Norte de Ecuador.

Miguel trabaja en la fabricación de puertas de madera, este negocio el empezó hace 15 años, trabajaba por pedidos y poco a poco ha ido incrementando su negocio, este negocio es aquel que le da el sustento para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos y de el, es por eso que realiza el sexto crédito en Fodemi ya que es una persona emprendedora y quiere que su negocio siga creciendo porque al igual sus ingresos serán mejores.

Su sueño es poder contruir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Miguel is a calm, optimistic person with high values.  He has three children and lives in San Gabriel in the province of Carchi in northern Ecuador.

Miguel makes wood doors for a living and started the business 15 years ago.  He works on an order basis and little by little has been able to grow his business, which is his source of income to cover his family's needs.  This is his sixth loan through Fodemi, as he is very enterprising and wants his business to continue growing so he can increase his income.

His dream is to be able to build his own house.

loans.use: To buy wood and materials such as varnish, paint and other items to continue making doors.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Khoni, West Georgia, with his family--which includes his wife, Keso, his 24-year-old son, and his daughter-in-law. All the family members are involved in agricultural activities. They have a milk cow, the milk of which is used for cheese production. The cheese is sold in the local market to dairy-product retailers. Also, the family owns a plot of land with 300 nut trees. Harvested nuts are sold in the local market as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 laris. 

David requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. They will double the amount of cheese produced and sold. It will positively impact the income of the family. With the increased income, the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is married and has six children. She is 37 years old and resides at Dalapang, Ozamis City, Philippines. Mila operates a farming venture. She plants, harvests and sells coconuts and bananas to earn a living. She's been 7 years in this business. Each month, she earns about 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 7,430 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

In 2008, Mila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 53-year-old married man and a father of four children who live with him in Tyre. He has worked as a blacksmith for 37 years. He has a very good reputation, his work is unique, and he is talented in his work.
In 2002 Youssef opened a shop in Tyre. Most of his customers are loyal to him, so his business was not affect by the move. The new shop was larger than the old one, and it was possible for him to expand his business as he had more space for new machines and stock.
Youssef has taken a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua before for buying a new machine, and this reflected positively on both his social and financial situations. Now, Youssef is requesting another loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his iron stock for designing new frames and other decorative items.
Mahmoud wants to keep improving the quality of business and sees working to gain customers' loyalty as the most important part.

loans.use: to buy extra iron to design new frames and other decorative items.

loans.name: Agriphina

texts.en: Agriphina is a 43-year-old married woman. She has four children, whose ages range from 10 years to 19 years. She describes herself to be polite, ambitious, and kind. She operates a retail store where she sells maize, millet, and sorghum and provides services of grinding maize into flour. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a busy and less competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the fluctuating price of maize. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy bags of maize, millet, and sorghum. Agriphina's business goal is to be selling cereals wholesale within five years.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and sorghum for grinding and then selling.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a 20 year old woman , from Sahab Jordan . She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to buy materials to make cheese and yogurt to sell. She wants increase her products and increase her capital . 
Since Majeda is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan .

loans.use: to pay for materials to make cheese and yogurt

loans.name: Jerrilyn

texts.en: Jerrilyn lives a simple life with her family in a town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines. She is a 38-year-old woman and a mother of four children; they are 11, 10, 6 and 1- year-old. She and her husband earn a living through fishing. They have been doing this for 12 years since they started their married life. They also work together to provide the needs of their family. Thus, she is asking for a bigger amount of loans to repair their fishing boat and buy fishing nets to enhance their catch. Additionally, Jerrilyn is a woman who dreams for her family a comfortable means of living and their children a better education.

loans.use: to repair their fishing boat and buy fishing nets

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is a blacksmith who makes gates, metal doors and windows. This is the second loan his is seeking from Kiva and Mifex. He was extremely satisfied with the results from the first loan in the amount of $300 received in May 2006. He invested in metal materials that allowed him to work much more quickly and efficiently. His repayments were on time and he proved to be a very responsible borrower. His family testifies to the success of the loan as they have seen a significant increase in income and improvement in their quality of life. Manuel is anxious to receive a larger loan so that he can scale his operation. He no longer wants to bring in clients just on references. His goal is to create a large inventory of his products to display in front of his home in order to attract new customers. He currently runs his operation in his backyard but his long-term goal is to open a workshop outside of his home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in materials for his metal workshop

loans.name: Immiélé Afiavi

texts.en:
Mrs. Immiélé Afiavi A. was born in 1946 in Aného. She is a retired public servant, married with three (03) children. After her retirement, she started a small business and opened a store selling basic need goods in Nukafu. She had the misfortunte of losing her husband, which forced her to face the household expenses by herself. She managed only because of her business, since her pension was not paid regularly.

Thus, to expand her business, she is asking for a loan of $600, which she will use to buy basic need goods (soap, detergent, milk, food, and canned goods...).

She is a very experienced woman and a very good manager who deserves to be supported.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Immiélé Afiavi A. est née en 1946 à Aného. Elle est une retraitée de la fonction publique, mariée et mère de trois enfants. Après sa retraite, elle entreprit un petit commerce et ouvrit une boutique de vente de produits de première nécessité à Nukafu. Elle eut le malheur de perdre son mari l’obligeant à faire face seule aux charges familiale. Elle n’eut son salut qu’à son commerce, les pensions n’étant pas payées régulièrement.

Ainsi pour accroître son activité commerciale, elle sollicite un financement de $600 qu’elle compte utiliser pour l’achat des marchandises de premières nécessités (savon, détergent, lait, les aliments en boîtes de conserve…).

C’est une femme très expérimentée et une très bonne gestionnaire qui a besoin d’être appuyée.

loans.use: To sell basic need goods

loans.name: Enedina

texts.en:
Ms. Enedina is originally from the town of San Nicolás de los Garza in the state of Nuevo León. She works making handicrafts and cushions, a skill which she has learned through taking various classes. Enedina's skill and talent have helped her get ahead in this business. She is the single mother of one small daughter and wants to give her all the best, which is her motivation for working so hard day after day.

In order to continue in her business, Enedina requires a variety of materials to meet the requests of all her customers. She needs a loan of $250.00, which she promises to repay over a period of 3 to 6 months. The growth of this business is in your hands, and so is the well-being of this family. Enedina and her daughter thank you sincerely for your care and collaboration.

loans.use: To buy supplies

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro I. S. lives in Canutillo with his wife Mariledas. Pedro owns the Peluquería Pepe, a barber shop that he built with a previous loan from Esperanza. With this loan, Pedro will renovate and better equip his shop, improving its structure and interior and purchasing tools and materials. Pedro and Mariledas's four children: Rosangelica (11), Pedro Juan (8), Pedro Miguel (7), and Vladimir (6) attend school locally. Like most Dominican boys his age, Pedro Juan dreams of playing baseball professionally. Rosangelica has a dream of her own: she aspires to be an architect.

Note: Pedro is one of five microentrepreneurs in his Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $1000 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. As soon as Pedro pays off his current loan with Esperanza, this loan will become active.

loans.use: Renovate and equip shop

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
Francisco M. is 60 years old, father of 3. He was born in Mafuiane and raised by his parents. His family’s financial situation only allowed him to study until the 6th grade. Since Francisco was a teenager he has been working on machambas (small agricultural fields). Francisco was introduced to HLUVUKU-ADSEMA by his daughter. There he requested his first loan with plans to prepare the fields and buy seeds to diversify and increase his production. Francisco’s business if close to his community because it generates employment for 3 people, including Francisco himself. With the income from the Machambas Francisco supports his family, sends his children to school and takes care of his younger grandchildren. Francisco has 17 cows, and 11 goats.

With the loan of 17.000.00MT, Francisco plans on buying seeds and fetilizers in oder to increase his cultivation area from 4 to 10 hectares. He also plans to increase the volume of his production of couve, repolho (cabbage), potatoes, carrots, lettuce, peppers, corn and onions to keep up with demand.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao: Mafuiane - Boane Cliente: Francisco M. Sector de actividade: Agro-pecuaria Valor de empréstimo: 17.000,00 MT ( 680.00US$) Aplicação de montante: Compra de insumos agricolas e fertilizantes Inicio: 30/08/2007 Fim: 31/12/2008

Francisco M., de 60 anos de idade, natural de Mafuiane, pai de 3 filhos, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos pais, as condições financeiras permitiram-lhe estudar ate 6 classe. Desde a adolescência assume na integra a gestão de duas machambas com sistema de regadio. Através da sua filha soube da existência da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, tendo solicitado um empréstimo para pagamento de preparação de terreno e compra de semente como forma de aumentar a produção e diversificar os vegetais. A sua actividade esta bem inserida na comunidade, providencia emprego para 3 trabalhadores, incluindo ele proprio, com os rendimentos da machamba suporta os encargos da família, a educação dos filhos, despesas de saúde e cuida dos netos menores. Conta com 17 cabeças de gado bovino e 11 cabeças de gado caprino.

Com o empréstimo de 17.000 00Mtn pretende comprar mais sementes, lavrar mais terras de forma aumentar o volume de produção de culturas de rendimento como (couve, repolho, batata reno, cenoura, alface, pimenta, milho, cebola) e como forma de satisfazer a procura. Tem como perspectiva aumentar as areas de cultivo de 4 para 10 ha.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizes

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther E. is dedicated to her business. She buys Soup Things from the village and sells them to people in the City. She has been with LAPO for the past 8 years now. She is married with seven children and is 52 years old. She lives in Benin City and has been in business since1987. She is requesting a loan of $675 to buy more Soup Things to sell.

loans.use: Esther would like to buy more Soup Things to sell.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Doña Concepcion sells fruits such as bananas, oranges, pineapple, papaya, in addition to sodas, juices, water, candy, cookies, cigarettes, etc.

She has been working in this business for 9 years and remembers how she started with US$11 of her own money when she found herself alone after separating from her husband. The need to support her 3 children motivated her to look for a way to make money to be able to guarantee food and education for the children. She started selling in the streets, door to door, but thanks to the help she has received in loans, she was able to establish herself in the central market of Leon. She started investing in the business and she has seen she has achieves financial stability and growth little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Doña Concepcion vende frutas como bananos, naranjas, piña, papaya, ademas de gaseosas, jugos, agua, caramelos, galletas, cigarrillos....etc.

Lleva 9 años de tener este negocio y recuerda que comenzo con 11 dólares, de dinero propio, al quedarse sola por la separacion de su esposo y la necesidad de mantener a sus 3 hijos la indujo a buscar una manera de ganarse el dinero para poder asegurar la comida y educacion para los niños. Comenó vendiendo en la calle de puerta a puerta pero gracias a la ayuda que ha recibido con los créditos, consiguió establecerse en el Mercado Central de Leon, comenzó poco a poco a invertir en el negocio y ha visto que ha logrado estabilidad y crecimiento económico poco a poco.

loans.use: working capital; buying fruits (Capital de Trabajo, compra de frutas)

loans.name: David

texts.es:
After his dismissal from his previous job, David decided, with some small savings, to start selling grocery products outside his house. With help from his wife, his business began to grow. In order to move forward and to provide for his son, (he is currently 10 years old, and goes to elementary school), David and his wife want to create savings so that they can consider sending him to university so that he can have better opportunities than they had. Now, David's business is becoming known in his town, but they would like to have a larger inventory since some of the products his customers request, are not available.

This is why David is applying for a loan of $ 575 USD, which he's willing to pay back within a period of 6 months. With the money he plans to buy some wholesale goods and some new products so that he can offer a greater variety to his clients. With your help David and his family can move forward and be able to help their child with his education and future career.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Después de que fue despedido David decidió, con unos pequeños ahorros, comenzar a vender productos de abarrotes fuera de su casa. Con la ayuda de él y de su esposa comenzaron a crecer poco a poco su negocio. Para poder sacar adelante a su hijo que actualmente tiene 10 años y va a la primaria, sin embargo David y su esposa desean crearle un ahorro para que pueda estudiar una carrera universitaria para que sea una persona de bien y con mejores posibilidades que ellos. Poco a poco el negocio de David se fue haciendo conocido entre los de su colonia. Sin embargo actualmente no cuentan con tanto repertorio de productos como ellos quisieran. Puesto que sus clientes le solicitan productos que ellos no tienen.

Es por eso que David está solicitando un crédito de US $575 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar mercancía por mayoreo además de poder comprar nuevos productos para tener mayor variedad en su negocio. Con tu ayuda David y su familia podrán salir adelante y podrán ayudar a que su hijo estudie una carrera.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale merchandise and additional products for his grocery business. (Comprar mercancía de mayoreo)

loans.name: Erlinda's Group

texts.en:
Erlinda, Lourdes, and Marisol have been part of the community bank Golondrinas for three, one, and two years, respectively. In their community bank they have learned how to educate their children, how to have a positive relationship with their husbands, and the importance of saving.

Erlinda is 25 years old. She lives with her partner and two children. Erlinda has been selling clothing for one year. Previously, she traveled to various markets around the region buying grains and then selling them in Ayacucho. She decided to start a new business in order to spend more time with her children.

Similarly, Lourdes is 24 and lives with her partner and two children. She sells cellular phones from a stand located in the central plaza of Ayacuhco. Before doing that she sold juices from a cart. She is now able to make more money with her new business.

Marisol is 34 years old. She is married and also has two children. Marisol has been selling clothing for close to 18 months. In addition, she knits alpaca sweaters, which she sends to an intermediary in Lima.

Erlinda, Lourdes, and Marisol need loans of 800, 800, and 1000 soles (3 soles = about $1), which they will use to invest in buying pants, sweaters, shirts, underwear, jackets, and cell phones for their businesses.

Erlinda, Lourdes, and Marisol are all saving to buy a house and a piece of land. Their dreams are to own a clothing store, continue to develop their businesses, and give their children a good education.

loans.use: To buy pants, sweaters, shirts, underwear, jackets, and cell phones to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is an associate of the community bank “Sumacc Huayta”, which means Beautiful Flowers in Quechua. She has belonged to the bank for two years, and in that time she has learned about respect and how to save.

Ruth is 48 years old. Ruth and her brothers are all artisans. They learned how to make silver jewelry from their parents, who were considered top teachers. They make beautiful items such as earrings, rings, and necklaces. Ruth travels to different markets both locally and nationally to sell their merchandise.

Ruth needs a loan of 2400 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying silver and gold.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Ruth plans to use her savings to buy stones to use for jewelry. Her dream is to continue progressing forward and developing her business.

loans.use: To invest in buying silver and gold.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is thirty-six years old and she is not married. She has no child. Hawa has been selling peanuts, rice, beans, etc. for ten years now in the open-air market place.

Hawa travels to Takyiman which is in the northern part of the country to buy her products. To enable her do active business, she has employed an assistant to sell the products when she travels.

Hawa wants to use her new loan to stock more bags of peanuts, rice, and beans to prevent price hikes during the lean season from affecting her profits.

She is a happy member of the group “Nyame Aseda” (meaning God’s Thanksgiving). The group exerts peer pressure on members to re-pay their loan from Sinapi.

In the photo, Hawa displays her products in the market.

loans.use: To buy more bags of peanuts, bags of rice, and bags of beans

loans.name: Kibua's Jiliwaze Group

texts.en:
Kibua is single woman with 3 children, ages 9, 7, and 2 years old. Kibua owns a small beauty salon, which she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Asha and Antoneta, who have businesses in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more salon items for her business.

loans.name: Aziza Lubiki's Tupendane B Group

texts.en:
Aziza L., age 38, is married with two children (ages 18 and 16). She sells clothes from a shop that she opened three years ago. She works from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around $254.

Aziza has taken out one previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business capital. She hopes for a new loan to increase her inventory. Aziza will share this loan with her loan group Tupendane B, which totals 15 members.

In the picture Aziza is fourth from the left in the front row.

loans.use: to increase inventory

loans.name: Comité Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.en:
This group was formed in July of 2006. The group contact is Jorgelina López de Valdez, who learned about the Foundation and the program thanks to members of the group “Enterprising Women of Mbachio-Lambare.” The group has 17 members of the neighborhoods Mbachio, San Roque and San Antonio in the city of Lambaré.

This system of credit helps the women know each other as more than just neighbors – as friends. They sell items such as chicken, hamburgers, and sausage in order to raise petty cash together as a group. They are in solidarity with one another.

These women have different types of businesses like grocery stores, small restaurants, clothing sales, home product sales, liquor stores, kiosks, and others. Now, they are requesting a new loan in order to invest in their business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for their business, such as clothing, lingerie, ingredients for meals, jewelry, and other stuff

loans.name: Ton

texts.en:
Mrs. Ton K. is a farmer in Sya Village in Kampong Speu Province. She cultivates her land twice a year on her plantation. During the rainy season, she cultivates rice. She grows other crops during dry season. Her husband, Mr. Rim Phan, collects palm juice to process into palm sugar. He also breeds pigs. Additionally he helps his wife on the rice field when he has free time.

Mrs. Ton K. now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy a new cow to help the old cow that now plows her field. Thus, she has asked for a loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Ton K. is 48 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Ton K. obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding. She fully paid back the loan. Last year, her husband got sick and Mrs. Ton K. had unforeseen expenses to take care of him. This is the reason Mrs. Ton K. does not have enough money to buy a cow to plow her field. Mrs. Ton K. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow to assist the old cow that now plows her rice field.

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants, dame V. Amah est née le 17 septembre 1960 dans le village de Tchékpo-Dédékpoè. Depuis qu’elle s’est installée à Agoè à Lomé, elle exerce le commerce de céréales et a crée une cabine téléphonique afin de pouvoir servir tous ces clients. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a fait un prompt remboursement.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de refaire son stock de céréales par l’achat de deux (2) sacs de maïs et d’un sac du haricot. Ce renouvellement de stock lui permettra de bien de vendre et de gagner beaucoup de revenus.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 4 children, Mrs. Amah V. was born on September 17, 1960 in the village of Tchékpo-Dédékpoè. Ever since she came to live in Agoè in Lomé, elle has been selling cereals and has opened a telephone booth so that she can serve lots of customers. She has received one loan already and reimbursed it promptly.

This second loan that she is requesting will permit her to replenish her stocks of cereals by buying 2 sacks of corn and 1 sack of dried beans. This replenishment of her inventory will allow her to increase her sales and earn a lot more income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a large stock of goods to replenish her small grocery store.

loans.name: Rabia's Group

texts.en:
Rabia baji is the wife of M. A. and lives in a small area named Bund road of City Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last 22 years. She completed her education until the 10th standard. She is the mother of three children: one son and two daughters. None of her children goes to school. Rabia baji’s husband is a shoemaker and sells those pairs in a shoe shop and different markets. He has been in this business for the last 27 years. Rabia baji herself is a housewife but she also sews clothes for her neighbors and earns a profit. She is applying for a loan to buy material (leather, glue, and shoelaces) for her husband so that he able to make more pairs of shoes and increase the profit.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sania baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread, clothes and pattenrs) for her decorative embroidery business. Khalida baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell. Irshad baji wants a loan to repair her "pick-up” which she uses for loading vegetables and fruits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material to make pair of shoes

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos tiene 49 años de edad es cadete de un taxi de las cinco de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde ya que trabajan  por turnos, pero también se dedica en sus horas libres a la venta de carne de res, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Sabana Grande, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 6,12 y 16 años de edad, los tres están estudiando, y se los cuida su mama ya que ella trabaja en un almacén para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia ya que tienen que recoger el abono de Afodenic que ha sido de mucho beneficios para lograr sus objetivos pues con esta solicitud es la tercera y la quiere para hacer un sumidero  en su casa, y  así estar mas higiénico.
texts.en:
Carlos is 49 years old and he is a taxi driver, working a shift from 5a.m. until 2pm. In his spare time he sells beef meat. He lives in a region of the capital city of Managua called Sabana Grande. His wife has given him three children of 6, 12, and 16 years of age. All three are attending school and he takes care of them while she's away at work in a warehouse. She works so that she can help her husband with the family expenses. Loans they have acquired from Afodenic have given them a way to meet their objectives. This is their third request for a loan and the funds are destined install a bathroom in their home, to create a more hygenic environment.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia tiene 27 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Se dedica al bordado de mandiles, lo cual inició hace 3 años, gracias al apoyo de su pareja, y desde entonces ha elaborado hermosos mandiles de diversos colores y diseños, los cuales son muy requeridos por sus vecinos y amistades. Para Celia el bordar es una gran habilidad que pudo desarrollar gracias a su madre, quien le enseñó todo lo necesario y por ser de gran demanda en las festividades del pueblo, ella trata de elaborar varios modelos porque sabe que cada uno tiene un precio  muy costoso, pero que las personas los obtienen de  todas maneras. Lo difícil es hilar, porque toma mucho tiempo si se quiere hacer un acabado perfecto. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará materiales, como hilos especiales y adornos que dan brillo a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Celia is 27 years old, married, and lives with her husband and son. For the past 3 years, she has worked embroidering decorative aprons and skirts with the support of her husband. Since she started her business, she has made many beautiful aprons and skirts of various colors and designs which are highly sought after by her neighbors and friends. Celia is a very talented embroiderer, having learned the trade from her mother. During this time of festivals in her village, demand is very high and she tries to make various models since she knows that each is very costly and people will pay high prices for them to get them one way or another. Her main challenge is threading the decorations since it takes a lot of time to add all the perfect finishing touches. This is her first loan from Prisma Microfinance and she will use the money to purchase raw materials like special threads and decorations that add a bit of sparkle to her work.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for embroidery

loans.name: Mrs. Nhor Nao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people in Kouk Sdau village in Kampong Chhnang province have formed a village bank loan and Mrs. Nhor Nao is the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Van Bang, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, they face an obstacle because their field is infertile and they do not have enough money to buy fuel for a pump to water the field. Thus, Mrs. Nhor Nao decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel to support the field. She is 42 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

All the members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loan so they are not required to pay any princiP. on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the princiP. whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel to support the field.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: El señor Juana Alberto Hernández tiene la edad de 45 años,  habita en el barrio San Caralampio ubicado en la Concepción  junto a su esposa es comerciante, ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos los que estudian su primaria; los planes hacia su familia es lograr comprar un terreno para poder hacer la infraestructura de su taller. El desde hace diecinueve años trabaja como mecánico electricista, con sus propios esfuerzos a logrado mantenerlo. El solicita financiamiento para poder incrementar su negocio en la compra de herramientas ya que el negocio tiene  demanda y quiere captar clientes para que un futuro sus hijos se integren a trabajar con él. Para que puedan ser hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Mr. Juana Alberto Hernández is 45 years old, lives in the neighborhood called San Caralampio, in Concepcion, and together with his wife. They are merchants and have two children in their care who study in primary school. Their plan for the family is to be successful in buying a tract of land where they could have the infrastructure for a shop. For 19 years he has worked as a electrical mechanic, and with his own strength has been able to maintain the business. He is asking for finances to be able to improve his business through buying tools that the business demands, and he wants to get more clients so that one day, his children will be able to work alongside him, so they can be good men.

Translated from Spanish by Misty McNally, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools for his mechanic shop

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 43-year-old married man with four children, living in Old Saida, southern Lebanon. He has owned a shop where he manufactures and repairs furniture since 2004. Khaled has 25 years of experience in this industry, and today he is asking for $1,000 in order to buy a sewing machine to increase his profit margin.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy seeds and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Maria Edith

texts.es:
La señora Maria Edith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, vive en el Jr. Sinchi Roca Nº 430, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 44 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que todavía dependen de ella. 

Se inicio con S/. 500.00 motivada por iniciativa propia y con el apoyo de su esposo emprendieron la construcción de ambientes para alquiler mensual de dormitorios, a estudiantes, profesionales que llegan de otros lugares para quedarse a estudiar o trabajar en Tarapoto. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, cuenta con 10 dormitorios

Con el préstamo de S/3,000.00 que cancelara en 06  meses, desea invertir comprando ladrillos, cementos, triplay, para la construcción de mas dormitorios, al fondo de su casa.

Ambos; su esposo y ella, toman las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, en lo personal, se siente más independiente, segura y capaz.

Maria Edith; manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Edith belongs to the Community Bank “Manos Unidas” and lives at number 430, Sinchi Roca Jr., District of Tarapoto, in the Department of San Martin. She is married, 44 years old and is the mother of 2 children, both of whom still depend upon her. She began with 500 Peruvian soles, motivated by her own initiative and with the help of her husband they took it upon themselves to create the right conditions to be able to rent out dormitories on a monthly basis to students and professionals who come from other places to study or work in Tarapoto. Now this business has 10 dormitories. With the loan of 3,000 soles, which will be repaid over 6 months, she wishes to purchase bricks, cement and plywood in order to build more dormitories at the back of her house. Both she and her husband make the decisions about the company’s earnings and, on a personal note, she feels more independent, confident and capable. Maria Edith would like to thank Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow both as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials: cement, bricks and plywood.

loans.name: Daisy Antonia

texts.es: La señora Daisy V. M., tiene 43 años de edad, trabaja en la Policía Nacional desde hace seis años, tiene tres hijos de 22, 18 y 25 años de edad, dos están independiente y el menor estudia. Este es el séptimo crédito en Afodenic el cual se ha beneficiado en lo personal para hacer las mejoras  a su casa, con este crédito lo quiere invertir para construir un muro en la parte de enfrente de la casa para reguardar la seguridad de su familia. A futuro espera poder seguir haciendo las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ms. Daisy V. M. is a 43-year-old woman who has been working for the National Police for six years. She has three children ages 25, 22, and 18, two of whom are independent while the youngest one is in school. This is her first loan with Afodenic, and she has been able to make home improvements with her previous loans. She wants to invest this loan in building a wall in front of her house so that she can safeguard her family. In the future, she hopes to continue making the necessary home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build protective wall

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Roselyn A. O. is a duly appointed Barangay (District) Official as Barangay Secretary of P2 Trigos, located in the highlands of Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married to Eugene O. and blessed with one child. Her husband’s main source of income comes from their corn production and coco land.

With the programs and services of Paglaum MPC, she was privileged enough to obtain our BOLA (Barangay Official Loan Assistance) program several months ago to finance her corn production. Now, she is applying for her 2nd loan of P23,000 to add to her existing money in redeeming their farmland which was pawned to an individual in their barangay.

Her aspiration in life is to give a better education to her child and to improve their quality of living through expansion and full cultivation of their newly redeemed land.

loans.use: To redeem her farmland which was pawned

location.town: Ozamis-P2 Trigos, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Henry's Group

texts.en:
N. Henry is the leader of Namukozi Suubi group in Mityana. He is a hard working man and married with 4 children 3 of whom are in school. Henry is a farmer with matooke, cassava, sweet potatoes and maize plantations for home consumption and for sale as well as being a poultry farmer with 100 broilers and 300 layers. His layers give him between 8 – 10 trays of eggs every day while the broilers are for meat and sold off after every 2 months.
